CtpzXul3NCAQMDJbfnGvgQ.text: Fabulous in every way! Amazing food, wonderful experience. Ken was the best!!! I was a little nervous at first, but it was totally above and beyond expectations!

9JKPKrhMPMBpNQiUZFrFlA.text: My wife and I had a phenomenal experience at this plant based restaurant. Our server, Willy, was what took this experience from great to exceptional.

Kd_FzX2Ys0EYB5Soa6pW2Q.text: Terrible food. I knew it was vegan...yes vegan not vegetarian..... $70 a person for a $5 a person meal. Poorly balanced meal lacking in texture and taste. Way too many vinegar based dishes. Don't bother. We are foodies that love our veggies and this place was awful. Not to mention the very awkward waitress and dirty dishes I could feel. Fun to eat in the dark but gross food.

tl-oCuI8yh98HNCKSrashA.text: This was an amazing experience and the food was good. We came to find out it was vegan which was awesome! The bonus at the end was very much appreciated. If you're looking for a unique date night I highly recommend it!

prLHMuuz6-5V0jQk7M4b6w.text: The experience itself was pretty great for our group.  The lobby and restrooms were clean and inviting, along with the thoughtful lockers to store your belongings.  The service was great is so far as attitude, explanations, and friendliness from the staff.  However, each course was served much too slowly and we had to ASK for the next course repeatedly.  This is not acceptable in multi-course dining.  A guest should also never have to wait for drink re-fills.  This is Restaurant 101.  The environment is loud (which is fine) and if somebody starts a silly song or chant (i.e. Marco / Polo), everybody loudly participates for some good fun.  It's a safe environment and the waiters are very attentive to guests in the dark environment.  The food was average, at best, much like the other diners mention.  The experience is what you are paying for, definitely not quality food.  The dishes weren't bland or bad by any means, but none were "excellent."  As it stands, the place is surely over-priced (almost $70 per guest) since the food quality and speed of service were quite subpar.    They need to work on speed of service and food quality and they could easily be 4 or 5 stars and justify the high price-tag.  P.S.  It was also disappointing to have a group behind us using the flashlight on their phone which kind of destroyed the experience for us.  That group should have been immediately ejected.

pn_OhOyl9cXodvLGAKoheg.text: This was truly a unique and exciting dining experience. My husband and I stumbled upon this restaurant while searching for interesting vegan dining options in Vegas, and it did not disappoint. Everything we tasted during our 4 course lunch was delicious, and it was so entertaining trying to determine what we were eating based on the various textures, smells and flavors.  Sam at the front desk was very nice and helped prepare us for the for the journey ahead. Our waiter Ken made us feel very comfortable and was very attentive, which made the experience that much more enjoyable. Whether you subscribe to a plant based diet or not, this restaurant is certainly worth looking into.

kKJRrScMF5uQv8OADMy83Q.text: Amazing fun experience to do with a group.  Must be open minded. Service was great, food was good, but drinks were mediocre.  The food is plant based, so don't expect a big steak. You'll end up pretty full though. I had so much fun, except for the terrible hangover from drinking low quality vodka.

zbNIuXY2bAbvifqQMnYWaA.text: Amazing experience!! You adapt really quickly and before you know its natural! Great food and the conversations you have are great! Our server was really fun.

op35tv-G2mBy5N5GP_HQkg.text: WARNING: THERE IS NO MEAT.  Okay, this is a very mixed review for me. First let me start by saying the employees are absolutely wonderful, and the customer service we received far surpassed all expecations and made the experience an incredibly enjoyable evening.   Next on the review was the experience itself, for something as simple as eating in the dark it was  actually really fun, unique, and everyone in my party had a really great time. They make you lock your phone(and anything else that creates light) up in a locker, which is really cool and lets you enjoy the people you are with. The only real way to describe it, is that it is an experience like none other you have ever tried.   Now for the cons and it falls in the most important section of a restaurant, the food. Heres where everything went very downhill for me very quickly and, why I most likely will not be returning. Apparently their entire menu is all Vegan/Vegetarian, which I was unaware of, because it is not posted anywhere in the location, on the advertisement I saw, and the website that led me to the restaurant had no indication. I ended up paying somewhere between $70-$80 with tip, for the six courses on the weekend. Every plate that came out I was expecting meat, and one after another it was just more vegetables and vegan food. Super dissapointing to pay that much and get food that you really did not like, because you have no choice since its a predetermined selection. I did not feel like the food was worth the money and 3/5 people in our party left hungry, and we had to go get food somewhere else after already paying $70 each.  For that cost you could go to the Bachannal Buffet, Texas de Brazil, and many other higher end restaurants in the city, where you would get a much better bang for your buck in terms of selection, and leaving satisfied.   Overall, to sum everything up the customer service was above and beyond, and the experience itself is really fun, and unique. But coupled with the lack of meat and food variety, it makes for a very overpriced night which left us hungry, and upset that we paid that much for essentially some plants and sauces. I wouldnt be nearly as upset if it was noted in the restaurant somewhere before we sat down. Because we would have just left and gone somewhere else, prior to even getting a table.

Xptq50PuSn51ILaUAezzUQ.text: A very cool experience. Six course meal - all vegetarian with plant based proteins. The dining room was pitch black. I would recommend this for anyone wanting to try something different.

GyAZQOFP8vDCjz4mnPDidw.text: I went there recently with my family for my 21st birthday and what an experience! Our waiter was named Cory and he was the best!! super funny and kind! Overall great experience thanks to Cory!! Really recommend people try this out!

3ByUddU8Meue9brE6mpMXw.text: Really liked the concept and the service was great. Loved their music selection. I just can't say I enjoyed the food. I knew it was vegan going in and wasn't concerned, but this was just... gross. If you like stereotypical vegan food and a lot of bitter tastes, this is the place for you. I would have gladly returned since the experience itself is so neat, but I can't justify paying the prices for food I simply don't enjoy.

swyTjHw4xmtcg8AnU8JwsA.text: Amazing and fun experience. I felt first a bit worried about my dress to be messed. The hostesses were very kind and have me an apron to cover my shirt. My server DANI was fantastic and very thorough about the whole process from A through Z. I never experienced eating on total darkness but especially when dressing well. I will come back again with more friends.

gvPD-oGcaaPQdWsYTfSw7w.text: The experience was extremely fun. The food was great. I would recommend this dinner experience for anyone. We took my 73yr old mother in law for her birthday and she had a great time. Don't be put off by the lack of cars (everyone Uber's) and the odd store front for a restaurant. You won't regret it.

VJZch5vrlEOnhQI6hKH_lQ.text: We have have done this sort of thing before and really enjoyed it . When we heard it was coming to Vegas , we knew we had to give it a go and with a 6 course menu for under 70 bucks it sounded like a complete bargain! What they don't tell you though- is that most the courses are very very small and it's all vegan. Yes you right that right - 100% vegan. Why they are not totally up front about this I don't know ... probably because they figure it would put people off. The food was bland, boring and not worth even half what we paid. Plus we were still hungry afterwards. Such a disappointment.

BkVsqXJQyrONmHO4wWofIQ.text: I've been to a lot of great restaurants in Las Vegas, this is my new favorite! What a fun dining experience. Our waiter, Anthony was great! The food was delicious and the experience was amazing! I loved this so much.

7q1Ofd13llyY-EzwDtetPA.text: Loved the concept, unfortunately the culinary execution left a lot to be desired.  Vegetarian / Vegan food can be great but their flavors and textures were unimaginative.  Service was good but sadly this was probably the worst meal I've had in a restaurant in 2 years.  Like others we found ourselves eating at another restaurant after dropping $250 for dinner.  Hoping honest feedback allows BLACKOUT the opportunity to make the right adjustments before its too late.

PK5AVnK0ehZPr1mwrj8Niw.text: This place was so unique and amazing, I would recommend it to everybody . It is all vegan, and no it's not all salad.  They give you a very wide variety of flavors and just about every single one of them is delicious. The waiters are so friendly and make the experience that much better. If you're up for something weird and a little bit challenging I suggest you going here. Be prepared to have some very sticky fingers.  I am planning on going back here with my friends very soon!

fIQKoPPdO6v1sF4kSuACFg.text: Such an amazing experience! Highly recommend! Ken made our night, with his witty repartee and very descriptive instructions as to our selections, we were much more at ease. The food was really good too...a new take on traditional favs, keeping the menu secret till the very end...so it's a True mystery and adding to the experience. And they ask about any allergies or objections beforehand so they can make adjustments for each guest's preferences!! Not everything will be to everyone's liking, but with six courses (yes, LOTS of food) and a menu that changes every three months, you're bound to come away happy. I know I did.

HVz91yCJvodx1gmpgLRUQw.text: This place is AMAZING! We had Ken as our server. He was the best! Great sense of humor! Very knowledgeable and patient. We forgot to mention allergies and he just rolled with the punches and made sure to take care of us. We would definitely come back here and will ask for Ken when we do!

0fIUBfux0Fw6GOoYaPOBVA.text: Took my girlfriend there with my son for my girlfriends birthday. The place is pitch black as they advertise. Overall, my waiter was nice but the staff in the front seemed a little pushy and stressed out. It seems the experience is they walk you to your table. They set you down and start giving you appetizers. Then you order your main course. My girlfriend felt a little anxiety so we left before we could order our main course. But be warned there is an entry fee. I paid 135.00 for just about 10 mins in this place. If you do this restaurant make sure it's with people who are completely comfortable with this. I wouldn't recommend it as its overpriced and to be honest the entry fee seems like a scam.

3Nt89C5cxXBtT8puMczJlA.text: We've never done anything like this before and thought we'd give it a try.... The food was REALLY delicious but challenging to eat - I mean it is like eating with your eyes closed! Our server KEN did an amazing job telling us exactly WHAT and WHERE everything was ("You have three ball shaped items on the left of the plate."). Ken also paired wines for our seven courses - PERFECTLY! I would do this again with a Groupon cause it was pretty pricey!!

SE-lfltaeGZx6Y-taWAZhA.text: This was a really amazing experience! 10/10 would do again! Our server Rebbeca was beyond amazing, she was so positive, cheery and helpful! Would definitely request her again! It was all beyond extraordinary!

nrhx9LyuPEm78abED0Nwuw.text: My husband and I went here for last minute plans and had an amazing time! Our server was Roscoe and he was a lot of fun! The food was delicious and definitely filled you up! Not being able to see in the dark is quiet a challenge but so worth it. Highly recommend this place to anyone that enjoys fun! We plan to come back the next time we are in town and bring some friends!

hwc1SeZ9KF9Jx9NQG0ZxMw.text: This was so fun!! We came for my husbands birthday just the two of us.  Willie the waiter and Mariah that checked us in were both awesome.  I highly recommend !!  Food was great.  Took a while to get used to but fun and so different.  Would definitely do again!

tTZckIAWk8myAS1bV_dE-w.text: Let me say the singular con first, which has nothing to do with the restaurant or staff, but did impact or experience: there was a drunk set of customers with a fit bit and loud voices. They shined light everywhere and were quite disruptive.   However, the pros far outweighed the con. Priscilla greated us with a smile and walked us through the instructions throughly. We joked around a bit which was pleasent. Kenneth then came and lead us to the table. He gave us a few good blackout puns (we laughed a good bit with him), and guided us through every course perfectly.   My wife and I had a wonderful time trying to guess each dish. We got a few right!! Everything tasted so incredible. My wife had a blast foregoing the silverware and just eating all the meals with her hands. Kenneth was very attentive always offering her new napkins. He was very suprised we cleared our plates given the generous portions.   I highly highly recommend eating here. I doubt you'll regret it.

gAf8h9Zm-GLcdD7q8yz6og.text: Had a great experience dining with friends.  At first the total darkness gave me some anxiety and then your other senses take over.  Fun place to go with people you're comfortable with!  The food was great!  We went for lunch and it was 5 courses instead of 7 which was plenty.

LDXRV8bY7hn2RfIVW14PuQ.text: Great dining experience! So just as you can guess from the name you are dining in black out conditions. You cannot see anything at all. You mostly eat with your hand so be prepared to try something new. It is all vegan and plant base. Being in the dark really heightened my taste and texture sense. It was fun experiencing food in this way. It is a bit pricey but it's 80$ for a 5 course meal so you are getting what you pay for. Our server korey was an absolute delight. He was hilarious with the jokes and a great server.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4x2RWJfSqnWSaz2H_IjUxA.text: It was a great experience, we were told the menu changed ever few months. Will definitely go back for the next round.

AJ93_tKBUXazFIF75PkGTQ.text: This was such a cool experience! The room is TOTALLY DARK!!!  You can't even see your hands in front of your face! Our waiter, Mike, guided us in 'train style' and made sure we were seated comfortable and knew where everything is on the table in front of us, including the water glass and where he'd place our drink order as well. The food came in 6 courses, each one in an interesting shaped dish and Mike explained each dish 'vaguely' (there's little ball and stick items with sauce underneath' and we ate most of the meal with our fingers. After we came out were able to see the actual menu and we were so surprised as we had not clue but the dishes were tasty and very creative and vegetarian as well. Definitely enjoyed ourselves and would love to go again!

zboE0WVJZ4GEfBu7Ica8Nw.text: We were hesitant to do this but I'm so glad we did. The experience was so cool, the food was 10/10, and the servers were so fun. Totally unique and we'll for sure be back!

86kAfc90TD4yd_NaPsQsLQ.text: The experience is really what you pay for!   Pros:  Our server Willy! Definitely had a great sense of humor and exquisite customer service.  The dark (you have to feel for your food and guess what you're eating and it's fun to speak to people around you!)  THE DESSERT   Servers wear night vision goggles (HOW COOL)  Cons:   7 courses takes too long, and it can get slightly anxiety inducing just sitting there waiting.  The margarita - tasted like it was made with margarita mix. Way too sweet.   The food...I wanted to try flavorful and exciting dishes. Things tasted a little ambiguous? Just veggies with sauce. Some zucchini cut with a spiraled to make it feel like pasta?? Why? I'll have some pasta  Nonetheless I had a great time. Eating in the dark is quite fun when you're not worried about how you look when you eat lol

-G7mThzHKcstyzToqoFlSQ.text: I was worried of how bizarre the food was going to be or if I would knock over my drink on myself...This was such a cool dining experience for sure and it gets you out of your comfort zone. It was fun trying to figure out what you were eating and how to maneuver around your place at the table. The food was great and I highly recommend this experience

Caup4Y2cFBOGaG-QM4ZnHQ.text: This restaurant is amazing ! It starts when you walk in everyone is extremely friendly. The locker area and bath rooms were extremely clean. The servers were friendly, funny and knowledgeable about everything. The food was actually very filling and very tasty. Will recommend to anyone looking for a unique experience with amazing food !

X8M9NBu_aOQe1xRGsZioGQ.text: Awesome experience!  We went on a whim after seeing an advertisement and it was totally worth it.  Our server, Roscoe, was fantastic-- he walked us though our meal and made us feel very comfortable and well taken care of!  The food was very good and they were great about accommodating my husband's allergies.  Would absolutely recommend!  And ask for Roscoe!

kkdAGp2tonJUX3j_Oo6y5Q.text: Terrible reservation at 715 it is 839 and still waiting. Going to miss our show. No where to sit no where to grab a drink. People leaving around us. Everyone aggrevated.

PcshV0hqr8I6C02eDZf-lw.text: My adult son and I had dinner here while in the Las Vegas area. While we were instructed to touch or place hand on shoulder/ back area of the person in front of us to follow our server to our table, I was behind my son and a server slapped my hand off of my son! They would have never done this if the lights had been on. I know it was another server because I could see the red lights on their night vision goggles. How rude! We will never be coming back to this establishment. Thanks

GdmcFUl4wpYOQqEHrUywtw.text: We enjoyed the entire experience. Cory our guide and server was AWESOME!! Food was delicious. We'll definitely be returning. Told several friends about it. We didn't share everything. Thank you for a great night out. Cory your the best!

o-3tGgtvh-COLisERPOmdg.text: This is one of the most unique and fun dining experiences we've ever had. We can't stop talking about it. This is a MUST DO. The food was excellent and the service was perfection. Go!

ifaVbXaVmm1NYowraQDqYA.text: We went for the one year anniversary special but were unpleasantly suprised to be charged an 18% tip on the $80 full price of the meal.  Not cool at all.   On the plus side our waiter was great and we had a fun time.  Food was ok, but limited by vegan menu.  A cool experience for sure.

knjFhvFbVH53yVQ2WTOETQ.text: What an experience..but such a great one! I went for dinner, our server Adam was fantastic and so helpful...which is rare nowadays! Dinner is a 6 course, and Lunch is 4! They change the menu every 3 months. They do have alcohol options!   Let me just explain the process...you check in, fill out a waiver (don't freak out), then you put your items in a free locker. At that time, go to the bathroom before hand, then go back to the counter to get seated. You meet your server, they ask for any food allergies, hold each others shoulder then walk to your seat. The server helps you sit down, shows you with your hands where everything is on the table, and takes your drink order. They bring you all the courses, they cannot explain what you are eating until the end out of respect for the others eating. When you are done, they stand you up, hold each others shoulders then take you out to the room. I recommend bringing sunglasses to protect your eyes. Go get your locker stuff and check out. At that time, you can see what you were eating.  You have to come with an open mind, but omg it is so much fun!  Coming back soon!

yd6OZmFfkgrkKktiQECBUw.text: Initially was super excited to try something new, except as we walked in the dining room conga dance style, I started to question myself.  It was completely dark, NO LIGHTS whatsoever.  As I sat there with my eyes closed wondering why in the hell were my eyes closed, I opened my eyes and relied on my other senses.    Not a vegetarian/vegan; food was amazing!! Flavorful and smelled amazing.  Everything was seasoned to perfection.  I was able to not only enjoy my delicious food but also my lunch date.  No cell phone interruptions!!! Amazing concept for a restaurant.  Thank you for bringing something amazing and affordable to LV.

goDV2CO6uMlLweAl0Iht6A.text: I kinda wanted to give 3 stars but due to the experience being new and exciting eating in the pitch black not having an idea of that you're eating. Feeling around using your hands while hoping for the best. You have no choice but to laugh, smile and enjoy the moment because it's most definitely unique.   I am vegetarian which was nice knowing they were more Vegan based by previous reviews. My friend however wasn't to thrilled about the Vegan base cause he was hoping for the meal to be a bit for filling especially for the price!   Daniel was our waiter which he did great! Good customer service!   Before our meal the lady told us we would be able to see what we ate after we were done. But, when we finished she then apologized and told us she was unable to let us know anything because of a recent menu change. That woulda been nice to know up front.   The food was ok... there wasn't anything I tried that I'm dying to try again (my friend felt the same). Nothing stood out to me as wonderful. Both of us ate everything but the dessert. I love me some sweet sweet desserts which it's extremely rare for me to turn down some sweets but it was way too thick and sweet for our liking.   We would have been ok paying the high price for our meal if it would have tasted better but for the quality of whatever we ate wasn't worth the price. Yet, overall our experience was good. Love the concept!

kmzb6yfqDFBLOaGyUH4XxQ.text: The sewer smell in the lobby needs to be addressed. It's a bad first impression when it's the first smell that greets you when you walk in. I decided to do lunch since it was a little cheaper, and we're going for the "experience" rather than the food. We knew it would be all plant based, no meat... but it was just so underwhelming. I've done the one in LA and it had meat on the menu, so it's interesting why they chose vegetarian. Our waitress was very sweet, and the experience was fun. The food was terrible, especially the overly sweet canned frosting dessert. It was almost $200 with tip (we got drinks) and I wish the food would of been a heck of a lot better.

B0vNxxRyULqG8kA2lOALXg.text: This was the most fun I've ever had eating anywhere! This is a True experience! It's really worth every penny and the food was AMAZING. Our server Rosco was the absolute best. He made us feel comfortable and excited for everything. It's not a matter of if we come back it's WHEN we come back, we will be asking for Rosco again. The only downside is the menu doesn't change for 6 months at a time so we are going to have to wait a while before we come back. But we will be back. :) 10/10 two thumbs up, 5 star review all the way.

gJrNoBPMPz9kll6wcsTziQ.text: Incredible experience! My husband and I went for lunch and we were blown away by every minute! Our server was Daniel and he took such good care of us - I don't want to give too much of the experience away, but I will say that if you go into this with an open mind, you will no doubt have a great time. There is no question that you are dining in the absolute pitch dark, but the music and food actually distracts you from the fact that you can't see!   I did see that some other reviewers were complaining about portion sizes - this was not an issue for my husband or myself! Our portions felt huge and they were so filling! My husband is 6'4" and is not a slender man, so if he left full, everyone else should too! There also seemed to be concerns about the vegan/vegetarian menu options... if you want a steak, go to a steakhouse. These are unique and flavorful dishes that go beyond what the average palette is accommodated to. Don't let the lack of meat dissuade you; live a little and enjoy the food as it is all handmade and fresh, not the frozen overproduced meat products that you can expect even at the finest of steakhouses (and trust me, I love a good steak just as much as the next guy, but this was next level!).  Recommended for special occasions as this experience is a bit on the pricey side, but worth every dollar! Also, their menu changes seasonally so there's opportunity to go back time and time again. We can't wait to go back and bring more people with us! Oh, and the 20% local discount is great!!!

UKRoWPH16HnIKkLGea7ZCg.text: We went here for a girlfriend's birthday with a group of 12 women. It was such a surreal experience and is something I will never forget. Our meal was delicious, our server was fantastic, and the experience was like nothing else.   Definitely recommend everyone to try at least once.

V4B8Ab2n0P2kET7eh9BHrg.text: I took my husband and brother and I didn't tell them anything about the restaurant. They were hesitant once we got there. However, once inside it was the most  unique  experience! Our waiter Tiki made it unforgettable! The food was AMAZING! This is a must try when you're in Vegas!

JBBxYm-QrytJL-NBqkATcw.text: This restaurant is a must for everyone! The food and server (Tiki) was a 10 out of 10. It was hard eating in the dark but you make it work! The menu changes every 3 months so we will be back.

vcX51CGAbszpzfV-v5dxJg.text: My 9 year-old son and I had a really fun dinner here. The eating adventure and mysteriousness made this a great experience for my child. He thought it was really cool. This restaurant would be great for a date too - try giving a kiss in pitch black - it's hilarious and not as easy as you'd think!   Anthony, our sever, was incredible! He was so funny and entertaining that I felt like we were old friends! The owner, Rachel, is very welcoming and kind. She made everyone feel like family.   Don't skip out on dining at Blackout while you're in town visiting or for the locals who are looking for a new and fun adventure. It is like nothing I've ever experienced before and so glad this restaurant is in our town!

U1O4eI4MXt2HmTK3Cbda8w.text: BEWARE when booking!  This looked and sounded like an awesome place, but beware of the credit card charges if you aren't able to go. A large group of us attempted to fly to Vegas to celebrate my husband's birthday on 2/21, during the big Vegas snowstorm! Unfortunately several couples experienced cancelled flights and the remainder of our group experienced flight delays. I called from the airport to inform them that we needed to cancel as a result. I would've expected their response to be much more understanding, as who would've thought there would be snow and cancelled/delayed flights into Vegas. The response I received was basically I'm sorry but we'll be charging your card $150 since you guys can't make it.  I get it that businesses need to secure reservations but I'm appalled that there was such a lack of understanding considering the situation was unavoidable and out of my control.  I was really looking forward to the experience but considering their response, I unfortunately will never try to go again when visiting Vegas.

jJs3xbGZN51QjRpg4kitJg.text: I was so  nervous about this experience, but our server, Roscoe was absolutely amazing!!!!! He made the experience so easy and fun!  The food was really good and the experience was one you won't forget!!!  Ask for Roscoe!!!!

DHN1SqoKTyiCt_ltCRuYyA.text: What an experience! The waiter was hilarious! We invited friends and all had a great time. You seriously can not see your hand in front of your face! Food was really good! Cool thing was they showed us the menu after dinner! Definitely should try this!

C-deLz43VHAYnsXjHFTU4A.text: It was definitely the experience...and a long one too. The reservation and wait was just really horrible as others have said. My boyfriend brought me here as a surprise on Valentine's Day for dinner for a 7:30 pm reservation and I was really excited. We came early at about 6:45 pm just to sign the waivers and to make sure we wouldn't be late. We had to talk to the manager repetitively over the course of the night and by the time we were seated it was 8:45 pm. At this point we really didn't want to eat here and pay for the price but if you leave they charge you I think it was $80 a person, something around that. Everyone waiting was extremely unhappy and it was just not the kind of experience you'd want to pay for but they have you locked in with that fee. Not to mention with that many people there, the room was too small to accommodate as well, the guests were cramped with no where to even sit to wait considering the wait time. I understand it's Valentine's Day but if you have a reservation at 7:30 p.m., it's a 7:30 p.m.  reservation...and you shouldn't have to wait till 8:45 to be seated. A few minutes maybe 15 after is understood....but not over an hour!!! The management & staff poorly dealt with the situation, they would keep saying "30 mins" "45 mins" when it was already our time to be seated, they also said the reservation time is what they base it off of (still doesn't make up for the wait that was over an hour for a RESERVATION). If you cannot handle making reservations maybe it should be just a walk-in basis restaurant only. They told us they were taking guests that were "late" to their reservation because of the weather....I'm just not buying that, if you're late, you're late. Taking the late guests just really threw the reservations off by almost an hour+ making everyone extremely upset. Don't take them if they're late, it's that simple. Overall it was disappointing, the manager didn't handle the situation well and it was not worth $80/person. Unsure if we'll be coming back at this point. The only time we were happy that night was when we were finally seated and when we were LEAVING! Had we been seated at 7:30 AND NOT almost 9, the experience wouldn't be so tarnished. Maybe this place is better when the weather isn't their excuse? The food was alright, it's focused more on the experience. I recommend a restaurants on the strip instead, they'll treat their guests much better and you'll be seated on time for your reservation.

za2Rlt7qBOakDpG2Lkn2lA.text: What a unique and fun concept. It was so happy that the kids had to give up their cell phones for dinner since they rarely put them down  The food was interesting and it was perfect for my vegan daughter since every dish is plant based. We laughed and had so much fun even with the invisible people at the surrounding tables. Not sure we would go back regularly but would definitely choose to go back for a special occasion or with out of town guests or other couples. Super different and super fun and our we waiter Willie was truly amazing.

PhAOLgXau5eAOF8fuw7kZA.text: Our waitress Cory was very nice, patient, and accommodating. He also had a great sense of humor making the experience fun!  :) thank you.

70j_CE7Gh50nbMKopD0tVg.text: Such a fun date night or could be super fun group event! Food was good, but the experience was what it is all about! Customer Service was amazing. yNPCenuqV67toKEkzH_kww.text: I have to say I got a little freaked out initially when I was seated. Having no vision takes some getting used to.. that being said our server Willy was PHENOMENAL and I was able to relax and enjoy the full experience. It was date night for me and the boyfriend and it was a success! The food is a mystery until after you eat and was filling and flavorful. My boyfriend and I had a lot of fun guessing the dishes. Apparently we did a good job and guessed a lot of them! From beginning to end it was definitely a sensory experience to remember and all made better by a great sever!   **Tip: if you get a little overwhelmed with the darkness, close your eyes. It feels more natural and helps adjust.. I really didn't open my eyes till the end of my meal.

JGlGyXik_Vh-egXwS9HmbA.text: Just finished my valentines meal there, and I'm not gonna lie I'm disappointed. I love food and am very open to trying new things and the concept is really unique with the whole being in the dark and being plant based. A star for the cool experience, a star for the staff and our waiter Willie and a star for half of the 6 courses. I just thought the food was mediocre. I understand making it a sensory experience with aromas, cool textures and odd plates but overall flavor felt like they were trying to hard. Its a cool experience, but I probably won't be back, not for the price. Nearly $200 (not including gratuity) and the best thing was the drinks and first three courses I feel cheated.

rryC59b94CHQHQCuhFcH0w.text: Amazing dinner and place :) Rebecca was wonderful and loved the service. The food was great and Mariah was the funniest host we ever met!

lGetJldkK_aWw3oPvIiVVg.text: For about a year I've come here with my managers as part of our training program. We loooove the experience. Something about being in the dark really helps everyone come out of their shell. We have always gotten exceptional service, but I gotta give Kory props for being the best waiter we've had to date. Very funny, prompt, and put everyone at ease. Also, the menu they have right now is probably one of my favorites. Main course was delicious! The only negative thing I have to say is that where we were sitting, the music was kind of loud. Made it hard to hear each other. Our group is a little rambunctious though, so we think maybe they turned it up so we wouldn't offend other guests, LOL. Other than that, they knocked it outta the park!

rqZEY6eGijHaG7asEoBFPA.text: Prior to going, I had read that lunch was $50/pp, which seemed expensive, but I was interested in the novelty.  The cost was $60/pp, which was more than I wanted to pay (for said novelty).  But, we were there, so why not.    The hostess wasn't overly friendly, but...shrug.  Our waiter was friendly, but odd.  We shimmied to our table, and took some time to adjust to the pitch black.  While your eyes adjust to the darkness, it never reaches the point of being able to see anything (like you have in dim moonlight), which is of course the intention.  I was glad to have read reviews and the website ahead of time to learn that it's completely vegetarian, else I probably would have been disappointed.  I am also glad we went for lunch, during a somewhat slow time, I would not have appreciated others being in close proximity.  The music was too loud for both my wife and I; being down one sense, you're much more dependent on hearing, which meant you had to speak very loudly to overcome the music.  There were a bunch of giggly people to our right, I'm glad they enjoyed their experience, but on top of combating the music, we were competing with them (to hear each other).  I think it would benefit diners to have sound-dampeners around their eating area, so you can more easily interact with your party (I don't think you'd want complete silence, but a bit quieter music would have been helpful).    The food itself was tasty.  We enjoyed tasting and trying to figure out exactly what we were eating.  After leaving the blackened space, they showed us the menu, but I got sushed by the hostess when talking with my wife about a given dish.  I understand not wanting to spoil the menu for others (there was no one else in the lobby), but that really annoyed me.  If you don't want people talking about the menu, have a different exit, or provide a print-out of the menu for guests to take with them.    Circling back to price, $150 for LUNCH for two was more than I wanted to pay, or felt the meal/experience was worth.  While the food was good, it was all vegetarian (soup, mushrooms, chicpeas, toast, polenta).  I can only recommend this as a one-time novelty, and only if you've won at the casino.

0NR-AAK2p1me_et1DchvWw.text: Super fun experience! At first we were a little nervous about not being able to see, but as soon as we sat down, we were comfortable. Music was fun, food was great and I couldn't even tell it was vegan. I was afraid we'd be eating kale the whole time, but nope. Not even once. Waiter was fun and attentive. Never let our wine glasses get empty which was nice. Anyway, if you want to try something fun, try this place. Went during lunch.

lgzsaNjCxXlrmH5cMYLeKg.text: We decided to try dining in the dark on a double date :) The whole experience was fun & interactive. The food was delicious, what a great way to experience food with all your senses. I loved trying to "guess" what we were eating & that I had a nice reason to be able to eat with my hands! We drank plenty of wine & were so full when leaving! Would definitely recommend, apparently the menu is season & changes about every 3 months. It ended up being about $120 a person, but I'd definitely do it again!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What flavor or scent  is this? I don&#39;t know but it&#39;s so yummy.

izKOEDzXI_WbI9ePm6QeOg.text: Have you ever had issue of ordering too much food, feel like your eyes are bigger than your mouth? Well, you will not have that issue at this place!   This is a fun place to hang out with your friends and families. You get to explore and enjoy your food and your surrounding with only four senses. Fun adventure!   Its location is a bit hidden, at the corner of Valley View and Flamingo. Once you pulled into the parking lot, you will find the entrance on the side. They will require you sign a waiver (don't worry, they don't serve anything repulsing or sickening - this is a vegetarian dining place). They will then explain the rule while you are in there such as no standing up, etc. You will be asked to remove any blings attached on your body including smart watch and put it in the locker. No cell phone allowed inside.   The server will then guided you to the dining room. You will not be able to see anything inside, so it is impreative to stay with your server who will guide you to your table. Our server, Anthony was very kind and patient with our group. He explained it all well to us (all first timer). He made sure our drinks were filled up and we enjoyed the food.   There were six courses throughout the dinner experience. I was so full at the end and could not finish my last course before the desert. I thought the food was so so, hence I cannot give it a five stars. Some was good, some was bland. The experience, however, were unique and exciting! I was guessing and visualizing what I was biting...what was the crunch, could it be.... haha that was the guessing game in my mind the whole time I was there.   Overall, we had a blast and would recommend this for a special occasion, birthday, team building, etc. Something you should add to your bucket list.

fSJJ0HZ2nU2RJjYe3sHadA.text: Spend your time and money elsewhere. For $200 I should leave somewhat satisfied and not feel swindled out of my money and like a child tricked into eating their vegetables.  Dinning in the dark starts out like a guessing game of "name that dish" but by the time the main course arrives you're tired of playing games, especially if you're hungry. I know there's a risk that I may not like a dish since it is a "mystery menu" but for $80 a person, the food better be decent. The first dish was good but it was down hill from there. I ordered an Old Fashioned which was just a 50/50 mix of cheap whiskey and water.  At the end they show you the menu that describes their food in the most exaggerated way, using the fanciest words they could find to describe their vegetables. "Surprise, its all vegan!" they tell me, as if they're expecting me to be enlightened into becoming a vegan.   Look, if you're vegan/vegetarian then more power to you, but I don't go around tricking vegans into eating animal products so please don't trick me or anyone else in to eating vegan food. I'm part of the 95% of Americans that are not vegan/vegetarian and I would expect a restaurant that charges so much to cater to the mass majority. If they decide not to cater to the mass majority then they should prominently say so. Their website says "Vegan and Vegetarian options available" but it doesn't say "Vegan/vegetarian only," if this was made apparent then I would have respectfully eaten somewhere else.  The servers were great. If I could, I'd give the service 5 stars and the food 0, but since this is a restaurant the food outweighs the service.   Pros: Great service, clean, and they make sure you're safe when it comes to food allergies (probably).

mB_HEUireHA57FCLvqXLsA.text: Had so much fun tonight!! The experience is a must have! Anthony the waiter .. funniest and most fun person ever! The food was so good! And the drinks ...yumm!! A must go !

RBF5EqxLQKbKQWID0V9NhA.text: The title of the event is explanatory, but my expectations were EXCEEDED! I was excited to try this unique experience, also a bit nervous. I'm normally very conscious of what is on my plate and follow a vegetarian diet, so I was relieved to hear they use a plant based menu! When you check in, they also assess for allergies or other dietary restrictions. So, you arrive at the location in a strip mall and check in. Then, you're given a key to a locker to place all your light-emitting objects: cell phones, even some watches have glowing faces in low light so pack them away. Next, you place your drink order (if you choose), and your server, armed with spy-like night vision goggles, leads you into the PITCH BLACK room. Truly a blackout. After that, it is a whirlwind of 7 courses I've been sworn to secrecy about- but trust me when I say they are delicious and interesting! I was worried that the novelty of eating in the dark would mean the restaurant didn't worry about serving interesting courses, but I was wrong. At the end of the meal you get to see the menu and see how good you were at tasting.   Excellent experience, and I would recommend this to any of my friends, and I'll likely go back if given the chance! Their menu changes a few times a year.

lh3F7t3J_hzTJ8cbvi3PrA.text: This place had great qualities all around which every restaurant should take manage of. This is definitely a 5 stars for the experience. This restaurant is definitely not for a big party but mainly for 2-5 anything above gets hectic. If you get Willie you will have a fun time especially if you talk to him. When you first walk in to this place you will feel scared but you will know your safe after they sit you down and talk to you. Overall this restaurant is a place you should go to annually and not a every day  experience. If you haven't tried this I highly recommend it.

0LtrSa6gMjQvJUk30pdQcg.text: This is by far the most interesting dinning experience of my life hands down.   Coming into a mystery meal, not knowing what you're going to get definitely peaks your curiosity.   The concept you choose your beverage alcohol of coarse and then you choose your flavor sweet, savory or a little bit of both. Then you put your complete trust into your server.   When you are ready to be seated you are  guided into a small introduction room off of the lobby. NO cameras, phones, iwatch or anything that can light up is allowed in the dinning room to ensure the absolute darkness that is expected. They provide each couple or group with a locker to keep all of your belongings safe.  Anyhow you enter first room get briefed and then you are guided by your server into the complete blackout dinning room. All of your other senses starts to take over, smell and sounds are in over time until you sit down your taste gets tested.  Mostly Vegetarian dishes with plays on a lot of spices helps stimulate your taste buds to make you figure out the different flavors you are experiencing.  Do mind the sound for some reason when you can't see you SEEM TO BE SPEAKING A LOT LOUDER. You and everyone else in the room lol!  It was I believe a 5 course meal with an alcoholic beverage to help take off the edge of any anxiety you may have with not being able to see. The whole dinner takes about 2 hours to go through to absorb everything in but you can request to be escorted out for restroom breaks or if you just need a breather.   Oh forgot to mention feel is also a sense that you are encourage to utilize was you are eating your meal. I guess its easier you navigate your food rather then trying to be all proper with your silver wares...or who know what color your spoons and forks were, it was dark lol!  At the end before you are guided out to the main lobby after dinner the server hands the men a rose to present to their date as a surprise.   One of the best date experience ever, bucket list check oh and the owners are so nice! Everyone must try for sure.

UVjQY1sE2L3u_JaeJpM8KA.text: This place is absolutely phenomenal!!! We found it on Groupon and is a steal.  Anthony, our waiter, was very sweet and funny. The food is fantastic and it's a blast trying to guess what everything is with your partner.   The plates are very tactile and separate all the foods, which is very helpful. I used my hands to get a mental picture of what the plate looked like and then use my hands the majority of the time to eat, which is a lot of fun!  Be open to the experience and the food and you'll be golden.

4tmN4oGG_w06p0ObSnv-kg.text: The hostess was friendly & checked us in as soon as we got there, she offered to take our pictures etc.  Our waitress guide, Victoria answered all our questions and concerns we had. Her voice was so angelic, it made the dining experience much more pleasant. Victoria was very informative and guided us throughout the entire time. The dining experience was amazing!! kZymh51GIL9RixdlfoT4Ug.text: My wife and I headed off the strip to enjoy an evening in the dark.  We have been telling about our *dining* experience ever since.  We were treated very well from the moment we walked into the lobby until we left.  I've not had any better service and that's when the servers can see our faces, tables, water glasses and plates.  I will say that the food was interesting and tasty, but not the greatest thing we ever ate.  If you are looking for a dining experience - I'd highly recommend Blackout.

25eNxtNZEQpwguOEQFD6pg.text: All I can say is this experience is a must while in Las Vegas. It is totally worth the price and it is super hush hush about the menu; but if you keep an open mind it is a great date night experince.

HU3lAmxi1-UmF0QvqJ63Ew.text: I gave this review a week of thought before posting it. Bottom line the food was TERRIBLE and like other reviews noted, was served luke warm at best. I predict that this place will be out of business within 6 months if the management doesn't start making changes based on customer feedback and complaints. This is a one and your done type restaurant but terrible food reviews will stop the flow soon. Sounds cool to eat in the dark but no one wants to eat bad food....ever. I really wanted to enjoy this experience with my family but we all walked away wishing we had spent $250 for lunch anyplace else.   Caution: spoiler alert ahead.   We were the only customers when we arrived. You have to fill out lots of personal information on a computer for their waiver... No privacy policy involved so I made up all our details. We were given the choice of viewing preset menu choices or going with the mystery menu and since we were there for the experience we all chose the mystery menu and the "Spicy" entree.  The staff still seemed to be working out the kinks and did not really have the spiel down yet. Bibs were not offered. Water glasses were never brought to our table after several asks. The dinning room was silent and we could hear the staff talking elsewhere. The food was brought out on a noisy food cart and plopped down in front of us without any details offered by the waiter to intrigue you. Lunch had 4 courses. Only one course, the 2nd was decent. None of them complimented the others and seemed to be random. Random may be fun if the food was good but it was not. The first course, a soup of carrot and coconut was watery, a little gritty and barely warm. The second course, 3 corn fritters in sauce was actually good and something to keep on the menu. Our waiter even mentioned that this was the item everyone liked. This should be a hint that management should try and include other menu items people would like. The 3rd course, our spicy entree was a small risotto ball with sauce over limp bell peppers. Not spicy and not much flavor. The texture of the limp and semi warm bell peppers that tasted like day old something was very unacceptable. It was as if it came from a pot that had been sitting out too long. It made me wonder if there was even a chef in the kitchen or if the waiter just scooped premade food into bowls himself. The 4th course, the dessert was a small cup of strawberry mouse with chocolate on top but it was so sickeningly sweet we could not eat it.  Such an odd contrast compared to the bland meal. Sizes were also very small but that did not matter since we did not finish what we were served anyhow.  Once finished we were rushed back to the lobby without the offering of sunglasses as others had mentioned. The check in desk lady was helping another couple that entered and when I asked to see the menu of what we ate she reluctantly handed it to me but sternly told me to make sure I didn't show it to the other people. Yay, okay. Had not planned to.   I get the concept and the likelihood that they will not get repeat customers but this place needs to at least develop a menu that will appeal to the masses, food should be served fresh and hot, music should be played for some ambiance and encourage the wait staff to add to the experience. Tell us what is great about what we are about to eat. Is it a family recipe, is it locally sourced, organic or health benefits, why was it chosen for the menu, why is it special?? You will get more customers if you also serve good food. Listen to the reviews!!!

zJOy810lZA-TIN3_MKQRcQ.text: The whole experience was amazing! Our server Chris was excellent! Everything we ate was delicious. We had a blast trying to figure out the different foods and using our utensils in the dark. Definitely will be back!

foL_F0cjd72X8sHSY6GYwQ.text: I had a blast, the food was excellent and our waiter Christopher was awesome! Great experience I highly recommend

UdAuzVI-WPrnodXALftNUg.text: Pros: The service was great! I really enjoyed our server, the atmosphere, and the overall experience. My friends and I had a blast. I was not sure how I'd feel about the food since I read online it was plant based, but the food was so filling and tasty I could not believe it wasn't meat! We knew the price going into the restaurant.   Cons:   The biggest problem I had with my experience which is why I'm giving it 4 stars is that I think their seating arrangement could be improved. It was not a complete blackout dining experience for me because my chair was facing the door/curtains the servers would enter/exit with the food and I was sooo distracted by the light that was always there due to the curtains. My friends back was to it the whole time and she did not have this problem.  Other minor things: There was an unusual smell in the waiting area. I couldn't quite figure it out but it made me feel like the place wasn't clean or needed a better ventilation system. The waivers they have you fill out auto save your information on their iPads to make it easier if you go again I guess. But if you type your zip code you could accidentally click on someone else's saved info with your same zip code and see their personal info (name, address, phone number).

pkVG9eVDe-M6DxekKZSezg.text: Came out tonight to celebrate my son's 46th Birthday, all I can say Is you have to Experience it for yourself, you will not be disappointed

xCvNjBlYGs2WgA7AQsE1YA.text: Experience was great, fun & entertaining. Our server Roscoe was funny & relatable, he made the time there so rewarding. The food was okay, not a huge fan of the main dish or the dessert. Meal lacked meat, even though it was supposedly in an item it was not easily identifiable overly masked. Would be willing to go during a difference season, if the menu items are different.

8-4PXlKmpwALetXPHccEsg.text: If I could give them 12 stars, I would. This was the single most fantastic experience of my life. I was very apprehensive initially, because I couldn't tell if it was a gimmick or not, but as soon as we met our server, Anthony I knew it'd be a good time.  First and foremost, I think it's awesome that our server could tell we were nervous, and therefor tried to break the tension with comedy. He was actually one of my favorite parts of the night. I appreciate that they inquire about allergies, and went ahead and verified why derivations of my allergies were okay, if any.   Walking in was terrifying, because you go from the light to nothingness. They cushion it with another room that's partially lit, but the absoluteness of darkness was jarring.   Feeling around to try and discover what foods are what was so fun. Our server wouldn't tell us if we were right or not about what we were eating (except for once on accident) but that made it all the more fun when we got out to see what the menu is (sorry guys, no spoilers from me). They also change their menu every three months, so even though the website says they have sweet, savory, and spicy options, there's a new menu that is actually different now that's one menu for everyone (unless your allergens prevent it).   I love that Anthony noticed when I didn't finish something because I didn't like it. And he was actually very worried that I wasn't going to get enough food and offered me more because I skipped a portion (it tasted fine, but I've some texture aversion issues and I couldn't get over the mouthfeel coupled with the fact that I had no clue what I was eating).   You think the courses are too much, they're not. They're perfect! And a pallet cleanser comes in at the perfect time to change the pace. They did a really good job with this. You could sense the chemistry between the employees inside which was also enjoyable to listen to. PLUS, we got a special gift at the end! (I'm not sure if it always happens, or if it's because it's a holiday weekend)I will probably come here every time I visit Vegas just to see the new menu and have the experience again!   Thanks so much guys!!!

fkRezsVUj96sHI1GwSBsNg.text: It was a unique and fun experience dining in the dark. We went there last night for a friend's birthday.   The food was good. I didn't know it was vegan. When my friend invited us to this place. I was kind of scared because I am a picky eater and I like to see what I'm eating. So coming here was an adventure and the experience was wonderful. tj_z120kjzXjAcjCSM-Tig.text: This was one of the most amazing sinning experiences I have ever had. Our waiter Ken, was top notch. From the very beginning he took the time to explain everything  that would happen during this dinning in the dark experience. The food was very good, especially since you really didn't know what you were getting g ready to eat. The deserts were amazing and the wine paring was on point with the foods they were paired with. This is a dining experience like no other and well worth it.

KE4iT9Vm9xI9HMpLJGiO2g.text: Been wanting to check this place out for a while and finally made it today - what a FUN experience!!   Our server Nikki was a rockstar and took fantastic care of us, explained every step of the way and made us feel very welcome and comfortable.  Highly recommend!!

HkZx1LHXP3ARDaG4Sf1tMQ.text: I visited here with a group of 20 people, as part of a Karma International event.  Wow.  So much fun.  Such an amazing experience. It was made even more fun by having such a group of friends. Enjoying the delicious food and drink, and the entire experiential aspect of the dinner, was really really enjoyable, even if you couldn't see me smiling in the dark. :-D  The check-in process required us to sign a waiver and have a short briefing talk.  Then we were led past a couple of curtains and turns, conga line style, to our table.  Sitting down was a challenge when you can't see the people next to you, the chair, or the table, but one that was easily overcome, especially since it's something you've done a few times, likely.   The dishes are not described but are different textures and flavors.  When you're deprived of vision, your other senses are enhanced, and you can curiously consider the scents and tastes before you.  What I liked about all six courses was that the textures were very different and unique.  And very clever in regards to some courses.   The table I was at had only one wine glass spilled, and lots of laughter and guessing.  We joked and teased each other, and had great conversations.   When we were done, we compared notes, talked about favorites, and led each other back into the light.    One note bears emphasizing: The service was absolutely fantastic.  The highest level of service here, with helpful hints for how to eat certain dishes, what to expect from what was on the plate you couldn't see, and refills on water and drinks.  They referred to us by name, which was impressive.    I think this is highly recommended. I can't wait to come back and I hope I do soon.  Really a must try, well done experience for all the senses except for one.

9xgH3X0JZiocthAmSb1GYA.text: A uniquely fun experience. Food wasn't very good.   First, we had a great time at this restaurant. It was fun to rely on other senses. We enjoyed trying to figure out what we were eating.   We were pleased at the end of our meal to see we were mostly correct.   Our server Martha was amazing as she walked us through our service. She did a phenomenal job explaining how to eat what was in front of us. Her tips and tricks were great.  I regret not asking for extra napkins. It seems almost everyone uses their fingers at some point. With all the sauces it became quite messy.   We were disappointed in the food. Vegan restaurants should celebrate plant based foods. Black Out tried to disguise the food with rich sauces, too much salt and sugar.   Keep the concept, improve the food and this restaurant will be amazing.

Ulc52uI-6AvQFsivlHfMuA.text: Willy, our server, served us six courses of great food for almost two hours!! Great fun for our party of four. We enjoyed every bite that we ate. We are going back with a different group as a result of the experience! It's out of our comfort zone and we love it!

JI5GgrSwaMuxLciVKKpoGA.text: We had a great time, great food, great concept!!! Our waiter (Willie) was the absolute best.  Definitely recommend to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great times!!!

DQraJ29nFcxjXCJE09TJxQ.text: After reading the reviews I decided to take my husband here for his birthday.  The service was good, our waiter was great but the experience was terrible.  We were seated in the middle of the restaurant, it was extremely loud. We kept getting bumped and hip checked by waiters that were rushing by. When you can't see, this is a terrible feeling.  The food wasn't very good either. To top it off, they give you sunglasses, after the meal, to help your eyes adjust to the light. I walked into the restroom and realized I couldn't see through the glasses because they were covered in greasy fingerprints. Disgusting!  They then advise you to recycle the glasses in a bin next to the door. They do not clean the glasses before reusing them- at least mine hadn't been cleaned and seemed to have been reissued 100 times. I am thoroughly disappointed by this experience. $250 to yell across the table, get hit by waiters and then instructed to place filthy sunglasses on your face. I need a shower.

y6DKa9dox0C0TPsKUoBIQQ.text: Beginning with the young lady who was our hostess, to Corey (Matthew McConnaughey) our waiter, this restaurant was a fantastic and exciting dining experience. The humor and the personality by Corey was greatly appreciated. He made the potentially awkward dinner in pitch dark, fun and exciting. Thank you for making this experience memorable and fun!

LWBvLbHnqFCSZfQoqLQKug.text: Great service. Willie was super cool. Being blind. I appreciated the theme. Food was good!!c

xqpSwxzMzer3Ox3MzyY41Q.text: I went here with my best friend and her family for her birthday. This review is mostly for the hostess and/or their policy... since it was my friend's birthday, her mom brought lots of individually wrapped and sealed bundt cakes in a bag to share with everyone (to take home at the end of the night). It's Vegas, so it's 112 degrees outside. Because of some kind of "cross contamination" issue, we weren't allowed to bring them in. Ok, I understand. So, I remind the hostess we are in the desert and ask if she could just keep them at her desk for us until we leave. But no, the host said the company was "really proud of their no cross contamination of food policy" and absolutely no food was allowed inside, even in the front lobby where absolutely no food or drink are being served to guests. So we had to ruin a whole bag of (really delicious) little cakes. They have small lockers for people to leave their phones and purses, in retrospect I should have just shoved them in there without telling her. Meanwhile another patron brought a large gift bag that didn't fit in the lockers and the host happily kept it behind her station. Totally wrapped... what if it was food? I almost made a joke about that but didn't want that patron to get screwed too in case it WAS food. Honestly - and this is my fault - I let that stupid interaction ruin my experience because I walked in there pissed off. And blind. Haha. Our server, Ken, was super sweet and fun, he was the only reason we had a good time. To review the actual dining experience: yes it's weird, disorienting and interesting to eat in pitch black darkness. yes the food is vegan or vegetarian - which is fine -  but I only enjoyed two courses out of the seven course meal. Everything else I tasted and immediately spit out and just sat in darkness until the next course was up. Just disappointing. And holy shit... with tax and gratuity it's over $100 a person!! What the hell? I know it's Vegas and absolutely everything is over priced... and I get that you can't serve people steaks in the dark... but one course was literally ritz style crackers with a fake cheese spread. Another reviewer said "I wish we just got fast food and ate it at home with the lights off" and I couldn't agree more.  I'm sorry. I'm still mad about the ruined cakes. Haha. They were so delicious and they were all ruined for no reason. The hostess smiled as she told us "I feel really bad but yes you have to leave them in your car" - omg if it wasn't my friend's birthday I would have just walked out right then.

0yz5tMEZV9TprJ_o8LzzlQ.text: As advertised, you're eating a meal in total darkness. The quarters feel a little cramped and the place isn't terribly comfortable. It felt a little stuffy- not great airflow in general.   The server was very nice and engaging as was the person up front.   The food itself was quite disappointing, especially after reading reviews - it was very salty and greasy; too many flavors trying to be combined. As other reviewers mentioned it is plant based, which is fine with me as I personally followed a vegan diet for many months, but this was not filling food as much as it was just heavy. The dessert was so sweet that I couldn't eat it.   2 stars because for the price it's not worth it, as innovative of a concept as it is. It's not even directly on the strip- it's in an strip mall near the strip, but you're paying as if it's in a prime location. If it was more reasonably priced or if there were some options for the courses I would've given it 3 stars.   I honestly think that the restaurant should consider simpler dishes- stick to protein, starch and veggie as was done for many of the courses but use less seasonings. Or include something like a pasta dish, and explore something like a cashew cream sauce which has an amazing amount of flavor but is still simple. Experiencing the crunchiness, texture, natural flavors of the food would enhance the experience overall.

Kz9Zpfn4XqpUkxJc6IhdFQ.text: First dining in the dark experience. Been in Vegas for almost a year and finally got to try it with the wife.   The entrance is nice and appears pretty cleab. They have lockers for you to store your light emitting devices.The dining room itself was pitch black, dark.   The staff was accommodating and very friendly. Kory was our server and took great care of us. My wife was freaking out within the first 10secs of being in the room. We made it to our table, sat down, and immediately had to get up to step outside because she was panicking a little. The host was able to move our table closer to the entrance to help her fears. Kory was kind enough to lend my wife his NVGs for a minute here and there so she would feel more comfortable, knowing what her surroundings looked like. I doubt I would've been able to try the food if it wasn't your Kory's encouragement and positive reinforcement.   The experience was fun. Nice way to test your pallet and how much you think you know about food. I'm sure you'll get some but not everything (unless you're G. Ramsey). Give it a go, face your fears, try it out.

_I6W1hl-cc-ZgCLYIaDiMA.text: The experience was so fun and cool! It really heightened your senses... BUT the food was awful. Fried everything and extra salt. The smell was pretty bad too.. I wish the food was better because this is such a cool idea!!!

13PZv28K4EWVucE6W3c1_A.text: Unreal!!! What a unique experience and the food was so delicious!! I wasn't sure what to expect and I was so pleased with everything!!

lPA4D4t_kcoVK6d7PCKq3g.text: This place doesn't even deserve 1 star, and to start this review off I just want to say I haven't been on my yelp in a long time so I finally signed back in to write this review to hopefully "be heard" by someone at this establishment because my experience is one for all to be heard due to getting hit with a plate to my nose during my dining. I am not one to write bad reviews in which the day after this issue had happened I immediately wrote a long email to the business and had no response. Enjoy!.... This place was of interest to my brother and the reasoning we went there is because it was both mine and my brothers birthday and we wanted to try something different. We arrived at the restaurant around 8pm on September 30th the night of my birthday and it was myself, my brother and my fiance. Fully excited we were greeted by an individual who was our server and he had just started a couple weeks prior at this place. We entered the restaurant and believe it or not it was an amazing experience to begin with. We started to enjoy our meals and drinks and everything was good up until I was adjusting my chair a little forward (keep in mind he can see us with the night vision goggles he was wearing and we couldn't see anything through the whole meal) I got hit with a plate to the top of my nose! From that point on I was in pain but I didn't want to ruin everyone night so with my hand over my nose I sat there for about 15 minutes while a migraine headache started pulsing. My experience went from great to crappy in that instance because not only did I get hit with a plate, but through the whole time I was at this establishment NO MANAGER came to see if I was ok! This is not what you expect to happen on your birthday. The server then asked if I was ok and offered to comp me a drink for what had happened. With my mouth held shut because I was so upset that through all of this time a manager had not approached the table I told him that it was fine to bring me a drink but not a martini because he had offered that. "He brings me a martini".....I then was fed up with my whole experience that I just asked for the bill. Like really? I literally sat there while all the meals came out and still no manager. We had a show to attend so I figured I would reach out to the restaurant the day after so that I did not miss our show. I walked out to the hostess stand to pay the bill eager to leave this place, and I began to explain what happened hoping someone would get a manager involved but still again no manager around, and to top that off the hostess said it was my fault that I moved my chair and got hit with the plate! At this point, on a $200+ bill I tipped way under 20% and walked out. The next day I woke up with a bump/bruise on my nose, and it was October 1st the day my parents were throwing a birthday party for me and my brother. I wrote a email and waited for a response back.....a couple days went by, nothing from them. As I said in the beginning of my review, I am not one to write a bad review because I feel good customer service and addressing the situation no matter what, will always keep a customer happy no matter the situation to keep the good reviews coming, but not with this place. I then decided before writing a bad review that I would dispute this whole transaction through my credit card company. I also made an attempt a  to contact the restaurant and ask for a manager to speak my mind out since my email I wrote and my credit card company was not giving me any response from the restaurant. I spoke with the manager there "Theresa" twice; the first attempt she listened to what I had to say and apologized but did not do anything as a manager to make sure I was happy. Instead she took my number down and said either her or the owner would call me. A month goes by and the dispute I did with the credit card company comes back not in my favor because the restaurant communicated with my credit card company and proved I ate there and provided them with a receipt. I then re-opened my dispute and fought it again providing the credit card company with the emails I sent to Blackout and explained to them I was not being heard by anyone and that was the most frustrating part. I have the money to pay for my bill, but my experience was unacceptable and with a bad experience the customer needs to be heard!  A couple more weeks went by and I was having no luck still and no-one still had reached out to me. I reached back out to the restaurant and spoke to the "manager" Theresa again, and she said there was nothing she could do she had given my information to the owners and that is all she can do! I asked her "so you being a manager can do nothing to make sure I am happy?" she responded it is not a decision or credit she is authorized to make.  Overall, I didn't want to write this review but I felt the need to be heard by others since this place couldn't reach out to me and make things better to save a customer.

hOzGQ0puJWexHka_rx1HAQ.text: The concept is amazing. I want this to really work. However, the Blackout failed with the kitchen/server curtain light and another odd green light in the corner. The staff and service is amazing but the food is awful. I mean really bad. It was super fun and we laughed the entire time. Our bill was around $430 including tip, a mediocre bottle of Pinot, 2 mediocre cocktails, and a coke. You guys need to up your game. Do better with the food. It's Vegas! We could eaten so much better for less. Get on it. Do well.

2_oQxtYX5YxHeT2UapfgUQ.text: Great atmosphere as cool as you get. Really friendly service. All in all something to remember. DO IT ONCE... food is really not edible. We went with six people and went out for food after as so much was really really bad. We wanted to love it and bring friends back but.. the food was so far below acceptable you wonder what the owner is thinking. We didn't expect gourmet but we did expect passable which it was not .  Truly mixed , go enjoy and make another reservation to eat after you leave

efGrD6r1y50-MuV9SSdcHw.text: DO NOT GO TO THIS  PLACE.  We paid $60 a person to eat in the dark.  The experience was fine, BUT the food was TERRIBLE.  We truly felt disgusted.  The day before we paid $60 for a 3 course meal at Hell's Kitchen.  Your money's better off spent there.  12PM on a Saturday, 80 person restaurant, for the full hour we were there no one else ever showed up.

rzyyvshia-JrMbwMr0IxQw.text: We had lunch here last Sunday with our X New Yorker meetup couples. We wee excited to try this new dining in the dark experience! So your choices are Savory, Spicy or Sweet on the menu - you choose a flavor only. Btw this is a vegetarian menu and only cold drinks. It was very cool being led into total darkness to our table. The first course was two shot glasses of let's say soup to get your taste buds ready. The second course was salad and I had the sweet one. The third course was vegetables and falafels, very tasty but not too sweet! The fourth course was dessert & we all had the same dessert - it was yummy!  That's when I asked for coffee but so far they are not serving hot beverages. After dessert, was all got a really nice surprise! Our server Willy was wonderful! We had a lot of fun & I was full! The price for this 4 course meal in the dark was about $98. Per couple.

_hP4ySCfQ7M68fq34lVJ4Q.text: I think that everyone should experience this at least once. The food was very interesting, especially because you only get to use taste and touch. 7nWmENAUNK2w631v_euVfQ.text: Great experience food is great!!!  Be ready to pay a big price for the experience.  I will definitely say that my sense of smell was very heightened by not being able to see it.  Waiters wear night vision goggles and they guide you the whole way through your meal. You do get used to the dark I would not recommend small children. I can't wait to go again.

d-8Hgy3uzkrzsezowjDP3Q.text: For those that have asked, the Black Out Dining is a unique, DELICIOUS ( plant based) and senses heightening experience. A couple big bonuses too: Taking a quick little nap in between courses and no one notices, Never feeling grossed out by  watching others and their bad dining habits,  And use your imagination because the list goes on... Down falls: Wanting to hold your hubbys hand but having to make sure it IS his hand, Tables were small so you have to be careful about sudden movements (we heard lots of glass breaking-OPA!) Toots and burps , you can't point fingers at anyone in the dark! And it's not great if you like to document your meal with #foodporn pics. Just to give you an example, here are pics of my favorite meal of the dinner and the other is Brian's favorite, both incredibly delicious though!  *ISSUE* Valentine's Day perhap? I did not ding any stars for the horrendous long waits past our reservation time. Many people were refunded and had to leave since the wait is brutal if your starving. They did try and bring around drinks in the lobby to the massive crowd, it was very confusing, but they were attempting to bring some relief to the growingly impatient guests. The food and experience did make us forget all of that!
