OsFfYgCt9siS1y04fEQWdA.text: This is absolutely a once in a lifetime experience. The food is out of this world, I had no idea until after we left that it was vegan!!   Eating in the dark like this absolutely has to be experienced, you're sense of taste changed so much when you can't see.   The service was probably the best part of the experience too, Rebecca was absolutely amazing. She walked us through the entire meal and developed a couple inside jokes with us as the meal went on.   Don't think twice about coming here, just come and try it out. I can't to come again!

-4LacUuNlDGUUS2kypLbIg.text: For a crazy sensory experience...this place doesn't disappoint. Ok here is the breakdown:   Ambiance: you are in COMPLETE darkness for 1.5-2 hours. I'm not in the least bit claustrophobic or paranoid, but I got to say, for the first 10-15minutes your mind plays tricks on you as you're trying to adjust to your pitch black environment.   Food: Everything is plant based, but before you go all "what, no meat"?!? I'm not vegetarian and I got to say, I was very impressed. You are not allowed to reveal or share the menu but even if I try, I don't think I can even recall all the different things your palate comes across. It's a 7-course prix fixe menu. Alcohol is extra and they have a good drink selection.   Cleanliness: N/A because again...completely pitch black.  At the end: you go to the same area you started and wait for your eyes to adjust and then the lobby. They show you the menu with the description and ingredients of what you just ate. They request you keep it a secret and they don't allow pictures of the menu.   The ONLY suggestion I have is that they have a picture next to the menu description of what you ate. Each dish was so unique (Including the plates and dishes themselves) that it would be nice to SEE what you felt and tasted during your meal.

Dz-LIF7um7MQidiNaZiINQ.text: Ok so this will be the unpopular opinion it seems like... But... The food was so bad that I cannot justify giving blackout dinner more than 2 or 3 stars. And no I am not talking about food not being plenty like some other reviews are suggesting - we actually thought there was plenty of food (with the menu that we had at least, it apparently changes so depending on the menu maybe there is less food?) and we were full after our entrees. Honestly, if you are not full, maybe you should feel around your plate a bit more because after all, you're not able to see anything and chances are maybe you're not eating half of the food on your plate! I've overheard some waiters telling their tables how much food they have left and actually interacting/talking with them. Unfortunately we weren't so lucky when it came to our waiter either.   Concept: absolutely very unique, no question about it. Definitely could be worth trying if you're interested. We wouldn't do it a second time and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone I know, unless they have a free ticket to get in.   Service: I think we got absolutely unlucky. Our waiter was really not good and he did the bare minimum. His explanations of what we were about to eat were not good and he made no other conversation with us. We could overhear waiters from other tables who were a lot more into what they were doing and provided better explanations, made conversation, etc. So I think this was a relatively big part of why we did not enjoy our experience, aside from the worst part of course which was...  Food: I get it. I'm not seeing what I'm eating. I get it that this is supposed to be about the experience and not the food. But for $160+ for 2 people I expect at least half decent food. We thought the food was just terrible. Every dish we had except a soup and a salad (and only part of the salad was good, majority of the ingredients were sub-par) was incredibly bland and had no taste. Just because we can't see what we eat doesn't mean the food should be so bad. Maybe it was the menu we had that day that was bad? Who knows. Regardless we were unfortunately completely unimpressed, and we really wanted to love this experience since all the reviews are so positive. I don't want to write too many details about the food since I am unsure how often or how long the same menu is used, but I will also say that our dessert was overly sweet and parts of it were dried out, and the last course also tasted like it had been made days ago and was just dry and didn't taste like anything.  So... The unpopular opinion here is that while the experience is very interesting and may be worth trying, and while the food is plenty, the taste of the food is just not worth the money. If it were mediocre food, I would have still given this place a 4 star or so review, but it was just that bad in our opinion.

4E3uNtyKlef2666Oz_Dn_A.text: Very cool and unique experience!  The food was all very good and the service was A+.  Super friendly and welcoming from hostess to server and they did a great job of verbalizing in detail where everything was located on the table and plate to make the experience manageable and enjoyable.  7 course meal including dessert took about an hour and half which was perfect.  The dishes all had unique tastes and smells to help guesstimate what you were eating and after dining they provide you w a menu to see exactly what it was you had tried. Great way to get people off the phones and into conversation over dining.

Z3jM36NFZ1bl-NBmw31N4A.text: My husband took me here for my birthday and it was amazing! The whole experience was incredible and Rosco was our waiter and he was excellent. He made our experience a lot of fun, great personality.

rIpXQyobzPE_DUhB7_y-FA.text: Today I got experience the best birthday dinner I have ever had in my 22 years of life thanks to Rebecca! At 1st I was a bit nervous for this experiment, but she made it totally fun and cool! Not to mention the best food I've ever had hands down!  The fun part was guessing everything we ate, such a creative menu that offers amazing textures and flavors that where able to fin thanks to our waitresses amazing tips on how to move about the darkness! Thank you again Rebecca, I hope to come beach again next year!

KiZypANHA3PnWO_DlJt8pA.text: Absolutely amazing experience!  Absolutely amazing food! An absolutely amazing server named Anthony! I think this is the best thing ever!  Just go.. go there and eat.

GpwnGcvUgKEQ3LdR39NztA.text: What a cool concept and great experience...Rosco made it awesome!  A new have-to do in Vegas.

YWX4x47pwYtFOVKl-DV6Fg.text: Awes exp to eat gourmet food in complete darkness. Our waiter was great. The food was amazing! You do not find out until the end what you ate so it's fun to try to guess. I highly recommend this experience!

_5EH8d_UTwreYsaWbUcZeA.text: First time ever dining here with my fiance and it was such a wonderful experience. Roscoe was our server and he really made us feel welcome and was just goofy enough about everything to keep us from feeling overwhelmed by the dark. I think it could easily be a bad experience, and the service is the most impactful part since you rely on them so much! The food was quite good, only one of the courses was so out there that we didn't really like it but 6/7 courses is pretty okay with me.   It was pricey, but I do think it was worth it, so check it out!

xDuyW_XFwi1l6-WUm6LsYQ.text: Incredible experience!!! It's totally dark inside and yes your eyes is not going to get used to it.  Highly recommend trying this restaurant. Service was awesome, Anna was funny and has a bubbly personality.  She made us feel so at ease. Food tasted so good.  My favorites are the first and 6th course. Btw, you'll not know what you'll be eating until the end.  This is literally perfect for a Blind Date " Literally"".

yrK1jxlc2bkYwwvr8TAntQ.text: I was extremely interested to try this dining experience once a friend mentioned that it was somewhere in Las Vegas.  Certain types of food that I never thought I would have ordered (after being able to see the menu after the experience) in light was totally delicious "in the dark."  I have a wider palette than I though! I could not believe how delicious the food was, and even the drinks left me wanting more!    This experience and foods hands down was an incredibly unique experience.   My husband thought it would be funny to stay silent when I was whispering if he was there as I got scared in the dark briefly for some reason.  But I eventually calmed down and tried to let my senses take over Daredevil style.  Unfortunately, I could only identify one broad based food, while my husband could identity a few.  But I found myself really enjoying the experience - and the fact that you really get to enjoy the company of those closest to you phone free (you put your personal items in lockers) helped us to discover that we could actually have a conversation without our phones. This could have been the longest time my husband and I have ever been awake without our phones.  We - gasp - survived.   Not only do I have an appreciation for the experience, but I have an appreciation for how much I relied on my other senses and how much I really need to branch out and try other foods cause that food was super delicious!  The best part is, you don't get judged for how much you eat because your company can't see whether you've eaten your entire plate or not!  I destroyed some of those courses!  I also tried to sneak some food off my husband's plate, but I got caught cause he was trying to do the same thing.  Awkward.   In short, the experience is "eye opening."  Also, the waiter Corey is super hilarious!  My husband are I were repeating jokes he said later in the day.  He turned the 5 star food into a 5 star experience as well, and we were very lucky to have him as a waiter.  Even the hostess/greeter at the front when you enter was super friendly, and I just hope they are also reading this and understand what a fantastic time we both had. My husband, who originally didn't care for this experience, had a good time.  My husband, who doesn't like being away from his phone for more than 2 seconds, liked the experience.  He was glad he went.   In short (again), this was way longer than I anticipated. Go now. It'll be about $200-$300 for tip for two people, but totally worth it for an experience no other nearby restaurant has!

aKxzF7id5zFiHAgW1j0XrA.text: So much fun!  It really is pitch black in there except I sat facing the entrance and there was a lot of times where people coming and going and the curtain would be left just a little open so my focus was on that and it was a bit distracting.  I suggest requesting a seat away from the entrance. The food was really good.  The flavors were great, but if you're like me and love meat then you'll be left wanting to have a some texture or flavor of protein.  They use a lot of starch and carbs I think.  It was still good though.  Dessert could be better.  Wasn't impressed with either desserts.  Overall, my fiance and I had a great time.

pAXy6k4v_r4AAR2cauNMxQ.text: Best experience and Roscoe was a great host! It was scary in the beginning to not be able to see but after we were seated roscoe explained each and every detail that was about to happen. And the food was good! I recommend trying when coming to Vegas!

rcgS_UIhEHTSPMfD0Q7t4w.text: This place was such an awesome date night experience! You walk into the lounge and a host greets you. You then sign a waiver and are given a locker to place all of your things. You are briefed by your server who will explain everything in detail about what will occur. Your server has night vision goggles but you are in complete darkness! You follow the server to your table and they explain where everything is located and you start your dinner!   Dinner is 6 courses, you have no idea what you are eating but it's super fun to guess! (All my guesses were completely wrong LOL) The darkness is designed to heighten your senses. There is music playing so it's not complete silence while in the dark.   The food was honestly so amazing! I loved every dish and they were all things I would have never chose on my own! At the end of the dinner you come back out to the lounge for a photo, to pay, and they present the menu you had so you can see what you were eating! I thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant and would def recommend going in for a fun night out!

RxUFwP49Oh1nrEmZONMEag.text: This place is such a unique experience! My boyfriend and I have been here twice and we've thoroughly enjoyed it both times. In the beginning, they ask if you have any food restrictions and you enter completely blind. Of course, you cannot see and need to be guided by your server to your table, but you also don't know what is on the menu until you leave.  The food was good, it was fun talking about what we think we were eating. When I became full I was also able to sneak some of my food on my boyfriend's plate. It was an entertaining game I played lol. We were also very fond of the playlist. Both times my boyfriend and I went the music was often a subject of conversation and how we wish were able to find out the artist or song title!  Overall a great restaurant that is different from a traditional one :)

s67hUMvVD6nFQSR29eaqNA.text: A truly unique dining experience that's well worth the short trip off the strip. We were a party of ten and it was an intimidate experience, even with other parties in the room. We were skeptical that a vegan meal would be filling, but by the fifth course, our bellies were full and our senses were heightened. Our server Willy was absolutely wonderful.

q_Gy0W0mfA-6gHxE_bs7YA.text: Suuuppppeeerrrrr overpriced. The dining experience is cool but not worth what you could've spent for way better food at a nice Restaurant on the strip. If they are going to charge these prices then they should update the lobby laptops to touch screen and/or tablets. 2 stars for the food because it was good, and 1 star for the service.

s6yjbLPaMBdZVaKtShvYQg.text: The food was fantastic and the service was top notch! Our server, Ken, did an excellent job taking care of us. The whole staff was great. We had so much fun!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dining experience was great! My wife and I had a wonderful time. When you make reservations, ask for Ken. He was fantastic and funny!
Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i0oKYWxyfOEx_zf41jQU0Q.text: It was fun as an experiment. Too expensive for eating all those veggie and small portions!!  Once time try is enough.

rL3I-IjnGcDQep-pYkzt4g.text: The whole experience from start to finish at Blackout was awesome! Our waiter, Anthony, guided us through a dining experience that was delicious, entertaining and most definitely unique. Was excited to hear the menu changes every 3 months. We will 100% be back in September with guests who are visiting from out of town.

eqQtnMM9fXZKvQm_C-n57w.text: What a wild experience! Leaving most of my senses out of the eating experience was unique indeed! The food was all plant based and amazing! Super fun place for a first date!!

ePWTGtnQCxZiqYuKIBvLTg.text: This was a very unique and fun experience! Our waiter was Shea and she was amazing, super fun, chatty, patient and really set the atmosphere for complete black out dining! They take you through the process of what to expect beforehand and guide you through the whole dining process. It's a prefixed menu, so they make sure to check on any food allergies you may have. I was expecting this dinner to not be very filling since it was a plant based meal, but by the fifth course I was feeling quite full. The food is way delicious! They will describe to you what you are about to eat (mostly finger foods) but won't tell you exactly what it is so it can enhance your sense of taste (I personally liked the mystery of it all). They do have a menu for you to look at afterwards if you are curious, but during the meal you are in complete care of the chef and staff! They also change the menu up every week, I was told. Loved this unique and wonderful experience and highly recommend it!!

4kPuYw84IObif0JtY1-H2A.text: We absolutely loved everything about this restaurant. Let alone the experience, the 6 course dinner was intricate and flavorful. Add in the pitch darkness and you create an experience where you really try to identify the textures and the individual ingredients in each dish. You find yourself wondering what that ingredient is that you know is so familiar but just can't place.  Yes, it's vegetarian food, but you really don't feel like you're missing anything - and neither of us could finish all the food.  The owner and waitstaff brief you on the process and patiently work to orient you to your environment. If you ever need anything - since you can't see your waiter - you just raise your hand and they come attentively. Yes I heard a few spills and drops through the night, but it really just added to the experience as we were laughing and having so much fun.  They change the menu every 3 months so we can't wait to come again and re-experience it.  This felt like so much more than a gimmicky experience - there really is something to blind yourself and enhance your other senses as you create an intimate moment for your food and whomever you bring.

FwUvxWruLO3klkFYCG-qKg.text: My evening dining adventure was a surprise. And what a surprise it was! Our waiter was Corey, and he took care of us from the moment we got there. Such a unique experience! I would recommend to anyone looking for a unique dining adventure.

oe3cgsked597n6JSpRUjyQ.text: The waiters are very nice and helpful. The food wasn't great and totally vegan. The music was a little too loud for me. You get used to being in the dark quickly, but I wish it was a little quieter. I guess your senses are heightened so it seems very loud to me.

3Kc_RKuLmYnAcdcfqE7S9g.text: this place is so crazy and amazing. eating in complete darkness is such a cool experience and actually pretty hilarious. the food is also amazing but i can't go into detail because part of the fun is not knowing. the way you're guided throughout every step--getting to your table, finding your silverware, managing to eat your food--is just so different. you really rely on your sense of hearing and spacial awareness. our server really made the experience what it was. Roscoe was phenomenal! so enthusiastic about what he does and excited to share the experience with us. he was hilarious and very polite. and his descriptions of the different courses were so interesting but just enough to still leave us wondering what we were eating. definitely will be back. love this place and the whole idea!!!

Li9SZMQYwF5ejDRilzn2QQ.text: I am giving three stars because the waitress was very upbeat and apologetic. It was a new experience eating in the dark. Also the restrooms were very clean.  1. There is no menu. It is a surprise meant to activate your other senses. You choose between three categories. (Savory, sweet, spicy)  -No menu seemed exciting. I took the risk, trusted the staff and left extremely disappointed. I did not hide my disappointment. My waitress apologized for 5/6 dishes because I was unhappy. 2. It should not be a secret that this is a vegan restaurant. There are only meat like items.   -The menu can be secret, but tell people in advance the type of restaurant. I was thoroughly upset. When we first got there and asked about any conditions to be aware of, my bestie told them she is vegetarian. The girl said ok no problem we have a menu with options for you. I said I am not a vegetarian and no allergies. She said ok no problem. During the experience, I kept asking will the next course be my main meal with meat? (I actually asked for meat)  I repeated I'm not vegetarian and expressed my concern there may be confusion in the kitchen. The waitress kept saying possibly... I can't ruin the surprise...test your senses. I think that would have been a good time to tell me I am not getting meat or fish.  3. The price...$70 per person. There was one course that I fully enjoyed. The other courses I didn't eat everything due to bland taste or certain veggies I have never enjoyed.   I am not ok paying so much for a meal that I didn't enjoy. It's pitch black so you're  not paying for the ambiance. I expect to pay for great tasting food... whether all vegan or meat included- a price that high MUST be great tasting food. This did not cut it for me.   I wish this new business the best of luck! It is a good concept.

erPn4LELL1pQB3SIfMVQ9w.text: Ken, our waiter made our night!! We randomly forgot a few allergies and remembered around course #4, and thanks for our amazing waiter it wasn't a problem. We had so much fun. Our food was delicious and so interactive. A night we won't forget!!! A must do for all adventurous people!! Make sure you ask for Ken!!

9cLfEAxj7q8Nio3KgWNZTA.text: This was such a new totally different way to dine! My boyfriend surprised me here for my birthday. From the outside looks a little underwhelming but it's about the experience. The experience was so much fun, and on top of that, the food was great. You literally can NOT see a thing, not your chair not the food. Eating with our hands was welcomed. I recommend this place to anyone! And if you're worried about being a little anxious, that's okay. I was a little also. But our waiter Anthony made us feel safe and comfortable. I'll definitely come back to show a friend this place.

33rdZq9LDvwtNs1fO_EPNg.text: I consider myself a pretty adventurous person so I thought this would be perfect for my birthday dinner with my husband .  Our server was Chris and he did an excellent job .  There are two things I realized are not for me .  1. I'm not made to dine in the dark  2. I'm definitely not a vegan  I'm all for paying for the experience of it but I'm not sure this was a $200 experience  I'm a foodie and I just couldn't get into it . This was not near gourmet in any kind of way . Portions were probably more suitable for a kid . I really liked the salad . All 4 bites of it lol .. I appreciate that they offer a free bottle of wine on your birthday . I showed my ID for it upon check in. When we got the bill it was on the bill so i asked about it . The girl told me she wasn't the one who checked us in and she needed to see my ID again . Better communication between the staff would be a plus . The sewer smell in the lobby area is definitely a turn off when you are about to eat a meal . All in all it's a cool concept . Something you should definitely try at least once .

Eof7XJePSffyHCycRAPaHA.text: I would love to give this place a 5 start however our experience was not. We got dropped off by our lift at 8:19... our Reservation was ay 8:30 they have on record that we went back at 8:56. After the first 2 course we fine but after which we started to realize we had been there quite a while we asked for the time 3 times... after the second we were told 8:45 ( remeber they said we got there at 8:56) however once we said no way that is thr time....the waitress came back and told us in fact it was 10:20 alot later than she had thought.   We were told dinner would take 45 to 90 min. After it took very long to get water and our 4th course where we requested to have all others prepaired now and not to wait till we were dones with this one. After awhile and still no water....We realized we were the only table left in the room.   We raised our hands, hollared and even yelled for someone anyone and no one was in the room. We finally had enought after a plate was neviously pushed off the table and still no one came to help. We desided to get up and try to leave our selfs when, we were a few feet from our table when we finally met by our waiter. It was 10:55pm then...they  close at 11 but tecnically we still had 2 courses left ....   We paid the full $212 for 3 people. And left. The next day i called to speak to a manager and where they refunded $70 based on the fact that we didnt finish our last two courses.  They argued that the time that we had experience was typicall.... even at 9pm to 11pm that is 2 hours not 1.5 but we werent done we still had 2 courses left.   HOWEVER that is not my biggest consern.  My consern is you trust them to keep you safe as you are completely vulnerable in the dark and yet there was no one in the room with us for at least 20 min.   We had no way of calling them but yelling and they still didnt come. One of my friends that was with us is highly allergic to dill we exspressed this and the other is very much afraid of the dark. So we have to trust the staff to keep us safe..... We felt very taken advantage of and disrespected by the responce we got.  I suggest a policy change where someone is in the room at all times. It is irrisponsable and dangerous for there not to be. Go at your own risk if there is not a policy change.

UqxstilUDN8awG8iyi7uPg.text: This is my favorite place to enjoy a great meal! This was my second time here and the every course of the 6 courses was delicious. The first time it was just my husband and I and I was so excited to celebrate my brother(s) Birthday here. We were a party of 7 and I promise you everybody's plates were cleaned. The experience of being in the dark with out any technology and the worry of if we have food on our faces is the best! So So so much fun. The staff is amazing and we were so happy to have Anthony again. We enjoy this place so much and can't wait to become back. The Rachel Collins is the most refreshing cocktail much like Rachel who has us hooked!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our favorite restaurant!

DbsitluQti28P8ZUYZRN3g.text: I had a fantastic experience here with my partner. Being in the dark really heightens your sense of taste and smell and the food was absolutely delicious (and surprisingly healthy). I loved the mystery of trying to guess what each of the courses were. The waiters were so kind and helpful in leading us in and making sure we weren't lost. I would definitely come here again!  P.S. Being in the dark is also a whole new kind of romantic. You'd be surprised how much you depend on sight to communicate with your sigificant other, so just relying on their voice or touch can be fun and interesting.

JpxVi-LpsuDvNi0lf_MBtQ.text: This was such an unbelievable experience. It is pitch black, i couldn't even see my hand in front of my face. The food was simple, but absolutely spectacular. I generally want a giant steak for dinner. This place had no meat, but it was so good i didn't care. The staff was terrific. I would go again for sure.  Best Gin and Tonic I can remember drinking.

gjnbjwDrAO2-FnvK54AEEg.text: Black Out Dining was an amazing experience. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and accommodating. This is definitely something people should try at least once.   The ambience was chill, you are in complete darkness which heightens your other senses. The music helped set a great feel. Although it does get noisy as the room fills up with other guests. This is all part of the experience.   We went for lunch which was a 4 course meal and was plenty of food to fill us up. Each course was flavorful and delicious. They did an amazing job using tastes and textures to entice your palate and tickle your senses. I read many reviews about the portions being small and I have to disagree, I could barely finish all my food. The portions were perfectly sized since you cannot take left overs with you.

3j3jLOwLeP972btCVQjJZw.text: This was an amazing experience with amazing vegan food. My mom and I went to vegas for my graduation and we went to this place solely because it sounded interesting, we were not expecting to have such an amazing time with AMAZING vegan PLANT BASED food. I'm in love, I can't wait to bring people back, it's a must stop for vegans & non vegans. I highly recommend. We had Anthony as our waiter and he was hilarious and was amazing [and vegan (win!)]

i1ViY-EsWrmXNM8LZBRYeQ.text: Great experience! If you are super scared of the dark, this may provide some anxiety for you. The way this place goes about serving you 7 courses is great though. Ate foods I would never probably eat if I would've known what I was being served. Got me to step out of my box.

V8PW7xTwr4GE_P9m3xdgDg.text: One of the coolest experiential dining experiences ever. You eat in the dark and the partial sensory deprivation changes your opinion of foods. Very fun.

4MgJrLJhZb4HP10MHsg_gQ.text: Went with a friend we both loved it great experience and our server Rosco was amazing! really great at describing the food would go again.

KUh46s4nkzKuQAbUMV_26Q.text: The best experience in Vegas so far! Our waiter Anthony was spectacular! I highly recommend eating here.

xTNEKxxGY_DSxtbLNmOSwA.text: WOW. One of the best dining experiences I've ever had -- unbelievably delicious and unbelievably fun. I chose this spot for my birthday dinner, and it surpassed all expectations. I brought along some family members, all somewhat trepidatious about the pitch black environment. Our server, Anthony, was not only attentive but hilarious, immediately putting us at ease and setting the stage for a fun-filled evening. Course after course, my omnivore comrades gushed how much they loved the plant-based cuisine; it was truly one of the best meals I've ever had. Yes, you should expect to splurge a bit here, but it's designed for a special outing. Even the plates have crazy shapes that are fun to touch. I recommend this sensory experience to anyone. And be sure sure to come hungry because as you will be pleasantly stuffed by the time you leave!

hnlLbBdVSzG1QIH66XZMfQ.text: An exhilarating experience!!! A must try for couples and groups. Food is delicious! Our server, Corey, was awesome and made our time fun, comfortable and relaxing.

0LCoHaembbUgwEuZUDorxA.text: It was definitely a unique experience. I found the check a little hard to swallow for the fact that the dishes weren't anything spectacular, it's hard to charge so much when you can't even see anything nor see the person's face you're dining with but that's inevitable because it's "blackout." The waiter we had was okay, he wasn't very enthusiastic as I have read reviews about people raving about their service. It was for a birthday dinner, they didn't do anything but wish my wife a happy birthday as most restaurants do a little something extra. If you're interested in playing "find your food" and your drinks then it's something to experience but definitely a one time thing.

Cksa_FVqt-KY988ZyMumXw.text: What a great experience!!!! Our waiter, Rosco, helped make the experience even better. He gave tips and guided us through the process but he never gave any of it away.  At the end of the dinner you get to see the menu to see what you ate. The food was delicious. I would recommend going here on a date or with a small group of friends.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobby area of the restaurant

7hIbzZXd73IwDU1BR2oHXQ.text: We had an amazing time! It was such a great experience!! We went for my other half's birthday and we had a good time. Of course after you get used to the whole not seeing ANYTHING, it gets interesting. The laughs were endless. We had a six course meal, I believe. They're not big portions, which was the only downfall, but everything was so tasty! We enjoyed all the dishes that were served. Never would've guessed half of the menu. Just wish the portions were bigger (ie: 3 pieces cheese and crackers are considered a course, and two pierces of chocolate were another). Their menu changes every two-three months. The price for the dinner experience does add up. About $80 pp, not including drinks. But this is definitely something everyone should try at least once.

_tQaAdWqM0crMrgabdU06w.text: Staff was very laid back , it was a very fun atmosphere ! The food was very different and it was a great experience !!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anthony made this experience interesting and he was really attentive! 10/10 would do this all over again !

eQsxj_xd84rU7U6_rSVhBg.text: I'm torn. I'd love to give more stars, but I'd also like readers to know my experience and that I found it verging on unethical.   HUGE ISSUE:: they don't tell you the price. And won't tell you when you ask. Expect to pay $100 a person. And for the food they provide that's too much.   They break the price into entry and food, but let's be honest that's a way to confuse the attendee. It's a restaurant. To have a hidden $30 entry fee without telling you till AFTER is extortion.   Our server was fun and added a lot to the experience.   I'd love to give a big 5 stars to the idea and the creator, but not after being so overcharged.   The food wasn't worth that price. I won't spoil The "surprise" of the menu, but suffice to say the ingredients don't warrant $100   Somehow Vegas has come to an agreement that it's ok to add a lot of hidden charges to bills and patrons will write it off as "oh well, it's vacation." I think that is a shitty business practice.   I'd love to suggest everyone try it, but I don't support they way they aren't transparent with the billing.   Go home and eat with a blindfold and save yourself $100.

vDwVbQJsAxfqhXuA8xXmmw.text: Amazing experience. Fun. Unique. Delicious food that is revealed at the end of the meal. Roscoe is the man you want as your server. He gives you just enough info to guide you but not too much as to bias your experience. This would be fun as a date night or even as a group to share your opinions and experience with in the dark. The staff does an excellent job to alleviate any fear or anxiety of being in complete darkness. Highly recommend this everyone.

42Pe7ok0rJIZV6dp-z_iaw.text: Complete and utter disappointment, took wife and mother-in-law to this place for a crazy dining experience. Turns out their food was absolutely disgusting. Even after asking before booking the reservation any details they can give on the type of food, they never mentioned that they were a vegan restaurant! I may have been fine with the fact that it was basically nothing but vegetables for the entire meal if the vegetables were actually good! If you want blah, bland, unflavored, disgustingly nasty food in the pitch black dark and then be ripped off with an outrageously high bill for that garbage, this is the place for you! If not I highly suggest going for a different type of crazy dining experience that might have flavorful food with some substance! After spending pretty much $100 a person, we all had to go find food to eat after leaving because we were still starving hungry! What a horrible way for my wife and mother-in-law to spend their birthdays!!! I feel like I have been ripped off beyond measure!! Though the guy Cory was nice we didn't come there just for a guy to be nice and spend $100 a person!!! Then I call to let them know how awful the experience was and they don't even care!!! I am so upset about this. Never in my life have I felt so ripped off by a restaurant. Like I said unless you are a vegan that enjoys food that has absolutely no flavor, maybe even make you throw up later like I did. DO NOT DARE GO HERE!!!

S4p52eA1YonUDcmpBsHNJA.text: TLDR: bad enough to get me to write my first yelp review.   My wife booked this for our Vegas trip.   It's located at the edge of an industrial complex that's pretty barren. The sign was easy to find, but even our Uber driver was confused how to get to the front. Parking lot was empty, which should have been a sign. Upon entering, there was a strong chemical smell, not really like a cleaner. After signing away my life with a waiver, we headed into the dark.   I must say our waitress was great and guided us effectively on eating the meal. The cocktail my wife had was tasty, but nothing special. The food left a lot to be desired. As others have mentioned, pretty much everything has a sauce covering it, which also makes things messy. Each course is served in a variety of oddly shaped plates and bowls that hide the small courses and makes eating difficult. The ending "bonus" dessert was very good, though.  The music playlist was amazing, which is why they get two stars.   The price is ridiculous. I understand the Vegas tax, the experience, whatever you want to layer on to try to justify the price but it's absolutely not worth $80/pp. There's nothing at all special to the food, I could totally understand $40 (as is itemized on the bill), but the additional entrance fee is BS.  The group of ladies that finished slightly before us asked us what we thought outside. They all didn't like it as well.

Fq-qAU_4fMvkv6Ku0xukWA.text: This place is a really cool experience. The food is great and the service here is awesome!  Couldn't have asked for a better dining experience. The only thing I can't speak to is the platting of dishes because clearly it was pitch black and we couldn't see anything!  Worth noting that our server (can't recall her name), was what really took the experience from being great to unforgettable.

AM2BHxwGXxGf0JU4UJwvTw.text: Korey was great, sold the experience. It is truly an experience,  one worth trying at least once!

_-nkPgeINGYHaUjsfmooMA.text: Had a great time! I joined them for murder mystery themed dinner and it was so much fun! Service was great and they were so funny while playing the characters , the food was amazing my favorite was some kind of pasta with tomato sauce and the desert . I thought I'll do good since I watched every murder show there is but unfortunately I got the murderer wrong .  The girl sitting next to me was there before and she was convicted she had chicken there last time , but it's actually plant based and you can't tell the difference .  Bottom line it was a great experience with great food and entertainment so definitely worth going there

Pl1rbMpdcnd1ey0EJPDb8Q.text: It was a lot of fun Crystal or wait staff was outstanding so what's our greeter it was nice to be there explained where everything was and how the plate is laid out it made it a great adventure. The food is very tasty we guessed wrong on just about everything

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s really day!!!

RgabeQnw-XPt_tJsCVHI9g.text: A really cool experience. It was weird at first to be eating in pitch black darkness, but after awhile my eyes adjusted and I felt comfortable. The food was delicious and our server was super attentive and friendly. I would have never even known it was vegetarian if I hadn't looked up the food choices ahead of time!

QtBn_kI0wKRSXW-YeG896w.text: What an experience! I arrived early before a work trip and wanted something that was one of kind aside from the usual Las Vegas adventures like gambling. The food was incredible and the staff were top notch. I definitely recommend trying this place out if you want a truly unique dining experience.

m2gcCv1lry-Dy1-U2bmoOA.text: By far the coolest dining experience ever! Totally bizarre at first not being able to see, but fishing around in the dark to eat your food was so much fun and your other senses are definitely heightened without your sight. I'm the type of person who always has to see what I'm eating (& take photos) but this experience allows you to experience food and reconnect with company in an intimate way, which I believe is something we lack nowadays. Wonderful concept. Wonderful experience. Also Chelsea, our server, was amazing. Thanks Black Out for a dinner I'll never forget.

7CJ8NVQDa_ujjvLRhsmACQ.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Blackout, and will definitely go again. The service was exceptional. I'm not a vegan or even a vegetarian, but I loved 99 percent of what I was served, and was okay with the other 1 percent. Above all, this was a truly novel experience and well above most of the other experiences Las Vegas touts as unique.

A0GHQXwdCbCJ5jblkCXtuA.text: Very unique dining experience! Food was amazing but a little pricey for the quantity that you get.  Never though eating in complete darkness could be so much fun! Would definitely recommend to family and friends but prolly wouldn't do it again because of the price!

JFsNonFAsBR-xwO9IZW1bg.text: One of the funnest and most exciting dinning experiences I have had in my life. Anthony our waiter was amazing, he walked us through the scary parts and gave us very good direction. The food was great, such a amazing way to dine. I will come back every time the menu changes. They mentioned it changes every 3 months. I'll be honest, it was a little tiring not to be able to see no matter how hard you tried, but it was well worth it. Oh yeah, the waiters wear night vision goggles to see lol

yeQRHccnYxvQZSV-Ph3PTQ.text: Anthony was absolutely amazing!!! The concept of this place is fun, the food was really good, and our server Anthony really made the experience for us, he is the best! Took my girlfriend for her birthday, loved it!

1Jn3gSBHSDGFGtaaw3Arfg.text: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our date night here. From start to finish the whole experience was one for the books. The staff was super friendly and communicative. The food was delicious and filling. You really can't see a thing while you're in there but the staff gives really detailed instructions throughout the entire process. The dishes that you're served on make it easy to feel your way through your dining experience. We had a blast and we loved every moment it. We even got a gift at the end! Thanks for the memories! Oh, and Willie was great!

-BDwlmPHM14KuWBf6S8WFQ.text: Yes I knew it was all plant based vegan before I went and I absolutely loved it!  The intrigue, mystery and eclectic environment made for a very relaxing, enjoyable evening!  The food was mysteriously delicious, and to top it off VERY HEALTHY!!  I loved it and plan on returning next time I'm in Vegas. There are very few cool surprises left in your life. . . Give it a try!!

NNmL8tzyUKHFPbU0y5CqPg.text: The experience and food was unique and amazing!!!Then why 3 stars you might ask? It's called service recovery!!we had a issue with the bill Minor but still a issue.it took them scrabbling for 25 min with 4 people trying to fix it..now was it fixed no it was not..this place is a good time for one night only.for tourist not locals.btw Ken is a great host no compliant there.

RRbBbPa6bX2QrAIpzpqNJA.text: Best experience ever! The food is so amazing ! The service is amazing ask for Willy ! I definitely would pick this spot if you want a awesome fun and cool experience!!! I had a blast !

4fZ7eEQxWczBB_KlRwAlVA.text: Went here a couple of times already ! I love it ! Great experience and a shock to your senses . It is True, it is a vegan menu. That should not be a deterrent . I think skipping one meat meal never killed anybody. You'll be surprised at how filling and delicious the courses are. The creativity of the menu still shines through even in total darkness. Like everywhere else, when you dine out you partially pay for atmosphere. Here you get an unforgettable experience. I suggest you go with people that you trust and are well behaved because the darkness does require you to challenge your trust issues and experience something new .  The last two times I went, the menu was the same. However I look forward to coming there again in hopes that they create something new . My only suggestion is that maybe they can ask or keep track of patrons that have dined there before so they can offer something new every time.

BgmSVnJrGwqIospbnWrFFg.text: Our server Chelsea was wonderful!  She made the experience a lot of fun.  The only reason I can't give 5 stars is that the main course wasn't very good and when I saw the ingredients at the end, I was pleasantly surprised at first,  but then I was annoyed.  A high end meal should include high end ingredients.  Overall,  fun experience but the food wasn't as enjoyable as the service and experience.  Worth going to experience it!

TOL8PbAaaUlDajEA7I9O-w.text: Hands down the best dining experience I have ever had. This was a great way to try things you normally wouldn't try. The staff is great and do a wonderful job making you feel comfortable. It was great for date night. And the drinks were amazing. It is a bit pricy, but worth every penny.

-ml7OMjBD0-9XWi7kukdFA.text: My husband and I had a blast thanks to our server Mike! Attentive to all our needs, made us feel comfortable while giving us some good laughs. Definitively an experience to try. The food had us wondering just about every single time, an adventure in itself.

iE5eCK_4ma5UjJol1lYwWQ.text: I gave this restaurant two stars only because it was fun, way too pricey for the quality. The experience was interesting and our waiter Ken was professional and very nice but the food wasn't very good. If you don't like (or can't eat) fried food make sure to let them know...if I could give any advice to the owners, add more fresh raw foods. Simple familiar foods would be better then all the same textures of fried courses.

--ruSNbhw8O27_UmK6FEVA.text: Dined there on Friday night.  Anna was our server.  She was amazing!  She's so personable and funny!  It's definitely a unique experience to not be able to see while you eat.  She made us feel so comfortable and walked us through the process.  She even went above and beyond and "shazamed" a song for us.  Will definitely be back just to see her!!!!  All the staff there are so warm and welcoming!!!!!

8NH5KJIySVebFUKMiud24w.text: Terrible. The food is subpar at best, and for 70.00 per person price point that's ridiculous. You do get a 6 course meal however after the first meal you'll be wondering why am I doing this, the food is terrible. Hoping my meal would get better course after course it just got worse course after course. This is not a high class restaurant no matter how they try or how much they charge. The menu is all vegan also which I had no idea and no one told me. Wish I would checked yelp before even thinking about going to this place. I'm literally eating McDonald's an hour after spending 167.00 at this place including tip. Completely unsatisfied, the Big Mac is more gourmet then the food at Blackout. Now let me be fair and say something nice....... uh, my server was cool.  Bottom line, don't go unless you enjoy wasting money.

sj2TY4KyEvGSJCAnScGMOA.text: We had a really positive experience here.  Definitely pleasantly surprised by the quality and complexity of the food, and also completely intrigued by the social dynamic of eating in complete darkness. Our waiter, Kenny, made it much more organic and less "gimmicky" than it could have been with good service, detailed descriptions of how to make the most of it, and especially by joining in on our jokes as we got past the uncomfortable part of being in total darkness.  Ask for him if you've booked!

gYNOitlItv2dDg44ZJTPNQ.text: Such an amazing experience. I will have to be honest when saying that I would only go here once in a blue moon. I don't think it was worth the same amount as the ticket at the end of the meal. Especially when you don't get the chance to choose what you eat. The overall experience was very different. But one in a life time. With that being said I guess the price wasn't that bad. 1/2 price would be awesome especially since they don't have a electric bill. I'd be there if any of my friends would come to town if that was the case. Have a nice time n visit with the ones you love if you don't mind spending $100 a person.

7O9jifsRbICwU6PXN3qSgg.text: Food was good, our waiter was awesome at walking us through the experience!   My only negative is that they ended up overcharging my card and they wouldn't fix it right away; the hostess told me to call the following day to have the issue handled.

0cPiRiW0UIo6MvwWVInLSw.text: It was the most incredible unique dining experience! I felt like Sherlock Holmes! Victoria was amazing and took great care of us. I can't wait to go back. Even though I'm so full and don't want to see food lol. Such an amazing experience! I'm vegan so to find a place as fun as this that's also vegan friendly. I'm thrilled. Best way to spend my birthday!

sx3easwJ-zhfDx1dGqGBWQ.text: Korey aka "Brad Pitt in the dark" was an amazing server who gave us a great experience! We absolutely loved this place because of his hospitality and humor! Absolutely recommend!

KZPOJl22su7GPQUVJH-o9A.text: We had the absolute best time at Blackout! We made reservations and let them know about any dietary restrictions. They confirmed those when we arrived. Walking into the pitch black is super fascinating. You know that it will be dark in there but I feel like unless you've experienced a lot of complete darkness before, it still a little wild to be in a completely pitch black room.   The food was incredible. We had so much fun trying to guess what was in each item. Every dish was delicious. The servers do a great job describing where everything is on the plate which makes eating much easier. Our server, I believe his name was Will, was really fun and made the experience really great.   Since you don't have any electronics or anything, you don't have to worry about being distracted. It's all about spending time with the other folks there with you. A very immersive experience.   All around, definitely one of the most memorable meals I've ever had. If I'm ever in Vegas again, I'm definitely going back!!

po6kVoP-uZ0BEZWpPBtt9w.text: Great experience. It's a must try if you haven't! Took my son here for his 18th birthday! We did the lunch and was so full! Food was amazing. Great service from Corey. Definitely have to do it again!

mPDdUCwg0cagAG83NHG2JQ.text: This place has a great presentation, however it is not worth 100 dollars. I just went here on 8/30/2019 my wife enjoyed it, but I liked none of the courses. OsbEKr6QeBtvscQNl08O4A.text: This was probably the most unique dining experience I've ever had & I wish to return. Y8y-zXNfef90jOIxz07cbA.text: This was an awesome experience! Came for lunch. The waiter Ken was fantastic! Food was really good!! mvOUt8Cs-PckKdMRTOZhwQ.text: This was not a great experience. It is gimmicky and the food was sub par for the cost. C7SnhCbstlpPnXhbEWLMrA.text: What is there to say!! We went to a trendy dining place that served your booze and food in the dark!! You would Think that was enough? Wrong!! It was a hoot! Qe5NVx_1IsEmuF9sZfFBBQ.text: Seated quickly. The experience went downhill fast. After the first course the food became inedible. Too many flavorless carbs. 88vpZ3LFdQN4NoEoekpVYg.text: management is in complete disarray and couldn't time up our large group to fit a window of time we had to eat so we had to leave and they charged $300 to our card after one manager said the person who is in charge is unavailable until the next day and wouldn't charge it. liars and bad organization.

D_4_-EYCfpuW_5sRTuGzTA.text: Visited here last night and was very happy with the experience! I had made the reservation as a surprise for my wife and brother and sister.  They were all very sceptical due to the lack ok sight and vegetarian menu.  I would have never lived it down if it was a flop. But the food was awesome and the darkness a great experience. Our waiter Cory was very attentive and friendly describing how to eat each course. A bit on the pricey side but hey its Vegas! Definately a good time.

896dYCcdNRFYCozbCSssCQ.text: I had such an awesome experience at Blackout!
