Not only is it a great experience, I loved each course that was served.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

loArW8CQbbX3ZXp0jBIemg.text: I think this is the first time that I planned to go to a restaurant Not knowing it was plant-based. Talk about a pleasant surprise! I called to check on vegan options and Voila! It was meant to be.   DH and I have been to a dining in the dark place before, but this was many years ago, before I was completely vegan. How cool that they have a restaurant with this experience that anyone can enjoy (and they do cater to dietary restrictions as well, offering gluten free options and asking before dinner about food allergies).   We were carefully guided to our table by Mike (and I didn't trip, even in heels!) I loved that we didn't have cell phones to distract us or take away from the blackout experience. Every dish was a culinary delight, and we had so much fun guessing what we were eating. The waiter tells you where everything is on the plate, and you get to try each item together and talk about what it could be. I was amazed that there was no dairy, everything was so creamy and indulgent.   It was a Lot of food, I will warn you. Go there hungry. We were so full after dinner we went straight back to our hotel  My omnivore partner was amazed that he wasn't hungry after eating a plant based meal. He couldn't believe how delicious  and filling everything was. His only complaint was the price- I told him it was our one splurge dinner for our Vegas trip. (So now I have to eat on the cheap until we leave lol). So Worth it.

R3Q6BDmtl-N7Chq-bR71bg.text: Fantastic experience! My fiance and I did the lunch option and walked away very satisfied. The menu is a mystery so I won't spoil that but I have to give a big shout out to our server Rebecca for making our experience so enjoyable! I'd highly recommend this place, very fun and delicious!

BG3SODiyjjiyf0YQv34I5g.text: I treated myself to lunch for my birthday.  Beginning with the hostess, who was wonderful then onto Shay who was my server and she was phenomenal!  She was very attentive and friendly.  I was served a soup, then a plate, then another plate and then another plate and then dessert.  The soup tasted like tomato to me - it was very delicious.  It wasn't tomato :) then next course were 3 fried round thingys with three different dipping sauce.  Each piece was in it's own sauce and Shay explained where everything was in detail.  The next course were "noodles" which was the best thing in my opinion.  The final course, before dessert, was a savory pastry but I was so full by then I could barely finish it.  The dessert was just enough and was very yummy.  They do show you the menu at the end of your experience but I won't give anything away.  The downside to my visit was a group of 6 women wearing "Lucky" hats.  They were loud and obnoxious and completely ruined my experience.  You are told to use inside voices, but these rules didn't apply to them.  They were so ignorant, yelling how they should have bread and why is it so dark (duh - it's the entire point of the experience) then they were SCREAMING for Shay (she was getting their food).  Then they were talking how they were going to leave and crawl out, which is impossible because it's pitch black.  They were also wearing light emitting jewelry which was just dumb because they do tell you to put everything in a locker.  The locker area is secure and you're given the key that you keep on your person.  If it weren't for this uncivilized group of women, I would have had a much enjoyable experience.

5pDaj18fTcKjva22VVIKhg.text: This server's for hire, even if we're just dancing in the dark...  TL;DR Feels like having your eyes closed the entire time, great for connecting to people, food is vegan and filling, staff really enhance the experience, well worth it.  I knew this place was going to be a memorable SNL sketch that my work team and I would remember for the rest of our lives. The experience did not disappoint. While in town for CES I choose this restaurant as a team building event for our group.   This is a 5/6 course meal that lasts about 90 minutes to 2 hours depending on the busyness of the staff. Dining with me were five guys from work so I got razzed like a baby sister when they found out the restaurant was all vegan food (they accommodate allergies), then when we arrived at an unassuming strip mall way off strip that had limited signage looking very sketchy, next when we had to sign a waiver to enter, and then as I laughed when they all texted their wives a goodbye message because we had to place all devices that light up in a personal locker.  Lastly, I got one last groan when we had to walk into the restaurant single file holding each others shoulders, because seriously it is THAT dark.  What's pretty cool is the staff all wear night vision goggles to wait on you. Plus they learn your name because they have to direct you once you are inside. The service was great but a little slow, mostly because the staff not only wait on you but are also your bartender. If you need something you raise your hand and they come over to help. You can leave for the restroom, but it will be hard to readjust. Our server did a great job orienting us pretty quickly to our dishes, glasses, and table. I put my hand a 1/2" from my face and could see nothing, it was like that the whole time.  A cautionary tale, apparently some people experience claustrophobia because of the enveloping darkness. I'll admit that for the first 2-3 minutes I got a little anxious, but once I knew where my cocktail glass was I was fine. One of my peers, who was more uncomfortable, saw a faint green light from a smoke detector and stared at it with longing to center himself in the darkness. Our server said, 90% of the people adjust pretty quickly including my peer who never lost sight of that light. Also you will be eating with your fingers and may accidentally spill your wine or gravy, no worries as the staff is very friendly to help you.  I won't give away all of the experience, but you do get perspective for those people that are vision impaired. Or like my new boss admitted, get a chance to face his fears of going blind while being with your direct reports...lol   Your other senses do become heightened. The food is okay, a little under seasoned, but filling. The music, which started out great turned into club pop that was really off for the mood. But the conversation-oh the conversation with my team was the best we've ever connected. Our table topics were slightly vulnerable, a bit confessional, and had lots of humor to offset our unique shared experience. A great team building or friend building experience, but more likely a one and done trial.   Recommend next time adding in a little Bruce Springstein's "Dancing in the dark" since they hand all ladies a rose at the end.

yh3ZHkRYHlcdrHh4cCtOiA.text: Totally relying on the reviews... we came in for Valentines day.  Had a reservation for 9 it was hella late when we got in. Even w/ the backed up reservation i was good but an irate customer came in later than us complaining about the time and got sat way before us was not cool because we didn't say anything? this was, ok? We finally got seated and after the 3rd course everything tasted gross! However, our waiter was cool and it was different. I suggest try it and then base it on your own (Totally overpriced for no reason).

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AOGsZI5c6iloROenuz_FIA.text: I remember driving by this place and thinking how I can't wait to check it out when it opens.   Imagine how excited I was when my date surprised me by taking me here!   At first, all I kept thinking was that show, Black Out, where one has to complete certain tasks in total darkness. As I signed the waiver, even though I was assured none would be served, I pretty much told myself I was going to eat a bunch of live bugs in the dark.   I was very relieved that nothing I ate contained any live bugs and once I calmed my nerves (the music helped) as I'm afraid of the dark, I found myself really enjoying the whole experience. Eating in complete darkness really perks up your senses and it was fun trying to figure out what we were eating.   I think this is one of those 'bucket list' things that everyone must experience at least once.  :)

a8bvIjaAwBRrUs0RcIR2XA.text: This was the most amazing experience! Nikki was our waitress and was the most fun ever! Each waiter/waitress only has one party at a time so they are totally dedicated to your table. The food was incredible and it was so fun trying to figure out what we were eating. Totally worth the money!!!!!

46A7CshTqSr7PL2EEySEPg.text: Very cool experience. Anthony our sever made our whole experience something that my wife and I will never forget.  If you're lucky enough to have Anthony I know you'll be in great hands. The food was fun to eat and tasty. Don't go there expecting the waitstaff to help you with anything. Just sit down and have fun.

on1V-uA5v3QA_YcnKpT4Tg.text: Wow what a trip! I've never been to a dining in the dark restaurant before this experience and really enjoyed it.  Come with a open mind and get ready to have a great time.   Before you enter the dining area you are asked to put your phones and any light emitting objects in a personal locker. You get the key so everything will be safe.   Your server will then slowly take you to your seat. Make sure you pay close attention to what they are saying because they are your eyes!  After you're seated you will choose something to drink and a flavor pallet for your multi course meal. While looking forward to this event I mostly focused on the eating in the dark aspect but was blown away by the food! Everything was very flavorful, fresh and fun.   The staff was great and we really enjoyed our host. Our host/server was very friendly informative and made us feel comfortable in the dark.   This was definitely a great experience and I can't wait to bring back some friends and family.  Blackout: Thank you for the great start to our anniversary weekend.  Tip: Bring someone that you can have a good convo with!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hE2ANESuvfsEXW8EnlFxCw.text: I would first like to say.. if you arent open to trying new food with different textures and flavors that isn't your typical "spaghetti" or "steak" then stop here. The reviews that take about "horrible tasting food" are definitely picky eaters. THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS. The 7 course meal the chefs had designed was amazing. I would never had thought about getting anything like we did if I viewed the menu. But it was such a great experience to try new things and see what you could like. The experience was amazing as well. We couldn't stopped laughing at the fact how we literally could not see anything. Having to feel around really shows you how much we rely on our vision! Lastly, we had such an amazing waiter, ROSCO. He was so kind and made sure we were consistently doing good. He helped up move around and explained each dish so vividly. Even explained the shape of the plates! It made things go so smoothly for us. Also he was very charming and made us laugh and feel completely comfortable. Definitely ask for him if you could!   Thank you again blackout for such an amazing experience! We left nice and full and curious for new menus!

M2EwKOv_j3YQictkBA2ZAg.text: Our host "Rosco" was amazing. He was informative, funny, nice and made the entire experience over the top. The food was top notch! Nothing like I ever tasted before, but absolutely amazing. We will definitely visit again!

4au9i9SN-oOVC_B8rBHtEA.text: You read dining in the dark but nothing prepares you for how dark it is!   That sounds like the most obvious statement but it is the first thing you hear from everyone as they get seated.  But let's start from the beginning.  Walking in, you go into a waiting room area where you are asked to put your handbags, electronic watches, and phones into a locker.   So take pictures first!  Once you do that, you will be asked to sign a legal disclaimer (as expected).    You then get offered a drink menu where you can order some specialty cocktails.  After that, it's GO time.   We were escorted by Ashley who was perfect for blackout dining virgins.  She was funny and really took time to explain everything each step of the way.   I held her shoulders and the boy held mine and we were on our way.   It's SO dark guys.    For us it was a fun date experience as we worked together to try each other's drinks and talk about what we thought we were eating.   Oh yes, important fact:  they will not tell you the menu until the end.   This doesn't matter because the food was delicious.  Nothing made me happier than finding a deposit of food that I missed on the plate.   We laughed the entire time and truly enjoyed the experience.  For meat eaters, adjust your own expectation down a bit.   This isn't a steak house but it is really great plant based food.  I do think it is a bit pricer...could be maybe 10-15% cheaper for what you get but no regrets.   We were told they change out the menu every couple of months so I will definitely go back.   For those interested, 2 of us with 2 alcoholic beverages ran about $240.   They do lunch as well which is a little less expensive.   They also currently have a Groupon which will save you some money if you can schedule in advance.    I highly recommend trying it at least once!

ahjXsT59rLmyMStw2ye6Ig.text: Locals and tourists alike have to try this place out at least one time! Food is great! When you go, ask for Cory, aka Carl!!

PMz8Hx0svUbWL1RG55yksA.text: I ate things at this place that would have never entered my mouth in any other setting. Let's start with that. Then it turned into I loved the unique experience I was trapped into.  They lock your stuff up in a locker like you're in grade school again, and walk you into the pitch black dining area like a human train with their night vision goggles.   Speaking onto the sensory deprivation part, you really are legitimately deprived of sight. Me being me, I found myself looking around everywhere anyway knowing no matter what direction I looked in I'd see the same thing... pitch black. I just found it worth noting simply because all of our table had different discussed behaviorism in this environment. It was very cool and unique.   I do wish this place wasn't EXCLUSIVELY vegetarian, however. That would have amplified the experience for almost all of us. Even just as an option, it would have been nice.   I'd recommend but on the caveat that you're very orally experimental and not easily queezy. With your taste heightened, the stuff that's good is really good, but the stuff that's bad is really bad. State your allergies or uncomfortable foods in advance and you should be okay for the most part. But for real... meat... get it in here.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pBd0eJMoMYnT0UEekRMUnw.text: This place was AMAZING! The food was absolutely delicious and the staff were very friendly. The overall experience of eating in the dark is something new and different and my boyfriend and I loved every minute of it. They bring the courses out individually (two appetizers, main course and dessert) and you get to try each dish and figure out what you are eating (and they do ask before you are seated if you have any food allergies). Then at the end, when you are brought out, they will show you the menu and let you know what you actually had; trust me you are in for a surprise, we were definitely wrong on virtually every dish. I highly recommend this restaurant!  P.S. For couples there is a cute little surprise added on as well!

wKBgzsomNMEq6A1CWKBFTg.text: Eek. This is not a fine dining restaurant with a fun twist. This is ill prepared vegan food that you eat in the dark. And as many reviewers have already commented on and I can also confirm, the food is served lukewarm and is tasteless until you get to the overly sweet desert. I swear it is like grade school cafeteria food.....only vegan style.  The owners have to be pinching themselves in disbelief at what people are willing to pay (myself included) for the craptastic food just because they have the lights off.   I need to open a knock off across the street for $10 bucks less per person and actually serve edible food and I would have lines out the door! Seriously you can expect to pay $100 per person (including tax, tip, and one drink) for a $3 meal.   You will laugh, and you will be heading someplace else to eat afterwards.

Tr4dUsS0nTsLiN26_HbTwQ.text: I recommend this experience for couples to parties of 4 max.   The experience was 4.5 stars - pitch black and intriguing. The service was great.   The music was good but a touch too loud.   The food was 3.5 stars - it was tasty enough but not enough to justify cost. It would be comparable to food at a cafe as opposed to a fine dining restaurant.

2-LSv6NEZEg5hjxhQbBAuQ.text: A great experience - the food was really tasty and filling, and dining in total darkness gave my family and I the opportunity to sit and talk without distractions and try something new. We went for lunch, which is 5 courses. It's a plant based menu, which we loved. It is a little pricey, but you're paying for the experience as well.

prKVvY-um388cz4pjPLQEw.text: Incredible!  My man and I enjoyed our date night here and it was just SO awesome! I can't wait to return. Our server was phenomenal and made sure we felt comfortable throughout. To remove the sense of sight is at first a tad concerning but as we adjusted it just heightened the mood and experience all together.   Note that our service took almost two hours so be prepared.   Also, my non-vegetarian boyfriend enjoyed it just as much as I did. No need to worry about the lack of meat!   I would've really enjoyed to see photos of the dishes we enjoyed afterwards, although they do show you the printed menu. Seeing what the dish looked like and comparing it to what our imagination has created throughout the experience would've been the icing on the cake! I hope they take this into consideration as time passes.  Another suggestion would be to turn down the lights in the lobby/front room area. It's so bright! Something to set the mood and help adjust our eyes upon entering and exiting would be greatly appreciated.

OrS6D_aJu9vUl37lovGU_A.text: This place was so fun!! I think anyone with their expectations in the right place would enjoy the meal and overall experience here. It's BLACKOUT DARK, duh! Don't go if you can't handle that aspect. The menu is a surprise, so if you are a super picky eater don't ruin everyone's time by going. (The guy at the table next to me wouldn't stop complaining and he clearly would have been better off with fast food.) It's 6 courses but they don't skimp on the food - I left full and ready for a nap! The tables in the dining room seem to be close together so it's a bit loud and you can certainly hear conversations happening at other tables. I think people naturally talk louder too with their sense of sight essentially inoperable. This didn't bother me and aside from the one whiny guy I thought it made for a fun, laughter filled room. You can't take yourself too seriously when fumbling around trying to eat with a fork in the dark :). I loved the menu, and even the one small bite I didn't care for seemed to have fresh ingredients and it forced me out of my box to try something new. The service was super even despite it being a busy Saturday night. Mike, my waiter, kept me updated on food status, kept my drink full, and checked in frequently on how I was enjoying everything. JP at the front desk was totally on her game and kept the lines moving (completing forms, assigning lockers, checking guests out, etc) - it's a busier than normal hostess role and she performed it well. I'll be back next time I'm in town!

2yf90FFbKfDhiIven_Nr4g.text: This was an awesome experience for my husband and I, truly a different way of dining. It's more on the pricey side ($140 for us) so I wouldn't recommend this place every night while here. It was a guided 6 course meal with our waiter Chris talking us through each course. It's completely pitch black and you rely on your other senses to help. Overall we had a lovely time trying to figure out what we were eating.

JGRqDZxsuzfouBCQ6Yfu7Q.text: I find this dining experiance to be awesome! My wife, friend and I went for a sunday girls night out and at first I was so nerves because of the dark and my allergies.. but the manager came out found a way to make my experiance just as fun as everyone elses!! Rosco was our waiter and he was awesome ! He was there every step of the way, describing how to handle each dish and making sure we had our fun and drinks! I would recommend this to everyone!! We will definitely be dining he Dee e again with more of our friends!!

YCgyVLMSmJsRARuwsUvx1A.text: Ate here last night with my boyfriend and it was the BEST experience. Rebecca was a phenomenal server. She brought up the already unique opportunity!!

MRI5J_7ls1fPEFg0KF1GQg.text: DO NOT EAT HERE IF YOU HAVE FOOD ALLERGIES!!!!!!!  They ask you about them, but do not care enough not to serve those foods to you!  You have a mushroom and coconut allergy???  They serve you TWO dishes with coconut and then rationalize that mistake by saying "Well we didn't serve mushrooms!"  WTF KIND OF SERVICE PHILOSOPHY IS THAT???

MvmVokUzA6p5T60pKobZRA.text: This was terrible.  Wait of two hours with a reservation . No place to sit and wait . Not romantic!!   Waiter had bad body odor noticable from the start . Food comes and you smell him.  Food was not good . Seven course it's not and over priced.   Meal was mostly not eaten . Too noisy to talk across table and kept getting bumbed in the dark by people passing . We just wanted out half way into the meal.   It was one of those bad experiences you talk about for days so they get one star for starting those conversations  Ruined the night . And we flew in for this thing .  When we left we mentioned these things like the body odor and we get a comment "that's not good" and here's your 200$ bill for two....

n8iVsC5ujEIv-8sQb7tXPA.text: Spectacular experience, I brought friends to check it out and this was best choice for happening , an evening that we won't forget for a while.  Highly recommend

5bTnjxfK4G-He-o1UyKyDw.text: I had a lot of fun. Our waiter, Willy, He was great and made us all feel very comfortable in the dark. The food was good and the desert was out of this world! I got two. I will go again for sure.  Great for date night I'd say.

A-EK6MTlBrB9-u7ajXFrHg.text: Amazing dining experience! The flavors, textures will have you mixed up, but in a delicious way. When they say "blackout" they mean black...not even a hint of light. The music added to the experience. You can hear people around you, but have no idea how many, or how far away they are. It's a crazy cool experience that I definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The main course

1pvkNcZ1JT4GY0H1MEON1w.text: The idea of fine dining in the dark turned out to be an amazing exploration for all non visual senses It was due in large part to our waiter, who not only  carefully guided my companion and me to our table, but also explained the concept of our 4- course lunch, and made sure our dietary preferences were honored  The meal was paced to allow us to savor each course, and we were astonished at what our palates recognized ( and sometimes didn't) The flavors and textures were bold, since we had asked for spicy options, and each course was designed to appeal to that preference When we finished, our night-goggle wearing waiter carefully led us back out to the stunning and brightly lit foyer I'm definitely going back

6WejQBTqTBqNbz9AbbwCmg.text: Oh. My. God. Everything about this place is all that I could ever dream of and more! I'm going to try to not spoil as much as I can while also giving you guys my experience: THIS IS A VEGETARIAN RESTAURANT.  When you enter, they make sure you put up pretty much everything and you sign a waiver. They ask for any food allergies you may have or even things you don't like so you will actually enjoy your dish. Once through the curtains, our waiter explained the whole process and guided us to our seats. We went to lunch, so it was a four-course meal instead of the five or six they serve for dinner; I still left feeling ten months pregnant so trust me, they serve more than enough. I'm beyond surprised I didn't spill my water but I'm even more surprised my lipstick was the only thing I ruined! THE DESSERTS. OH MY GOD THE DESSERTS. I used to work at a bakery and I even bake on the side but my god nothing can compare to the desserts they serve you.   I think I may have actually lost more of my eyesight since dining here... worth it. I absolutely loved this place and wish they offered similar dining experiences back home but I guess it gives me more of a reason to return to Vegas!

zFU1yl8Cas_LyTPUsvP3sA.text: Incredible evening!!! The food and service were outstanding. Very unique dining experience. We did not know what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised and pleased with the evening. Well worth the price. The food was delicious and flavorful. The waiter was extremely attentive and funny. Eating in the dark was such a unique experience. I would recommend it to everyone and I can't wait to go back!!!

EvWazOf4dahHBrRCCT4LJQ.text: What an experience to enjoy with friends and family. The over atmosphere from beginning to end was amazing and your truly treated like family. The fact your in the dark truly does enhance your taste even on the simple items such as the water. The employees are super friendly and provide a world class service. I highly recommend this location for guest visiting Vegas and Locals. Do not miss this amazing dining experience.

0fR2mOGKd1hbLRjwbR37Mw.text: Most amazing experience a must do request Anthony as your server food is delish I have never experienced a place like this happy birthday to me thank you blackout for a great experience

wZkLN2-nVAhweIlYOVS3lQ.text: Great customers service! My date couldn't make it and I was all alone and nervous. My waiter Kory made sure I was taken care of and took time to explain everything. Everyone was very helpful. Had my own personal crumb scraper Anthony who also recommended a good burbon for me to try. And can't forget Tiki who went out of his way to find me paper napkins. Overall the experience was amazing even though I went alone. Can't wait to go back with my friends

CctJwvbQOh4TJv6o608-gA.text: Blackout was amazing! Nikki, the host was superb! She made us feel very welcomed and made sure every last detail was taken care of! Blackout has 3 "types" of meals, Savory, Spicy, and Sweet. My husband and I enjoyed the Spicy 4 course meal. Our server Daniel took great care of us, escorting us to our table in pitch black and informing us of every course change. It was the best experience!

HKWT3wmqpZC9dwgJj-5wqw.text: The dine-in-the-dark experience at Blackout is very memorable! My team and I went for their lunch service and were pleasantly surprised at just how much we enjoyed the experience. Our waiter, Anthony, was patient and kind as we got acclimated to total darkness. He did a fantastic job at describing our surroundings before each course. The food was AMAZING, and the staff paid close attention to our dietary restrictions. They change their menu every three months, and I can't wait to go back for more :-)

Ks8Dsf4L9M3wT8wGhsZC5w.text: Great dining experience. Food was delicious. Tiki, our waiter, was amazing-very engaged and amusing. Ask for him!!

kVjhka0BQTYeCW7O--xLEw.text: This is a complete rip off. It's about $70.00 per person. If you are in a group of 7 or more expect to spend at least $90.00 each person after gratuity.  Yes, there's 6 courses, however, each course is small and bland. It's a mystery  menu, all plant based food. The food was so disappointing, I don't even know where to begin. Honestly,  if the cost was only like $40.00 per person maybe I wouldn't be so upset. I can't help but feel cheated. Good service, unique experience,  but the whole point is to have your sense of taste and smell heightened. Well, mine was, and I was painfully aware of the lack of flavor and originality of each dish.

VY5U8L91LZG83vTk1DjOdg.text: This place is the place to dine for the most unique dining experience.  The atmosphere is perfect and so memorable.  Everything about this was fantastic.  They pay close attention to detail in the drinks, service and food and even the presentation you truly can feel it.  The food was so tasty mixed sweet, savory and spicy they brought that taste in every bite..  Great job blackout dining for making this such a incredible experience.  We can't wait to dine again!!  Chris our server was amazing and funny.  You won't go wrong with dining here if you love adventure and good adventures rich tasting food! Bit on the pricey side but this place isn't for everyday dining ...  also if you are a picky eater stay home.  drinks are not included ... however considering the price can someone consider at least tossing house wine with meal and a cold cappuccino option at end of meal.  Willing to trade the flower for wine.  Unfortunately flowers die but a bit of wine will help when you pay the bill.

JjMCzt6keuKaQ2wu9WRgRA.text: Really great and different experience! Our server was Daniel and he did such a great job waking us through it all. He guided our hands and was very knowledgeable about the menu and the experience overall which made me less nervous. You literally can't see anything and it's so great! You hear ppl in the distance and it feels like you're Ina movie with faint voices in the background. Great and different date night option :)

IzEsDnXN0JLjALfk9eP-aQ.text: So fun! Food was yummy! Staff did a great job explaining things and making me feel comfortable!

fLfgfb1Ejb2VQShw3LyOGg.text: The experience itself is very fun. However, the food was terrible. The first course wasn't bad but was something I wouldn't choose to eat. The second and third course was not edible. The desert was so sickeningly sweet no one at the table ate it. The food was a vegan menu but they didn't tell us that. Could be a good concept, but is a waste of money.

KBrM9-boTwWGgRmpoqcVxw.text: Went here on a whim - locking for something different for date night.  Great concept.  There was a little bit of ambient light from the exit sign and the night vision worn by the staff, but you certainly can't see in the traditional sense.  Options for food are somewhat limited; be prepared to get your fingers dirty!  Fun to try and guess what you are eating as the menu is a secret until you leave. Victoria, our server, took great care of us, making sure w were comfortable and enjoyed ourselves. Take the time to enjoy the shifting energies in the room as people cone and go. Let your other senses reach out and experience eating in an uncommon way!

v30b23RtK-zozrMa3oz9SQ.text: The service was 5 star but I gave it three stars because the food was blah. Ashley our server was the best. She took the time to explain and made the experience so much fun for us. The cost is around $70 per person (not including cocktails) those are extra about $14 per drink.  We used  a yelp voucher. $55 for $70 worth of food. 6 course meal not good at all sorry to say. The chef needs to improve on the flavors to make this place a success! All vegetable menu hope they add some meat in the near future. We were told the menu will change in January hope its better so we can return!

tZNxRS5PCwtmPfQnwcR3ig.text: Such a great experience!  Our server Ken made us feel like experts and calmed our nerves upon our first visit.  Would definitely recommend!

xeL0S8lstqw8wkwa2p8f-g.text: First off, I would like to say the experience was way cool and our Server Angel was absolutely amazing. If it wasn't for her, I probably would of given this 2 stars. Why you ask? I'm still freaking hungry! For a 6 course meal, $60+ a person (not including drinks) and all vegan menu... I honestly expect more and feel slightly ripped off. If you are one for new experiences by all means try it but expect to hit up the closest McDonald drive thru after. I was so hungry after, I even told them when paying the bill... Living in Vegas, for the price I've paid I should not be this hungry and this broke (joking on the broke part).

ePOmX9tQNSgyEtpMZaLdJA.text: We had a fabulous time. The food looked delicious lol. Our waiter Kory was awesome for our 1st time experience. We looked forward to the next menu when we come back to Las Vegas. Kudos to Kory & the entire staff!!

1TFIKA5jt69zxC7LvK3aDw.text: The experience was great, but the food was not.  Only tasty course was the salad.  I wish we had known going in that it was a vegetarian menu.  Very overpriced for a subpar meal

CQh5j18_pffpGlJyWoZK0Q.text: This place is seriously awesome! My husband made reservations for my birthday and completely surprised me! Every staff member was extremely nice and helpful and it was so fun!! The food was delicious and it was a little hilarious trying to figure out how to eat without seeing the silverware haha The food is plant based but my meat-eating, picky eater husband loved the food and wouldn't have guessed it was plant based if he didn't know before. Everyone should experience dinning at this gem of a restaurant:)

jmzmiDqcB7D0WTPkaGU1pA.text: Unique/Fun/Great Experience! We dined in the afternoon which was a four course vegetarian meal (dinner is six course). This indeed is an all vegetarian restaurant. I am not vegan and never had a total vegan meal but I did enjoy it. Perhaps some people (if you're not vegan) may not be satisfied or feel full as some complain, but I didn't come for the food. I came for the great people I was with, to laugh a lot and for the unique experience and I really loved it.  I won't go into details because the other reviewers already did  but what I was happy to know in advance was to know and prepare myself for pure darkness....no shadows....nothing! When you first walk into the dining room you are like WOW...can't see a darn thing and your other senses kick in big time! It was a lot of fun but also makes you appreciate things you take for granted. Our waiter Willie was AWESOME and will make any anxiety/nervousness you have subside. He guided us through the entire experience and if you lose your way and need help finding a utensil, glass etc. (LOL!) he's right there to help you out. Being with a group of six was perfect because we were able to talk and hear each other easily. We laughed and laughed, had fun trying to find and maneuver things and tried to guess what we were eating. The young lady at the  front desk was super nice and friendly and we met the owner who just great. I hope you go...have fun!

4ofPe6_JU-LVexgt0X_ZtA.text: The grilled steak I ate was awesome!!! I've never eaten such delicious steak!!! And the mashed potatoes that went with it were so good!!! I ordered the sangria and it was a large glass filled to the brim with the most delicious sangria. I will repeat this experience.

wp3Z_0D5A9M7vZRT9feFbA.text: Great Experience!!! Food was great!!! And Our server Victoria was super nice. Definitely we'll come back... Thank you

0rr9mz-COFSwFrzu-V-N_g.text: This was an amazing experience. The food was excellent and Victoria was an amazing server! I will definitely eat here again!

J3XYHhLNQprKupxDs9JPgA.text: Cool experience!  We went with friends and we were giggling and enjoying ourselves the whole time. Eating in the dark was easier than I thought it'd be. Our waitress was great and helped us out and let us know where everything was every time a new plate was placed. I enjoyed not knowing what I was getting out in front of me. I got to eat things I would have never ordered on my own and it was a great branching out experience.  It was fun guessing what everything was or could be. Overall i have no complaints. Check it out, I guarantee it's not like any other dining experience you've ever had.  I'm sad some reviews are giving too much of the experience away as well. The whole fun of it was not to know anything. If you go expecting to eat certain things you've missed the point completely.

iWgis9APH8dWwmLhAzkazQ.text: It was a little pricey but the experience was definitely worth it and our waiter was hilarious! The food was really good, especially the entree.

SWF14EhcoSI-o8crUGM--w.text: Love this place, had such an amazing experience. The food was absolutely delicious!! On one of the dish I was wiping off the sauce with my finger and no one on my table even knew what I was doing until mentioned it. And the funny thing was when I told my friends at the table what I was doing, one of them yelled out ME TOO! Hahaha!! What a great time.

s5JRHbxlLacUHK55qPfgSA.text: Really an amazing experience! The food was fabulously delicious. Although I couldn't see the food, it felt like it was beautifully presented. We had a 4 course lunch meal. You only get to choose your drinks and the type of food flavor (spicy/savory/sweet). What a great experience. I will definitely come back again. Super friendly staff. Comfy dining, you can actually have a conversation without having to talk over others.

06L1ZjjYN519Agyi7aoKWg.text: I want to first point out this place is vegetarian. And to those who have complained about not being told up front or that there should be meat options let me explain that there is a good reason it is vegetarian. You are dining in PITCH BLACKNESS using your hands most if the time because using a knife would be impossible. Also with meat you run the risk of temperature issues. Imagine trying to bite in to meat or grabbing meat that is too hot, or with fish having issues with bones. So as someone in the business I say to those who are put off by the fact it is vegetarian I say to you suck it up and try it, a vegetable won't kill you and your going for the experience and that is the best part. Now moving on yes this place is PITCH black the only thing you can see is the floating light from the staffs night vision goggles.  My advice is too sit with closed eyes because trying to see any light puts a strain on your eyes.  Matt was our server and he was awesome. Very attentive and friendly. He really made our experience and if you go ask for him.  I will not spoil it and tell you the menu, trying to figure it out was the most fun. So my advice is go, have fun enjoy a new experience and some yummy vegetarian dishes.

lc5ywFhKlqfINKBmshjp1Q.text: I've heard of this concept, but never thought it would come to Vegas or it would be vegan. I went with my husband last night and it was the coolest experience ever. The staff was amazing and instantly made you feel comfortable sitting in a dark room. My husband was worried about the food but once he tried the first course he was happy and excited. Not being able to see your food and only rely on touch, smell and taste to figure out what it is was fun- now I know how babies feel trying foods for the first time. It was interesting discovering the different textures and trying to place all the flavors. It heightens your other senses. It's really a fun experience although kind of scary at first being led into a dark room to dine. But it's so freeing being invisible from the other diners and even yourself. The food was amazing I would definitely recommend this place.

lzARSOGvKh08-Y50Hxl6Zw.text: First, this is an ultimate sensory deprivation activity. It is more than dining, it is an eating adventure with a safety net - your guide/wait person. Ours was Nikki. She was fantastic. She was personable and helpful, which was necessary when you perform this task in absolute darkness. Second, the dining experience was a test of the smell, taste and touch senses. I felt myself concentrating more on what I was eating and how it tasted rather than electronics or the people around me. I believe this added concentration led to a greater appreciation of my meal. My companions were my family of 5, ranging from 16-the parents. There was a bit of nervousness in the beginning, but that fell away soon after beginning the meal. It was 7 courses of plant based food - salads, soups, savory, and sweet. I am a meat eater and left feeling very satisfied. The meal was expensive, but I looked at it as more than a meal; it was no less an activity as a show on the strip, albeit a little more interactive and potentially messy. So, for the price of dinner and a show, it wasn't a bad deal. Whether you're a tourist or a local, I would recommend dining in the dark at Blackout.

acLSeMJXeu328MNKsqdI6Q.text: I highly highly recommend. I loved this. My waitress was Nikki, absolutely loved her. She was perfect the experience itself is not even something to describe. Food was tasty and just hard to beat. All your senses heightened. It's great eating with friends, parents, a date. Go!!

gfhcBlNA5Eb8ph4n7uDT4A.text: I had to give this a 5-star review because this restaurant totally exceeded my expectations. Imagine having to sit at a table, eat dinner and converse with the person/people you're with all while being in the pitch-black darkness...and actually be ENJOYING IT. This is the place that made it possible. Not to mention, the food was amazing. I took my boyfriend here as a surprise date and we had an awesome and comfortable experience. Neither of us are vegan but I must say, this plant-based menu was both filling and highly creative. The staff was extremely kind as well. We will be returning, and next time the menu will be something new! (since they change it often).

TZvUPdSJAMWqLG2WZAaaBw.text: Foodies...Please note. This is a MUST do experience! The staff and service were phenomenal. Nikki and Daniel were great. Daniel really made this experience exceptional. All courses were tasty and after finding out what the courses were we were truly shocked at what we enjoyed since it was nothing that we would typically order or make. This experience definitely expanded out palates and appreciation for food. It is extremely convenient walking distance from the Rio.

nSqRKRZCf2L-evKvOzFZUA.text: This was such a fun and unique experience!My wife and I dined there last night and it was definitely something everyone should try at least once. The food was delicious and guessing exactly what you are eating is part of the fun.I was half right on some totally off on another.The staff was courteous and very friendly and while in total darkness I still felt comfortable and at ease.My wife and I recommend this restaurant whole heartedly

m-TW7TMvNnS65yRxe8m60w.text: I really enjoyed the experience! What a way to boost your senses. I had the vegan menu selection. Obviously I can't post a photo ha ha !

OXbiNlGYEbTexYO3Fs2VBQ.text: Such a unique and fun experience. The staff was also super friendly. The food was great!

6rsjmj9G2d5A71BV7ZoEvA.text: Delicious meal. Unique experience. Everyone should try it once, at least.   They really should play better music. Wasted opportunity. The electro-jazz is beyond banal,  but the company and food was so good it didn't ruin it for me.

9TYi6IMeTOlPutrupYfnyA.text: Great food and what an amazing experience. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. It was like nothing I have ever seen or tried. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone vacationing or living in Vegas. We did it in the dark and it was worth it!

CiYsKsOpcj1KH0bCraLqHA.text: This was absolutely the best dining experience I've had! It was an excellent way to celebrate my birthday. The service was impeccable and the food is unlike anything I've ever eaten before. You won't be able to request your server, but if you happen to get Christopher to help you with your dining needs, you'll be in great hands. The server guides you through your dining experience and is essential to the proper journey. We were so lucky to have an attentive, jovial, and descriptive server in Christopher. Eating at Blackout is like a riddle wrapped in a mystery. It was worth the time and money for this once in a lifetime experience. 5 stars aren't enough, but it's all Yelp will allow. Bottom line: do yourself and your taste buds a favor and go to Blackout.

-i-TiTaOUK2Iub8oAwr3Uw.text: This is quite the experience. Its interesting to eat food when you cannot see a thing. My husband was somewhat nervous because he said since you cant see you cant tell if anything is dirty he has a point and hopefully it was clean ha ha but the experience was interesting. It does heighten ur senses and we tried to guess what the food was. We already knew it was vegetarian from the reviews which is a good thing because i am. My husband had the wine pairing which was not very good but the food was mostly good and the service was good too and the price isnt bad for 6 courses.

YLOE54KY6-7Pgdfzpl15OA.text: This was a super fun date night! To say it was a "unique experience" does not give it justice.   You get to indulge in a six course meal being served to you in pitch black darkness using only your sense of touch, taste and smell. The restaurant will adhere to any dietary restrictions that you give them. The food provided did not require me to use my knife, so that was good. Your fork, spoon, and fingers get the job done!   I think my favorite part was that you have to lock up your cell phones and watches (basically anything that might emit light or sound) in a locker outside of the restrooms. You get to keep the key on you.   The servers use your first name each time they speak to you. They inform you of where things are by referring to "time". Example, your fork is at 9:00, your drink is at 2:00, etc. The Rachel Collins was my cocktail of choice and it was very good! They will provide you with a bib upon entering the dining room if you want one, I opted not to and was totally fine. They give you a free pair of sunglasses upon exiting the dining room and I highly recommend you take that! Even though it was evening, the minimal light in the entry way felt like I was staring directly into the sun!   Put this place on your list for dinner the next time you need to get out of your dining rut. You'll leave with a smile on your face, and a story to tell people.

C6W46SYPFB9s_TPMCSLIwg.text: This was a great experience.  The food was delicious. Our server, Nicole, was great. We'll be back again when the menu changes.

ydkpD-S_O-LsjKF_sv5Gtg.text: My family and I went tonight for the first time. It was more than I expected! And yes, it was pitch black!  But it made you use your other senses and made you stop and really pay attention to your foods tastes and textures. That took eating to a whole new level. Everything was amazing! It was just as fun for us all to try to guess what we were eating. And we were right on only a couple things. Ha!    Our server Anthony was hilarious. He made us feel comfortable as we entered the darkness and explained perfectly where our drinks, plates, and silverware were located. He impersonated several actors and movie lines and was on point!    If you're visiting Vegas or are a local, you've got to try Black Out. When we visit again in the near future we'll definitely come back! The owners have done an amazing job.

UquQXgkr8jUsmfhCCxSJ1w.text: This place was different lets start there.. eating in the dark is strange BUT awesome.. the waiter was great, he directed us to our table and told everything that was on our table.. the food was really good if I could see it I'm sure my plate was clean after each course.. this is an experience that if u want to try it is worth it

zVV8VZPgzs7saXY2CvKZ-g.text: This was an experience.  That's it. I'll chalk it up to buyer beware.  No price was indicted ahead of time. But There is no meat. It's all "fake" even the menu at then end tries to say its meat. But it's not. The chicken and scallops is not chicken and scallops. Everything is drenched in a sauce.  It was pitch black which is a crazy thing.  It was 6 course overpriced "experience".  I'd have rather gone to chick Fila and blue man group. Or gone to a really expensive steak house and paid less for better quality actual food.

wLE4fd652UejhMnj8bQvfQ.text: Christopher was our server & let me tell you..... he made the experience a 5 star experience! Great energy to start the night off, extremely humorous & down to earth! I would highly recommend everyone to ask for him when experiencing this unique dinner!

WvaHMlzR4NFzlO_imHnT9Q.text: This is the most unique dining experience I've ever had.  The service was excellent and we loved the food. I would recommend it to everyone.

aD6FvPu0AQZ1-rWwUaoWLw.text: This place is awesome, and so much fun! I was a little concerned at first if the money was worth spending, but I immediately enjoyed myself once it began.  The food was actually impressive, you could tell by the flavors that it was high quality stuff you're eating. Couldnt have asked for a better server,  Rosco was on point for everything, and he really added character and excitement to the whole experience,  so ask for him to be your server. Yes it's pricey, but it was so worth it.

IqwN2WZFE1rD0vtcOQT1Fw.text: That was seriously one of the coolest experiences I have ever had in my entire life. I was apprehensive going in but wanted to be open to trying something new and different. Our waiter, Anthony, put us at ease and was funny and attentive.  The food was superb; tasting items without knowing what they are and without sight is such an interesting experience, no preconceived notions because of what it looks like, you just dive in and enjoy. Your senses are heightened, your conversation is more freely flowing, your inhibitions are down. You have no distractions of cell phones. I highly recommend trying it!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Dui_XIE5jgGTtpTdfpVGA.text: We went for dinner here last month and the whole experience was different but great! Our server Rosco was beyond amazing!  Even though I am a super picky eater, I still enjoyed every dish (my favorite were the first 2 dishes and dessert). If you're looking for a cool experience and enjoy eating a lot, I highly recommend it!

Tuc2T-UI5i71gAdZkijlwQ.text: We decided to spend New Year's Eve over a fancy dinner and skip the drunken parties. I'd needed a reason to go to Dining In The Dark for a minute, and the holiday seemed like the perfect opportunity.   You have to understand a few things:  Firstly, this is not an experience for someone who is "precious". If your going to be demanding and high maintenance, go somewhere you can pick your food, ogle the waiter, and try to look alluring over candlelight.   Secondly, the whole point of dining in the dark is so that you fully immerse yourself in the experience of dining, without distractions. Yes, it's a mystery menu. That's part of the point.  Thirdly, I learned something about myself I would have never notified before. I was eating my entree and it was incredible! I think this was the fifth course. I was so full by that point I stopped eating. Our waiter came by and asked if I was done, and I replied honestly that I wasn't sure... I couldn't see how much food was left on my plate. The moral of the story is, without the visual cue to keep eating just bc the food was there, I stopped eating when I was satiated.  The food was excellent and the experience was eye opening (pun quasi intended). Would definitely recommend for foodies and adventurers alike.

-_4c0ARkii9BflZNVm1xRQ.text: We had a great experience with the concept but the food was only marginal.  They tried to do to much with the fake meat(plant based) items and since there is no menu you do not no this until you start eating.  I enjoy trying new things and a few of the items were good but several were not very tasty.  I should have read more reviews before we went but we went on the spare of the moment.  The waitress was great and was very attentive which made the experience great even though the food was not so great.  I believe they should give you an option when you get there of a plant based meal or one with real meat.  I do like my veggies but also like my meet.

_jXBGz-f5AShhsZNhXrx1w.text: Our server Rachel was amazing! The food was very good! We ordered the wine pairing with our food and it was the perfect accompaniment. I don't know why any people said they left hungry. I couldn't eat all courses because it was so much food. It is expensive but we enjoyed this unique experience. If you are a picky control freak with food, don't bother. The entire meal is out of your control.

VqPNSxbzJtsB6OZg_QpaPA.text: Just dined last night. Such an awesome dining experience! Shay really made it special for us def ask for a spot in her section! Keep an open mind it's definitely overwhelming at first but once you get comfortable it's so worth it! Hilarious dining experience and all of the food was awesome even though i kept forgetting where i placed it.

gV29zqrHRZO8ry36MxemkA.text: Wow.  From the beginning. Wow.  Once you enter, you put your belongings and anything that glows in the dark in lockers with a key you get to hold onto.  I used the restroom next (just in case), and it was very clean.  On my way out, I filled out and signed a waiver, I was asked about allergens and away we went!  Our server, Daniel, was top notch.  He made me feel safe, which is super important, especially when following someone and trusting them with your life through the pitch black darkness of the dining room.  He sat us safely down, I ordered a Rachel's drink (highly recommend if you like vodka) And away we went! Each course was awesome and he guided us through so we wouldn't knock anything down or get too messy.  I won't say anything more about the food.  It's an experience.  Your senses are heightened.  And the experience in itself was amazing.  I loved every aspect of it.  You really get to just experience and appreciate good food in a whole different light.  Go in with an open mind. And it's all uphill from there.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food.  Jk, no phones or light inside the room.  Your food will look like this.  Super tasty!  Trust your senses
Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The inside waiting room

D2y8QpKv7ntcvOUjgSMxXg.text: My husband and I just tried this place for the first time and it was PHENOMENAL! What an experience it was. Rosco, our waiter, made everything ten times better with his personality and we felt comfortable enough with him to blindly follow him, literally! Our helper at the table, Willy, was also very attentive. They were so extremely helpful and the FOOD! It was so delicious. I'm very much a meat/steak eater and I usually hate most the things that was on the menu, yet I didn't realize it until I had already eaten and thoroughly enjoyed it. It was truly such an amazing experience and we would recommend it for anyone! Ask for Rosco though!

91-xAuGx1XahRRaagi2Vpw.text: Amazing Experience!   I'm not going to lie, it was quite expensive.  However, it was $80 for 7 course meal + blackout dining experience. I think it's worth it for the first timers!   Meal in general was pretty good (probably 3.5-4 stars), our server, Rebecca, was amazing (5+ stars)!  This was one of the coolest dining experiences ever!

KZQ3hZAEW-UddV3pqDNFCQ.text: I am giving a low score due to the food served did not match the price we paid. We paid $200 for 2 people.  I feel the price should have been more like $100 for 2 people. I would have rather gone to a celebrity chefs restaurant in Vegas where I could see the food and take pictures of it to remember the experience.   The experience was interesting and different but again not worth the price.  If you are claustrophobic this can also be a little challenging.  You can not see anything at all it is pitch black.  It took me a few minutes to avoid from freakin out and wanting to leave.   Positive - the food comes out fast and waiter was nice.

_fm65vXWGL55rgaP-v5zhw.text: Came here for my birthday with my boyfriend. It was an amazing experience and our server, Rebecca, was awesome and had a great sense of humor.   We were the first ones there that evening, and walking in it was a little freaky - being totally alone in a pitch black room. But, again, Rebecca was fun to have as our server and made everything comfortable. We were able to order drinks from a menu before we walked in, and when we sat down, she went over where everything was on the table so we could feel our way around. Some items were finger foods, some you needed a fork, but you were always told the best way to eat the course before digging in.   I unfortunately did have to use the bathroom during the meal, but Rebecca safely brought me out and in.   The food was all DELICIOUS and it was fun trying to guess what was on the plate. They were able to accommodate my soy allergy, and can accommodate nuts and gluten allergies as well, I believe. Really diverse dining experience.   COME HUNGRY, there are 7 courses!

W6gWo79QpaaOGA4jYjbKZg.text: Amazing experience. I'll absolutely be back.   I hate eating in even low light, so i was definitely nervous going in, but i quickly got used to it and totally enjoyed it. Rebecca was our waitress and she was hilarious and really fun to talk to. She was very descriptive and we were never lost.   Everything was really tasty. We all joked how classy we all were being, digging in with our hands for majority of the courses. Many innuendos were made.   The game of "what are we eating" was half the fun. Without knowing what's in front of you, it's easy to eat something you usually don't like, but not immediately be repulsed because you don't know that's what it is.  Definitely recommend. Assuming you like fun and aren't a total spoil sport.

VDMHSf08M_vWq9nCJE9naQ.text: I am pretty disappointed and upset with this place. My friend and I were looking forward to going here, and enjoying the experience as well as the food, which I had heard was amazing. When my friend and I arrived they asked if we had allergies. My friend happen to be allergic to berries, including strawberries... Which ended with them telling up they couldn't serve us due to them serving strawberries and they could possibly cross contaminate.  I understand we are eating in the dark and they could be liable if something was to happen, but after reading that they make accommodations for others allergies, I was highly upset and disappointed we were turned away. I also looked over the website to see if there was any notice or warning stating if you are allergic to strawberries you might be turned away, which I couldn't find.  Again I understand the liability and all; I just wish it was stated somewhere on the website.

IWv0Xb0PmpTJJz2hzR5CIw.text: Great experience with my girlfriend and my friend. Food was 6-7/10 but we came here to experience anyway. Rebecca was our server and she was very nice and kind! One of my friends did not feel comfortable first but she made it comfortable enough for all of us. Pretty pricy but worth the money.

Xw8NIMGWnDYlRhL6GD3LVg.text: This place was awesome.  Totally different experience.  Don't go here if you are looking for your typical dining experience. Yes, it is vegan. Yes, you need to get over it and just let them surprise you. No, you don't get to pick your food. Yes, the food is unique and awesome. They are out to prove that dining can involve your other sensory faculties. Went there by myself. Didn't have anyone to talk to or dine with and it made it that much more interesting.  In fact, I found the conversations of the other diners to be a little distracting.  Would have been fun to have it be in complete silence as well.  That way you are focused on the food and the food only. Smell, taste, texture and that is it. Would be cool.   Have a family member that is 95% blind and this gave me a better understanding of what they are experiencing -- including why they use their hands the way they do. Would love to go back with them.    The food was awesome and the friendly servers help you along the way.    Awesome experience. Thanks again   Pic is of view inside the establishment.  That's about how much you can see.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GIypg37AwLwL8HVWekiEZg.text: If you are researching this place and if you have any thoughts of going... You must lead with your first mind and Gooooo!!!! Food... Service 5 's..... Amazing experience off the chains.. Our server Roscoe was super cool. Would definitely go back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sign explains it all.
Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The servers gear... Awesome

1x15UVS-7d1aAao1sNr_5g.text: One's tastebuds aren't the only thing that detect what type of food one is eating. When 100% of your vision is taken away, you would be surprised at how hard it is to discern what certain (even common) flavors are. And don't get me started on how much you want to use your fingers to see what and where things are prior to digging in with your silverware. (Put that napkin on your lap!)  Richard and I enjoyed a lunch date here today, and it had to have been the most fun dining experience we have ever shared together. From Priscilla's kindness at the front, to Kory's friendliness and humor throughout our entire meal, we definitely enjoyed the entire afternoon.   The food was to die for, and we found ourselves frustrated not being able to identify so many items! It was a fun relief upon paying for our meal at the end, though, when we got to read descriptions of what we were served.  We were told the menu changes around every five months. We cannot WAIT to return!   Biggest tip: come hungry!!!!

Y9JGJTn72qRiPZ0Cw-dprw.text: Such an awesome experience, we had so much fun. The dark is no joke, you can't even see your hand in front of your face. The food was great, with the 1st course and the main course being my favorites. We were so full when we left. The environment was comfortable, with many other people also dinning around us. You are able to see where servers are by their green and red lights, but they will still let you know when they are approaching your table. Our server Rebecca was great, very personable, and made this experience so easy. I highly recommend going with 2 people, plan for up to 2 hours, and expect about $80-$90 per person plus drinks. Don't hesitate, just do it!

oRrcSCwGGjtC8Xm6XNSv3Q.text: What a great night! Shoutout to our server Ken. He made us feel comfortable right from minute one. I have a gluten allergy and I'm usually hesitant to eating out. He talked with the kitchen and made me feel confident I was in good hands. The food was absolutely delicious. I was nervous that I wouldn't like something that was served because I can be picky sometimes but the opposite happened. Not being able to see what I was eating opened up my mind and allowed me to actually savor and enjoy the food I was eating. I also smiled the entire time. Taking away your sight and lights from things like your phone you are also able to connect and be present. The entire night was incredible and it will definitely be a go to spot of mine and my husbands. Would recommend 10/10.

PVKghNII-O0an-ctbZHsAw.text: My boyfriend took me out for an early Valentine's Day! I wasn't 100% so no crazy activites.  But had a lot of fun dining in the dark! Also our server Rosco was amazing - really took care of us especially since I'm not 100% comfortable with being in the dark...ESPECIALLY FOR 2.5 HOURS?! It didn't even feel like anymore than 30-45 minutes. Definitely an experience everyone has to try! And I feel like since they take away all the phones and technology around you - you go back to the 90's and everyone is talking to one another. The wine pairing was awesome and everything was a surprise. Definitely got hands on and messy with it. But the food was delicious and they really paid attention to not have it too hot so we were able to use our hands to figure out locations of items - as well as Rosco's description was fun and entertaining!! We did a 7 course with the bubbly and treats   Was definitely full after the whole thing... and they keep an eye out so your food comes out as you finished your last plate!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Right outside the restuarant
Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Photos of me and my bf  and our server Rosco!!

kqOjLTLjOan8-ge6sawxaA.text: This was my first experience at BLACKOUT, and it was an awesome one! The food was amazing and all vegan. Our waitress Sarah was perfect ! She made the best lemonade and had a great sense of humor. When we first arrived we were greeted by 'Julia' the hostess that night. She was unpleasant and quite rude. She bummed us out right when we arrived but Sarah picked up her slack. What made it worse was when we were leaving, Julia was rushing us and again was quite rude. I recommend going to BLACKOUT and seeing what it's all about! If you happen to have a run in with Julia I'm sorry for you and 100% request Sarah as your server.

8Q-TY5teaEDx1H-KYZK9Sg.text: This is hands down one of the neatest things I have ever done for dinner! Service and food were fantastic. I'm so excited to hear that the menu changes every 5 months because we will be coming back every time we visit Vegas. I was super skeptical and a little nervous but our southern belle waitress from Moultrie GA completely put me at ease the minute we walked in the door. She was amazing! For me one of the best parts was  putting everything away in a locker and being able to enjoy the company.  My husband and I haven't laughed so much at dinner. Quite an experience we will never forget!

HgPfJAhsphj3Ywz7xhSkoA.text: This is a great experience that we would highly recommend.  We received a gift certificate to dinner from our kids for Christmas.  We were in Vegas and had the opportunity to have dinner.  Our waiter Roscoe and the entire staff was outstanding.  We had the 7 course dinner with wine pairings.  Absolutely a great way to go and the pairings were terrific.  Each course brought a different experience.  They were mostly great ones with one perhaps one that was just OK.  But that is a matter of taste.  Plenty of food and very tasty, good textures, awesome dessert.  The experience in the dark is truly unique.  Once you are in and settled, it is fairly easy to get comfortable.  Nice music, the sounds of laughter and chatting, and the wait staff very attentive.  Guessing what it was that we were eating and even trying to guess the wine pairing in the dark was challenging.  The menus afterwards were very eye opening.  Do not ask or tell ahead of time, it would diminish the fun of the experience.   Going as a group of 4 or 6 would be fun.    High recommendation to do something different and interesting.  The staff was fantastic!

Yw4A8eO6wKbXfP8CQebk7g.text: This was a super fun experience. Not for nothin, but Rosco was hands down the best server. He was so funny and accommodating! He is the best. I highly  recommend this place. Unique and fun. You must do the wine pairing for only $35 more. Generous pours and it totally  enhanced our experience.
