Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f3ACh2AcbdI3UhOHBI0q0w.text: Very interesting concept! Really haven't experience anything like this.   You literally lose your sense of sight & rely on your other senses to make this such a unique experience. Honestly, if you want to take someone out on a date to solely get to know their personality, this place would be it!  So you go inside and sign a waiver and pick out what you would like to drink for the night. You are then led into a dark room and seated at your table by a guide who wears night vision goggles & is able to see everything you can't. Jealous...  Slowly, you are served your 7 course meal one at a time. You are not told what you are eating so that it makes it an exciting experience of asking your partner what you think you're eating. Each server has their own way of vaguely describing your meal, so hopefully you have a good one!   It's such a trip to eat your food, try & guess what it is, feel the different textures/playing, talk to your partner, listen to the music, & simply hear everyone else's convo! In the end, you finally get to see a list of foods you tried. You should have a betting game with others at your table to see who got the most items correct!   While this experience was very different & unique from anything that I've ever experienced, the food was not my cup of tea and my sangria wasn't as tasty as I'd like. & I wasn't special enough to get a rose like others lol. But hey, this experience is worth a try. You get to cross something off your bucket list!

5l8ezXUNqtDvVfJb8VrJhA.text: I have been wanting to try Blackout Dining since they opened, after a bit of arm twisting and convincing the rest of the party to join me for lunch, we finally tried this experience.   What a great choice, the staff was very helpful and we enjoyed laughing along with them. All of the courses were amazing, come with a open mind and you defiantly will not be let down.   Hats off to the chief, Corey and the rest of staff, we will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NUVteIQ21Kp1G2KX63yksA.text: Willie was great! Awesome food- def felt full afterwards!  A little nerve wracking at first but Willie put us at ease and made us feel safe!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I8_heRNefFRiSdDXO3RLEA.text: This was a very unique and enjoyable experience! The staff was very informative, helpful and friendly. The instructions given by our waiter was to the tee and very easy to understand. I took my wife for her Birthday and we had a blast every dish of the way - from trying our "food expertise" side to guess what was on the plate was a great game. We didn't have any food allergies but they ensured at checkin of any. I would definitely recommend this restaurant and don't forget to have fun!

r93SLPyiUZlCMXlIM4_4Yg.text: If you are adventurous then this is the spot for you! I came here on my birthday and it was such an amazing experience. The whole experience was so mysterious. Trust is so important here as you will not know what you will be eating.   You start off by placing all your belongings in a locker. This includes anything that lights up so be prepared to not have any access to your cell phone.   You are then giving some shades to wear and you walk into a pitch dark room being lead in by your waiter with your hands on his shoulder for him to guide you to your table. I couldn't see anything. I admit it's scary at first and anxiety of the unknown was getting the best of me but once i sat down it was the most amazing dining experience.  Something about sitting in the dark and not knowing the food that was being served was exhilarating. Your sense of smell, taste, and touch is enlighten. The best part of this experience is that it generates great conversation and avoids you from being distracted by people watching or messing with your cell phone to check on social media.   The food was good and the music set a great atmosphere. It's a 6 course meal. This is where I had to knock off a star. I felt the food could've been a bit more variety. It felt like dishes were vegetarian. Don't get me wrong it was good but I feel a menu that provides a dish with protein was the missing factor to complete the experience. I know it's kind of hard to serve a protein dish in the dark to be able to cut things up but bite size pieces could be an option. We are in Las Vegas and I've had many food joints here serve incredible dishes so perhaps that's why I'm a little harsh rating the menu. I was full by the end of the 6th dish so that is a plus. At the end is when they will reveal to you the menu. It was fun using my taste buds to guess the food we were eating then at the end seeing if we were right.   The service was top level as they were right there to refill drinks and the timing between each course was perfect. They knew when to arrive and provide clean utensils after each meal so that old flavors didn't transition to the next meal. They described each dish and gave you great instructions on how to eat the dish.   I highly highly recommend this type of dining experience. It's a great place to celebrate an anniversary, birthday, or as a date as you will get to the know the person more intimately.   They change their menu ever 3 months so make sure to give them a call to check if you decide to return. I look forward to coming back in the future! They got a fan right here!   Advice: use the restroom before going in. The transition from pitch dark to light feels like your eyes were dilated. Your gonna be squinting and trying to adjust back to light. You don't want to go in and out believe me. Best is to stay in there for the entire dining.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

ciHwRvjQGyq344ij6c2MXw.text: We had a really great time. Willie was outstanding as was our hostess with the cool tie.

tEHum282-0VJK3vvdempcA.text: Great place for an experience, you won't get anywhere else. My girlfriend brought me for my birthday and we had so much fun. I can't say what we ate but the food was surprising and decent. It's the fact that you're in complete darkness and don't know what you're eating until the end. We were able to talk to each other like never before because we weren't glued to our phones. (you have to leave them) A fun time in Vegas.

3qS_MZKFIGrzPk9c647Dnw.text: Great experience, wonderful food,  Priscilla was an excellent hostess and Cory was an exceptional guide/waiter.   I recommend this restaurant to anyone who is an adventurous eater or is looking for distraction free dining.

rGwfM-9i4p5ZvqX8R15TCA.text: What a unique experience and honestly the food was great. Being well accustomed to plant based and vegan food already, I will say that this place does a superb job with flavor and variety.  Our server Kory was entertaining and knowledgeable. Overall definitely worth the price and the experience!

WHvCpPrERhxYN-xsKZJxrQ.text: My wife surprised me with a double date with our friends to this place. I've never heard of it, so when we arrived I was super excited to try it out! I didn't know what to expect to be dining in the dark. But I get nervous as it is eating in front of people, so this was a savior!   The lobby was super nice, clean, modern, worthy of posting on social media. Lol. The staff was super nice and personable. We signed in using their laptops. We also were given lockers to place our phones / wallets, anything that would be a distraction or shine light. I thought was cool because I'm all for not being glued to our phones.   We were given instructions on what to do prior to entering the dark dining room. Our server was Victoria. She was amazing! Super nice. Patient. Informative. Etc.   The room is pitch black. So dark you can't see a thing. But the experience was awesome! I left there being thankful for my eyesight! Lol. The food was delicious too. Each course was yummy.   It is on the pricey side, but definitely worth every penny. I would highly recommend and we all agree we would return. Check it out!!

gpfIxwvbqjhyPE0xjxXMbg.text: Not gonna lie as a black man I thought my girlfriend lost her damn mind bringing me to some cult sacrifice a the virgin type place but I quickly realize it was a restaurant were you in the dark. This was so much better than when you can't pay your light bill and have to eat in the dark. Seriously though this was really enjoyable I would have never eaten some of the thing I ate if I would have know what it was. They are a bit pricey but definitely worth the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JCCv1dHcivUI7opuHK4dtw.text: My sister in law and I decided to overcome the fear of something new...dining in the dark! What a great experience! You absolutely cannot see a thing. Travis took care of us from start to finish. He lightened the mood with some jokes. It was great. I managed to guess a few things I tasted. I was stuffed by the time we finished lunch. I would definitely like to come and experience the dinner menu.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice comfy couch
Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ready for an experience!

8EymjRh05XgTr8ReNPbfTw.text: I just had a really fun experience for Mother's Day! It was my first time at Blackout "Dining in the Dark" and it was awesome! Eating in pitch black really heightens your senses especially taste! Once you are guided into the dining room, you literally cannot even see your hand right in front of your face. Every course was exceptional -sorry, I can't give it away or it ruins the fun! The second course was my favorite, but honestly everything was very well seasoned and a great mix of textures and flavors. Although you can't see the plating, it's very well thought out and the plates and bowls are well suited for each part of the meal. Plus, it was plenty of food, we were stuffed when we left, and even the cocktails were delicious. They let you read a menu before you leave so you can see what you ate - I guessed all but one sauce, and I wanted to taste it again afterwards because I was so far off! Our guide/server Rebecca was super fun and helpful. I would highly recommend that everyone go at least once (they completely change the menu every few months!) Shoutout to owners and crew for a truly unique and enjoyable dining experience! This was the only picture I was able to sneak in, but I guess my flash didn't work!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

KWe3RDSWzInB0qViDB8DYw.text: Truly a one of a kind (Birthday)Experience..!!! Unfortunately, we where not lucky enough to receive a flower at the conclusion of our dinning experience. (Rats) Victoria, Had us laughing out loud she was comical and sweet.  It would be a super fun idea to see the photos of the dishes along with the menu at the end of the meal!!!! Still puzzled and wondering..!! Can't wait to go back for a Luchtime Experience. Thank you to the Staff for the friendly service and memorable time!!!!

AOwx-xYekXLY1KDNyvTGpw.text: Super fun and interesting experience! The food was delicious and the service was outstanding! I would definitely go back next time I'm in town. Big groups would be very fun!

J7ntknTDSXg2v3hiS9sM2A.text: I recommend this for the experience which is very unique. But the cost is steep for the value of food you get. You wont leave hungry, but you may not leave satisfied

P6OI2SHiFXT2-DEcnf-1IA.text: This was an amazing experience.  I was very apprehensive at first but the staff and our waiter Roscoe was amazing.  You are in complete darkness but the staff helps you feel comfortable and the food was amazing.  Great gift, wonderful experience even for those afraid at first.

iR9dHHZwXuzbCQKWoxUqDg.text: I wanted to love this place, I tried to love this place, but I just couldn't.  When it comes to experience and service they deserve 5 stars. Our waiter Daniel was fun and  informative. The 6 course meal spread out over approximately 3 hours felt like we were in a time loop when we were brought back to the light. Having no cellphones available was refreshing and we had a great time figuring out how to manage ourselves in the dark.  The food however fell short. Without giving anything away the caliber of food felt more like a bad deli's takeaway section instead of a restaurant at $70 per person price point. The dishes lacked depth of flavor and complexity, after the first two courses we lost excitement in our future courses. I personally enjoy vegetarian meals quite often and eat pretty healthy however these dishes felt very plain, simple and I can't even say it was well prepared. If the food was a higher caliber I would have been much happier with my experience. I hope they find a way to revamp their menu so the food is as good as the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YUQbxHIZb-Gln8z3hxl1eQ.text: Not sure why there are so many great reviews. Love the concept and the experience was great but the food and the wine pairing just wasn't very good. A couple of the courses I would just take a bite of and be done (this is saying something as I am a BIG eater who loves everything and never has leftovers). The wines are mostly sub $10 bottles. Then at the end you get hit with a $350 bill (for 2)! Can name 100 meals that are significantly better for a tenth of the price. Went with a group of 10 and this was the general consensus. Can't remember ever being this letdown by a meal which is why I'm posting about it. Very rarely post.

Nui34b12t9E0FwJPR0zJYw.text: What a fun experience! Every course was delicious and was each a different experience. Our waiter, Chelsea, was very nice. I went there to celebrate my birthday and it will definitely be a birthday I will remember. I would recommend coming there hungry so you can finish all the courses. I will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2i098T7cA-VIGr7N3JWcpA.text: Excellent night out for dinner at blackout with a group of six in town for a convention. The meal was great, the experience was bizarre in a great way, and our server Rebecca had the perfect combination of banter / heckling / charm. Highly recommend this place.

zNoQKUWeuW1KLc2FszYj_Q.text: As this was our fourth time going we already knew what to expect! It was my husband and my 1 year wedding anniversary and there was no other romantic place that we could choose from.   We are both Vegan so we knew that we would be getting amazing food.   That was not the case, the hostess asked if this was a special occasion and we did mention that it was our anniversary but there was no acknowledgement of our anniversary.   We were cool with that because we are a same sex couple and we understand how people may react. We were also shocked how the bottle service was going to be $35 which is more expensive than the bottle of wine they served. That should have been our first sign of actually leaving.   When the waitress came up from she made a comment with a small attitude about so you call me up here for a two topper but there are multiple two topper which one is mine.   The waitress provided wonderful service but it didn't make up for the sub par quality of food.   The first entree the waitress went ahead and said you may have already had this which we did, and I was already disappointed. We know that the menu changes every couple of months and the last time we went was back in August 2017. 2nd entree was very disappointing as if the restaurant didn't know what to do so they just scrapped a couple of things together and served. The third entree they used gardein products and I was extremely disappointed as prior time they were able to put together a meal and make it delicious and having us use are palette.   The fourth entree was ok as it wasn't anything to fancy. The fifth entree was definitely a huge disappointment as the veggies were under cooked and the starch was over cooked and the fake meat once again came up again. The dessert came and it was good. The first and last dish was probably the only thing I real enjoyed at the restaurant .  Upon paying my bill I was extremely shocked that the price went up another $20 per person which I do understand that if it's a high demand restaurant that you gotta do what you gotta do but at least make the meal worth $80 per person. I don't think I will be coming back again.

SkcS02zTCUntxkL-qFPHqg.text: This was the best dinner I've had in Vegas.  Great food and awesome experience. Service was the best!  We'll be back next time in time with more people. Our waiter Willie was super helpful and interesting as h#$$. We'll done!

cYBLzuZgfTkFCNwtijnvyg.text: Very unique experience! We didn't even know that it is vegan restaurant. Great food,great idea Plus Great service from Rebecca!

DWq54xHGd-m826mriNbZVg.text: Ok, I had an anxiety attack in the dark. Not scared of the dark, but something like agoraphobia. Hard to explain. I had to calm myself for a minute and then after that, it was super fun. Food was good and probably made more memorable by the fact that you had to really concentrate on tastes and textures to decipher what you were eating. Surprisingly, not messy. Does make you appreciate your sight. The waiter will tell you where everything is and how best to eat. Not something the sightless always have the luxury of. Although we did hear another table spill their drink.   The price would be prohibitive in thinking about coming back, but I definitely enjoyed the experience. I really should think of the value of the meal as including entertainment, not just the food. When I think of the cost as just the price of food, I think it's a little steep, even if I were to get something like that on the strip. What counted most was that my partner enjoyed their birthday meal. A little chocolate liquor shot too the place if a birthday cake. You know, no candles and all.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Photo of my food

WkA0jepS9--zJgauXgdYOA.text: Dining in pitch black is a fun and interesting concept but the food was horrible.  $280 for two what you get are literally freezer/microwave food -- not even the good kind.  Honestly not able to see makes it even worse bc for one I'd never put those things in my month if I'd see what they were. Instead I had to take a bite and spit out.  Dessert was a joke lol tasted like those cheap chocolate frosting you can buy at Safeway top your cupcake.  The service was great, music was good.  At the end the reception showed us the menu and asked me what was my fav, honestly, the sparkling water.

S1O8VtfPw0AlH_lxMIhx7g.text: What an experience!!!! I saw this restaurant while watching late night TV and knew I had to see this for myself. It's encouraged to make reservations ahead of time to ensure you get a seat in the restaurant. Upon arriving, the staff goes over allergies and provides a small locker to put any belongings in that may cause a flash of light (watch, phones, beepers etc). I suggest you use the restrooms first before sitting down to avoid the dark to light, but if assistance is needed, the host will guide you out to the restroom.   Unfortunately there isn't too many pictures here because everything is in the dark. Your host will have you hold onto their shoulders and you shuffle your feet into the dark room. The host wears night vision goggles so they can see you and your food.  If you need assistance, just raise your hand and they sneak up on you. You can barely see them walking around with a little green dot. They explained each dish based as descriptive as they can without giving away the actual food you're about to devoi  Your eyes won't adjust as much as it wants to. The experience takes about an hour to hour and a half depending if you're pushing on time. We went to dinner for $80 a person for a 7 course meal.   Each course was delicious in its own way. It was more fun to use your hands and eat like a slob without your date seeing the messiness. I used my napkin as a bib and told him it was on my lap. We also tried feeding each other at one point during dinner service and that was hilarious! I first got his arm and accidentally spilled it on his hand. Sorry other patrons if we were the loud ones during your visit.  Although super fun, they don't change out their menu often. Their last update was December 2018 and I dined here June 30, 2019.  It's an experience I won't forget but it's not something I can do multiple times. But if you're in town and looking for something crazy and different to do, this is THE place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They give you a rose at the end of the experience
Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The night vision goggles!
Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me and my fellow yelp buddy Des!

PmhZaChNSarlGVYBYeGwYg.text: I'll admit it. I was nervous. A friend convinced me to give it a go and I am so glad I did!!   I'd love to tell you about the decor or how pretty the food was, but it's literally dining in pitch blackness. You can't see anything. Every once in a while, your eyes will catch a tiny bit of light - maybe a red light on the server's night vision goggles, but it is pitch black. No joke.   The price is high - $80 per person plus tip. But it was worth it. So incredibly worth it.   When you walk in, the lobby almost seems like a sterile environment... the smell, the decor, everything really. You put your belongings in a locker & wash your hands, then they take you to your table by forming almost a conga line. They seat you, tell you where everything is & how to find it. Then the food comes  They don't tell you in advance what the menu is, that way you can try to guess what things are. I guess that was fun but my taste buds are not that good. I had some of everything, which maybe was a mistake because by the time the main course came around... I was full! It's a 7 (8?) course meal, so you get a LOT of food.   Definitely make a reservation for this place. And go with some adventurous people. You'll have more fun that way.   I can't recommend this place enough. It was such a fun & unique experience!

cezfBP7uNp4qmHISuWucvg.text: GO GO GOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!  Not only is it "an experience," I found the food to be very delicious and filling. I think half of my group of 9 was full by the 5th course. I won't ruin it by saying what we ate but, we got to see the menu & was pretty shocked. Not cuz the food was "weird" per se but maybe I'm not the foodie I thought I was lol   For not being able to see each other for a couple hours; it was REALLY FUN!!!! haha  Just the thought of all the giggles my friends and I had before, during, and after dinner made it a memorable night.  Pro tip: wear black clothes just in case you spill something on them!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was fun!!!!!

30PXajSTeb-06JEBgC7FNQ.text: What a great experience.  A fun way to challenge how you look at food (pun intended). If you are adventurous, try this experience.  You are given a locker for your cell phone and then your wait person escorts you in to a surprisingly dark dining room.  Your other senses kick in and you began to smell more and become very aware of the sound in the room; the sound of others having dinner and the music.   The food comes in several courses.  The first course had me stumped, but as the meal went on, I was able to start getting some of the things figured out.  Fun to touch, smell, and taste to guess what you were being served.  I drank a lot of water to keep cleaning my palette so that I could guess my next course.    I came out of the meal surprisingly full.  I found myself ignoring my mixed drink because I wanted to be able to guess all of the food flavors.  I liked the creativity.  Shout out to Roscoe my server who took great pride in giving me a great experience.  For those that have claustrophobia, the darkness could be a bit unsettling.

UOfesFZNTSGq96ZtJfkrdA.text: An excellent experience in 100% Total Darkness. The most unique & memorable dining experience with a 7 course meal.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An excellent experience in 100% Total Darkness. The most unique &amp; memorable dining experience with a 7 course meal.

34Ayegymv3bUE7ayFyA81Q.text: This is an experience! It is exactly what it's title indicates. BLACKOUT! You are dining in complete darkness & are being served food you have no idea what it is until the end of the dinner. (Atleast that was my dinner experience) there is a couple courses and the waiters are hilarious & continued to have the table laughing. The food was decent not what I had expected & maybe not something I would come back to eat again & again. However the experience was neat!

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

wq31G3uW2GCwuhB-P4kEcA.text: I absolutely loved this experience. The food was incredible and the service was top notch. I especially love the plate descriptions, not what the menu item was, more along the lines of the shape of the dish, enticing the senses to do more than just devour.   I'm glad they waited until the end to share what each dish was, it was a lot of fun trying to guess the flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JvoCiWm-H6xZ_aMmm8Dc9Q.text: BLACKOUT reached out and invited me back. They reassured me they will be more well prepared for problems like that. Although I may not be able to go back anytime soon, I really appreciate the nice gesture. Like I said in my previous review, everything else other than the flashing light were great, I even liked the menu. Hard to believe how much fun it is to eat in the dark. It is certainly something everyone need to try, at least once. Thank you again.

oXW5FocaAG9nlLwBREs8BQ.text: I made my reservation for this unique dining experience several days in advance with a special note that one of the people in my party had a nut allergy. The menu is a mystery because you're supposed to use your senses to figure out what you're eating in the dark. I flew out to Vegas and got a Lyft over to the restaurant. Upon arrival, we were told that they saw our note in the reservation but were unable to serve anyone with a nut allergy due to one dish having pistachio. No accommodations could be made, and that was that.   I found the whole ordeal to be pretty unprofessional and really the biggest disappointment of the trip. We wasted time, energy, and money on a cab to be turned away when they could have called me ahead of time to let me know they would not be serving us. You'd think that for $75+ per person that they'd want to do anything possible to keep the business.   While I did not get the opportunity to dine here, there would have been no photos anyway as the dining room is pitch black.

2lvRH5WHgrpnC9gnEdfCRA.text: Being my second time at BLACKOUT, I knew what to expect but that didn't make it any less enjoyable. This experience is extremely unique and allows for me to get out of my comfort zone. I highly recommend this as a fun date or friend dinner night. Something about the dark heightens the mood and all other senses, especially the tastebuds!   The food was incredible. Each dish was unique and full of flavor, I loved all of it both visits. I love bringing people here who are not comfortable with plant based food, they always leave surprised and satisfied.   Our server, Sara was amazing. She made the entire experience top notch. Her voice was extremely soothing, and she maintained great service throughout the entire experience. We thoroughly enjoyed her company. She also mentioned they will be doing a Halloween themed dinner so we will definitely be back.   There was only one person that stopped my experience from being a 5 star. Julia, the front desk/receptionist, the first point of contact through this experience. From the start she was rude and standoffish. I was not pleased with her introduction, especially when we were about to spend over $80 a head on dinner. After dinner, her attitude was even worse. She wanted to get us out of there as quick as possible. Julia was not personable and I was extremely dissatisfied with her service. I would expect a lot more from someone handing me a $300 bill. I would not have her customer facing in my business.

fn5M72xCrL_oWLrbvH2sAg.text: We were very pleased with the whole experience, our server Kory guided us comfortably through it. The food was excellent and the music was delightful! Definitely recommend anyone to try it... Thank you for making our anniversary unforgettable!

PxukTfA9jG6t_C91Rg3ZEQ.text: Okay! Here's the deal with this place. It's a super unique dining experience with really pleasant and delicious dishes, but in complete darkness. You can't see a thing. I have been here twice now and I can honestly say I both times were fantastic. If you haven't been and you are up for strangely satisfying, one of a kind experiences, you absolutely need to go!   Our server, Sara, (Sarah?) was very hospitable and helpful. Her service was excellent and went above and beyond your regular expectations. I would only hope to get her as my server again at my next possible visit.   The only flaw in this experience, and the only reason I deducted a star, was the person who is the first and last point of contact at the establishment. Julia was not blatantly mean or anything crazy, but she definitely wasn't personable either. I didn't feel very welcomed coming in, and also felt rushed going out. As a matter of fact, I felt as if she did not like us for whatever reason. Maybe she was having a bad day? Who knows. Anyways, step it up a little, Julia! Having been in the food service industry for 10 years, I know that is not how you act with / treat customers. You set the course and the mood for the ENTIRE visit of each and every customer. You also leave the very last impression and give them the last thing they will remember when they leave. Don't leave a bad taste in customers' mouths after they just stuffed them with delicious food!

XHgOkYAC66gWO5IUskkRvg.text: What an incredible experience!! First off, Charlie was an awesome server - I highly recommend you get him! He makes you feel comfortable and you will laugh A LOT!   Upon arrival you'll sign a waiver saying you won't run around, use electronics and don't have any allergies. You'll lock up your phone and purse and be escorted to a room to help your eyes adjust and get instructions. You'll be escorted "conga line" style to your table where you'll await your seven course meal! While this meal is all plant based, you won't miss the meat! Your server will guide you verbally through what to expect on your plate and how to eat it - and yes, you will use your hands to eat! The plates were unique and matched the dishes perfectly. The desert courses were my favorite! You don't find out what you're eating until check out when you can see a menu. I left incredibly full and there was even a plate I only ate 1/2 of! Overall the food was good - there was only one course I found to lack flavor. The dishes range in complexity of eating, but the challenge is half the fun. You learn to trust your senses and they guide you through your meal!  This is for the truly adventurous! It was an incredible experience trying to guess the ingredient from smell, taste and texture! The roses at the end of the meal were the perfect touch.

21Zg_O5q8zXya40OhKebNQ.text: So just have to give a little review of the Black Out Dining experience we had last night in Vegas. For those looking for a unique experience - I highly recommend it!  Some things to know: you eat in pitch dark - that means u will be using your hands to "feel" the food a bit so expect to potentially get a little messier than usual while eating (they have large plastic bins you can wear which my sister and I wore to make sure our clothes didn't get messy.   It is a Vegan restaurant (the carnivore in me was a little hesitant on this part), but everything did taste good and was filling by the time we were done!  Our waitress, Rebecca, was awesome! She led us to our table, explained where everything was and what to expect with each dish (and provided some nice convo).    The food tastes very good and they were adaptable to allergies and food preferences.  Their signature cocktails and shots were also tasty!!!  Dining in the dark was definitely a unique experience.  It was fun to see how much we relied on our sense of sight, as well as how to adapt using our other senses when sight wasn't there (the most difficult/fun moments were when My sis and I tried to taste each other's drink/etc and we had to "find" each other's cup/etc).   We opted for the 7 course option and it truly didn't disappoint!  If u are in Vegas please Che k out this awesome family-owned unique dining experience!!!

x3bH2PgrYF88b6o7mzZ0Ww.text: Unique experience, overpriced, poor service with front desk and management:  I made a reservation for 12 guests for July 11th. On the call, I referenced a current Groupon they were offering and asked if we should each purchase the groupon or if they would be able to price match as this saves them money (groupon takes a fee for sales). The hostess on the phone said they would honor the Groupon pricing and she would put notes on the profile.   On the day of our reservation we signed the waivers, got checked in and was lead into the darkness! It is a very unique and fun experience and the food is definitely notable, especially considering it's all plant based. This was until my boyfriend pulled something long and stringy out of his mouth. He didn't say anything at the table but squeezed my hand and had me feel it as well. It felt like a hair but he insisted on holding onto it until we got into the light.   After the experience, we all went to check out. I went up to the hostess to ensure the Groupon price would be honored and she said she didn't see any notes. She wanted to know who I spoke to, however I couldn't recall. I asked if she could see who made the reservation. She was pretty rude and so I suggested everyone could get on their phones and purchase the Groupon now. Not showing any sympathy or understanding she responded you have to do that 24 hours prior. This went back and forth for a little bit before she called out a manager (who was also our server?) The stupid thing, is that the Groupon only saved each person $7.00. Why they didn't just honor it and insisted on turning a good evening into a trying experience is beyond me.  The manager came out and said they could honor the pricing. The total discount for the entire group of 12 for $84.00. The hostess discounted the first 2 people that checked out $84 each. It wasn't until the 3rd group she checked out that she noticed the mistake. The manager then had to come back out and said she would be fixing the credit cards in the morning.   So the whole check out process takes a good amount of time and you have to claim your alcoholic beverages when you check out. Why the waiter can't assign the drinks to the checks, not sure?? We get to the end and the hostess is (with attitude) saying there is an unclaimed tequila shot. No one is claiming it, so my boyfriend pays another $15.00.   By the time we get home, my boyfriend is extremely irritated with the situation as we recap the evening and he decided to write an email explaining our experience. He ended the email asking for a phone call. He also asked that no changes to the credit card should be made without our approval.   In response, he received a generic email apologizing, saying they would look into the situation. The email wasn't even signed with the sender. My boyfriend responded, again, asking for a call. To this day, nothing. We gave them 3 chances to try to resolve.   The following day I got an email from Capitol One asking if I had left a 46% tip. What??? Upon opening the email, I was able to see that they took the difference that I owed them (hostess mistake) $73.00 and added it to THE TIP LINE.   And by the way, it was a hair. A long curly hair stuffed into the beef Wellington.    Unfortunate that this review would have never had to be posted if we received a call from the establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tip they added for themselves the following day.

fYMIo3GWufXSQzQMJN-6MQ.text: Okay first of all we did this for my 30th birthday and I'm not gonna lie to you, Rebecca MADE the experience. Like absolutely, the food was dope as f. But Rebecca made the whole thing awesome. We got sat in the dark in a room that I can't tell you anything about because it was dark as f. So 7 course meal, hella good. We're from the Bay Area in California so I feel like we are spoiled by good food, but I feel like this place was absolutely legit. Plant based?! FRIGGIN YES PLEASE.   But in case you missed my other thoughts about REBECCA, SHES AMAZING! She's a lot of fun and completely worth it.   Overall, I'd say 5/5 would recommend.   And also, Rebecca.

PBapfm8oFEb2Erg5tlnirQ.text: I'm going to start by saying that dining in the dark is an experience. Is it worth the $200+ that I spent for an all vegan meal and no alcoholic drinks, absolutely not. Our server Anthony was awesome and received a very appropriate tip. The food was mediocre at best, many of the plates my wife was unable to eat due to the taste/texture. Within 2 hours, my wife and I both began to exhibit minor signs of food poisoning and had to end our night very short. I definitely advise eating somewhere else. You can have an amazing dinner for that price without the fear of food poisoning.

XM8zpQCRvF8a_0MqHFJvFA.text: The menu is all VEGAN.  Not being able to use cell phones or be distracted with looking around was awesome. Everything was great, except the food.  They try to be vague (about Vegan) on their site and when we asked about it at front desk.  They show you the menu after you eat.  It actually describes things with ".... stuffed with 'meat'....".   Typical vegan mentality of trying convince everyone that their way is better or just as good.  We are from Texas and we love our meat!  All 4 of us thought the food was disgusting.  $300+ would have been much better spent in the same setting with the darkness being used to show people how dinner use to a time for family bonding, not looking at your phone (eating food you prefer and not some Vegan agenda).  We arrived with 2 hours before our show.  We ended up having to rush the last 3 courses and barely made it to our show.

PikhzCLfIS3CyROYBJaXNQ.text: This was such a fun experience!!  At first, we were all a little uncomfortable, because we didn't know what to expect going into a pitch black environment. But, on the other hand, that was the point! To try something new!  Our server, Anthony, made us feel at ease, and was very gracious and enjoyable! The food was all fabulous (I won't tell you what it was, in case yours is something similar).  Six courses of delicious food that we all enjoyed!!  And something we found interesting --- if you know what is in your food ahead of time, you often pass on it because you "don't like a particular ingredient." Or, if you can see the food ahead of time, you pass judgment on it because the "serving is too small" or "that's way too much. I won't be able to finish it!"  We were afforded none of those prejudices. Consequently we ate what was served to us, and tried it without knowing the ingredients, and without being able to see the serving sizes. We enjoyed the entire meal, and later saw the menu and realized there were ingredients we would not ordinarily have chosen, but we actually liked when we just tried them!!  We eat at a lot of restaurants, but this is one of the most amazing experiences we've ever had!! My husband, my mother-in-law, and I all highly recommend this place!!

_XZLHi9rdmhhfV9Rg-meJA.text: So neat! I've been wanting to try this for a while so when I saw their ad in a local coupon book we had to try it! The lobby is super nice and the staff is very friendly and helpful! It was fun walking in the dark to our seats and eating in complete darkness definitely makes you taste more flavors, I felt like I should sit and savor it more since I couldn't see what I was eating and it was a six course menu. We both got the spicy choose as opposed to sweet or savory being the other options. It's all vegan friendly food and tastes delicious!

7VEsnTZvvEt0P9KHJJiukg.text: I highly recommend the experience of eating here. Very welcoming and friendly staff, relaxing music, delicious vegetarian food with the option of vegan. It is an out of body experience to enjoy with great people.

QaFhd60AaaIvfWiEFxR_mg.text: We came here on a Friday night for an early dinner. Not knowing what to expect. We loved it!  Very professional and clean (from what we could see) - completely black inside. Food was amazing - every 6 of the courses. We all loved our food. There were three of us so we got to choose one from each category (spicy, savory and sweet). The wait staff was very professional and didn't hover. I would say their drink selection could be better but all in all I would highly recommend this experience!!

xRtYSXeQc9a6FfRfRl8x7g.text: So amazing! Anthony was our server and he was hilarious and made our experience fun which was pretty cool! The whole thing was an awesome experience!!! :)

kTKYtKeKcyfpAHMDlnvrdA.text: This was a great experience. Food was excellent.  Don't come here expecting the typical dish. This is designed to take you out of your comfort zone and try things you probably wouldn't give a chance if you could see the meal. I'm such a picky eater and it really blew my mind. Come with someone who you enjoy their company. Perfect for foodies. I loved tying to guess what I was eating.

-BlF99PhdLUHDJDnTadoPw.text: We are always looking for fun things to do close to home.  A fun time.  Great food and great atmosphere even though you can't see it!  :)  I would say this is good both small or larger groups or special events.

AJ5SqA4i6xxyJiNHspwPXw.text: Such an awesome, one of a kind experience! We were greeted with incredible staff and wonderful food! The entire set up is very cool, way better overall experience then I expected! Do this, you won't regret it!

35FeQjNE7gCbe4lhUp9c5Q.text: Super fun. The food is amazing. Step outside your comfort zone and try Blackout. You won't be disappointed.

oVwldyPy1edKa-zzoPS-fw.text: Coolest food experience ever! Daniel was a terrific waiter and extremely attentive and fast. Really fun! A definite must try

S3IPrejGIeqy93NKf9__ig.text: What an amazing experience!! The food was incredible and reasonably priced for fine dining! I can't wait to bring more friends and family and try the new menu. :)

CyrkYWa1Oq2aPu-W4PBbrg.text: Loved this place! Cant wait to come back again! Our server Willie was fantastic! Way to much fun! Thank you for such a great time and see you soon!

iyqYTl-1BtvYxcLpjoHefg.text: What an amazing experience!! This was a spur of the moment decision for dinner and I am oh so glad we went!! The food is delightful but even better is the experience, and that is made all the better by the fun-loving staff. They create an environment of fun and make you feel incredibly comfortable in what is,admittedly, an unusual experience. Our waiter, Ken, made us laugh and gave us "tips" and hilariously guided us through the entire experience. He was our eyes and he was an excellent guide!  Try this, you won't regret it!  Worth every penny and a full hour and half of entertainment for our group of 5!  This was dinner and a show of our own making - we will definitely be back and be bringing others.

uBecjdOPn-FDN8JyBaXSXw.text: The food was surprisingly good. They basically gave us a choice of sweet, savory or spicy. It is a 6 course meal, none of which is disclosed to you until the very end. It is so dark in the restaurant that you can't see your hand in front of you, however, all the waiters and waitresses can see you very well. The experience was very interesting because you must rely on your sense of smell and taste to figure out what you are eating. You also don't know if the restaurant is clean or a dump and whether the dishes are clean or not. You are required to leave cell phones, lighters and anything with light outside in the lockers. They reveal the menu to you at the end but it left me wondering if that was really what we ate. Although food was pretty good. The experience is worth a one time try, but the price of eating there is better spent at a high end restaurant like Ruth's Chris where you can see your food and your surroundings. 2 people, we paid more than a couple hundred. Drinks are charged separately from the $65 per person meal. We had 3 beers and 2 glasses of wine.

AYNlzkFxVzXAjlrYqDFdRw.text: My son and I tried this unique dining experience on the first night they opened. I expected to have some mix ups or mistakes, but everything went smoothly.  My son has peanut and tree nut allergies and they were extremely careful with the food. The waiter explained where things were located on the plate and how to eat it.  He didn't give the secret of the food away which left us time to talk about what we thought each item was. It was fantastic to eat without everyone looking at their phone during dinner. I would highly recommend this delicious experience.

pULJeXnWhvhSDWL2-NRgPg.text: We had a wonderful night here yesterday! Willie (who we renamed Willum....) was our waiter and he was phenomenal and absolutely made the experience. Food was fine, but it was really about the experience - and Willum!!!

bemKqhDNEy11IzbGEAla5g.text: The service was amazing, very friendly, and not the fake kind. The food was REALLY good, all 6 portions- there is no meat here (could you imagine all the steak knifes in the dark?!) so stop complaining about the no meat options. Come here with an open mind! A star deduction due to price- although the experience was fun, it wasn't worth price.

qYaTWjqpxnbUdSu0eiwSCw.text: Wow so delicious! It sounded like a neat idea but actually experiencing it as a Valentine's date was super romantic. It forces you to put away your phones and any other distractions and just focus on whoever you brought with you. And the darkness adds an element of intimacy hard to get at restaurants. The food was delicious and mysterious. Its surprisingly difficult to guess what each food is without being able to look at it. At the very end they show you the actual menu and wow so surprised to find I got almost nothing right. They also cater very well to allergies as I am allergic to gluten and they had no problems at all with making sure everything was safe and yummy. Its also a surprisingly large amount of food that starts small and gets larger. And oh that dessert! Epic win. Our server was Victoria and she was very nice and charming. Its a really welcoming vibe the entire way through. Definitely recommend for any romantic dates!

uSsFNBP9JFJvFpjH68THYQ.text: This was a great and unique experience.  Ken our server really made this an awesome night.  He was always attentive without being overbearing and had a calm voice that I found soothing while navigating the dark.  The food was great and the experience was really memorable.

Y0Y0mciQyKpIGOZvs59yWQ.text: The service was amazing!! Anthony was so good to us, made us feel comfortable in the pitch black.. and yes it is COMPLETELY dark. I would definitely recommend this place!

xWEuEoGfSN8RA3iq4C09GQ.text: I've seen dining in the dark restaurants before on tv shows and I always thought it would be so cool to experience. Well, it was definitely a very cool thing, and I'm happy I got the chance to experience it but I don't think I will be back unless there are some changes. When you first get there you check in and sign a waiver. You meet with your server (our server was amazing! I forgot his name but he had a cool mustache!) you get taken behind a curtain and explained what's about to happen. You hold each others shoulders and begin your journey into complete darkness. I wouldn't recommend wearing heels to this place. Your server seats you at your table and explains everything and where all your utensils are. Dinner is a 6 course meal and lunch is 4 courses. My friend and I did the 6 course savory meal. Each course is very small, bite size portions to be exact until you get to the last 2 items. You have no idea what you're eating and they don't tell you until after, but they do ask if you have any guesses. I do have to say, for $60 a person for a 6 course meal, I don't think was worth it at all. The food is insanely small and what you're eating is not expensive food. Another thing I didn't like was the whole menu was vegan, which they do not mention. To my understanding I thought we were gonna be tasting a little bit more expensive unique food, like steaks and seafood. Nope, you're not gonna find any of that here. I don't understand why they ask if anyone is vegan or vegetarian when it doesn't even matter because the whole menu is vegan. They should definitely make that clear because people go in with the impression they're going to be eating a filling 6 course meal. With meat. All in all it's a cool concept. If they were to add non vegan options, make the portions bigger or the price less I think it's gonna work out. But it's vegas, and you can get a hell of a lot more food anywhere around for the amount you're spending. You are paying for the experience though, which was fun.

Q4FmbDk-ZX31xmqPWxqK1w.text: This was an absolutely amazing experience! Was in town for a conference and a group decided to be adventurous and try this out. We were skeptical at first but completely loved it! We all had a blast. Willy was a phenomenal waiter! So funny and made us all feel comfortable getting used to the dark. The first few minutes is a little odd but once you sit down and get accustomed with the table setting your nerves calm right down. Our group laughed so much during this experience. Food was delicious and none of us walked away hungry! Thank you for a wonderful experience!

hooeG_jy89PFACqC_e6nmA.text: The service was great, the food was delicious, and the experience was very cool, but all of this should come with a disclaimer... The fact that they don't tell you what you are eating adds to the mystery, but you will most likely leave hungry and everything is vegan. The price is something I would expect from a master chef's restaurant on the strip and It just wasn't to that level of perfection. With some tweaks and maybe more options this could be a great thing for vegas, but when there is such a limited menu, any allergies or food problems cause you to either lose one of your small six courses or it is no longer as complex or flavorful.

ctC_WN4HI802VFx8i9eKxw.text: Highly recommend!!!  But you have to go in with an open mind. When you first go in there is a briefing room, your server goes over everything, how things are done. They lead you into the back, you have to hang on to each other. The room is pitch black, you can't see anything, not even your hand in front of your face. The server does a great job describing every step and describing the table. It was crazy how acclimated you get, your other senses take over. It is a 6 course surprise meal, we had so much fun trying to figure out what everything was we were eating, and then seeing how wrong we were at the end. Our server, Martha was amazing. The food was great and totally worth the price.

nTcbOHDolzgwCxfAGnWNcA.text: Short review: A unique experience that is WAY overpriced for the food you get.   Long review:  There is no denying that this is a unique concept that is executed well.  This  restaurant is exactly what it says it is.  You get to have a meal in complete darkness.  The staff is very courteous and does an excellent job of welcoming guests, explaining the experience, and guiding you through dinner without hurting yourself or spilling your drinks.  The mood music perfectly complements the pitch black atmosphere as well and to a certain degree it is worth having the experience of trying to eat in complete darkness and figure out what you're tasting.   However, I can't help but feel the darkness helps to perpetuate a fraud.  It was not until after we started reading these reviews that we found out the place is vegan.  That information is never told to you.  I also did not ask about the price and just assumed it would maybe be somewhere in the $50-$80 range per person.  So when we were presented a bill for over $220 (between my wife and I), I was blown away.  I do not mind paying for a meal like that if I'm getting some quality food (like Kobe beef or something).  But again, this was all vegetables.  There is no way that anyone should need to pay that much for a meal consisting of all vegetables. Our main course was, no kidding, a risotto sandwich. At no point were we blown away by any of the dishes in our six-course meal.  Given that this dining experience is supposed to enhance your other senses (especially taste), you would hope that we would have dishes that were a little more inspiring.  We did not. We went with two other friends and all of us wished to go to In and Out burger afterwards.    I cannot help but feel that this place would be far more successful and earn a lot more repeat business if it were honest with its menu and pricing and at least offered a non-vegan option.  Great potential. Mediocre food at best.  Only worth the price if you value the experience over the substance.

lEH8RhTXfr7ZqHxw05yG4Q.text: While I was looking forward to a new dining experience, I hadn't anticipated this one being quite as unique and enjoyable as it was. I'd read a couple of reviews about it after my girlfriend suggest it for my birthday and understood that because you are truly dining in complete darkness, a lot of thought had been put into the menu and the ingredients that make up the 6 courses you'll be served by your night vision goggle clad server. Your 6 courses and their ingredients are purposefully made up of a variety of foods of different textures, flavors, density's and sizes. Before being escorted Conga Line style into the dining room, you'll get to choose one of the 3 flavor genre's that will make up 2 of your 6 courses; savory, spicy or sweet. The other 4 courses are the same for everybody. Your server will then carefully escort your party into the blackness of the dining room and seat you individually., explaining the layout of the table for you because you literally can't see anything. They'll take drink orders (be aware, these are pricey) and bring out your first course. What I found fun about the experience was that I enjoyed every course, and that most of them were relatively complex recipes (no burger or sandwiches) that we'd try to decipher and identify their different ingredients by taste and texture alone. We'd take a bite or two and then discuss what we thought we were eating. For a picky eater or the less adventurous diner, this might not be as fun as it was for us. I enjoyed all of the courses, especially the dessert. Even our conversation felt different because as we talked, all non-verbal cues and feedback were eliminated and you really have to focus on the other persons words. And you may say things you might not otherwise say, if you'd been influenced by those non-verbal cues, such as their facial expressions, while you spoke. Your server continually reminds you, out of courtesy, that they can see everything , while you cannot. They do this because diners often forget that because they've been blind for 60-90 minutes. So don't pick your nose or your butt crack, or do anything else you wouldn't do in the normal light. They'll also tell you which tool to eat with for each course. Such as, "You'll want to use your fork for this course". And they'll tell you where that utensil is with a clock face reference; ie. "At one o'clock is your glass" or "Your fork is at your three o'clock". Overall, it was a great experience and I'd recommend it to any adventurous person who enjoys a new experience.

lB9YeB5etZaknLSIX5rXZg.text: Excellent experience! I got a few of my guesses right but I was very surprised at how well they disguise most of it. Our server Martha was wonderful! They change their menu every few months in order to keep it exciting so I will definitely be back. My husband and I loved it!!!!

ZPW4-kORpaBRTK497E8SNQ.text: This was so much fun! Our server willy was incredible and made the experience even greater. I suggest trying to feed each other, it's pretty hilarious. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the food wasn't that great, especially for the price!

t6CpNtfyiZL3-hhCxvbFFw.text: Loved it! Food was good and had no clue what I  was eating until we walked out. They change the menu every 6 months . Worth the price and great experience

0KXV5uELG2-_70D-T6TpBQ.text: Neat concept, worth at least one visit.  First stop of my vacation last Tuesday.   Chelsea was my server, and she was absolutely perfect. Guided me to the table, and through the course, as visually as words can.  The food was just OK, not spectacular, but it was fun trying to guess wrongly what each course was (except for one small piece of course 2 which was obvious by its shape; it was impossible to hide).  The night vision googles that the servers (need to) wear were a small immersion break - I could sometimes see some faint glows, especially when Chelsea leaned in for the next dish.  All in all, a good experience to have at least once. Then judge for yourself whether to go next time.

j10cD8IcnpRFbb5A7-nNNQ.text: Great experience. When you go in it's pitch black. You think your eyes will readjust but they don't. It was great being able to guess what I was eating and smelling and tasting the food in a new way. As I mentioned to my friends the food didn't feel like food I would've ordered at any restaurant but I guess I need to start exploring food more. The wait staff was amazing and took great care of us. You just need to sit back and enjoy the experience.

3LSx3ZceKn5WgZvv62_YfQ.text: Love Love Love this experience ! I never knew a room could be so dark, it is literally darker than closing your eyes. When we were first seated my brother began to have an anxiety attack, and our server Rosco was quickly able to calm his nerves. By the end of our meal by brother said it was one of the best dining experiences he has ever had. The food was delicious, All 7 courses of it ! Two Desserts ?! That's MY kind of pre-fixe. %100 will return, and I will definitely be requesting Rosco !

Xg0ep3stkKu80ZmwGXagEw.text: Willie our waiter was THE BEST! He made it so much fun.  We had such a great time. We laughed so hard until we cried. Food was good but the atmosphere is what you pay for. The pitch blackness was weird and hard to adjust to at first. But it is an experience I will never forget. Thanks Willie for making us laugh and let us be loud and silly. We had a blast!!

vz2nZB_gg4F0vLL_475ACg.text: This place was such an amazing and unique experience! Dining in complete darkness with a mystery menu, forces you to use all of your other senses to figure out not only what you are eating, but also how to eat it! 7 courses did not disappoint. We had lots of laughs trying to get food into our mouth! Anna was our waitress and she was the sweetest and so helpful! JP was also provided excellent service checking us in and getting us set up. Definitely recommend!

AHU2nM7vMH-gFOC5emcKdQ.text: It was a fun experience and I think everyone should try it once. Not knowing what the food is and trying to guess what it is and where it is was fun. I would rate it higher but the food is not that great. I was in a group of 6 and we all felt the same. You get seven dishes to try I only finished one because it was the only thing that was worth finishing. Afterward I had to stop somewhere to eat a good meal.

MrZZpP8tQUlGsSEiddEPEQ.text: Blackout was a great experience!  We had a group business dinner here, believe that the conversation was actually more productive in the dark.  It was a lot of fun and one of a kind.  The only thing I would add is real meat. But it wasn't a deal breaker, I would go back.  The desert was delicious and a great way to end the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0bixj2QtdVYaKsBwdfbJuA.text: I really wanted try try Blackout, glad we went.  We went at lunchtime and it was perfect. I would eat here again, I loved the experience!  Dining in the dark, awesome!

FsrsYSsuY6S3Y7QQ5SJ8Rw.text: I've always wanted to do a Dining in the Dark experience and finally booked a table at Blackout in Vegas. It was such a great time! Priscilla, the hostess, was friendly, welcoming, and fun, and our server, Kory, was fantastic. He was sweet and funny and really made the experience amazing for us! The food and drinks were fantastic and it was just a really fun, different experience. Highly recommend for something different and really cool.

ElL1n5lBMBMAAEFdzMjLrQ.text: What a fun and one-of-a-kind experience, so glad we were able to try it. The food was great and our waitress was wonderful and helpful. It's a unique idea for a date, as you really focus on the conversation when you can see your hand on front of your face, and not knowing exactly what you'll be putting in your mouth makes your sense even more heightened. Definitely recommend!!

w9ZMxxjpFKiRI7v2JqqnAg.text: This place was incredibly AMAZING! The food- delicious. The atmosphere- spectacular. The waitress/waiter- personable and enjoyable.   This was quite the unique experience and I would recommend to anybody and everybody! Prices were steep but totally worth it! (And it had a vegan menu )

dRnSqkQyVEA64sr83y_d7Q.text: Such a great experience! My boyfriend and I decided to try out blackout for our date night. Our server CORY is AMAZING- he has a great sense of humor that made the entire experience very special.   First they ask you about any few allergy. We get 6 course dinner without knowing what it is exactly. And holy crap that entire place is BLACK and DARK. However, getting rid of that visual input and replying heavily on other senses make the food even better--- we get to smell the food, touch the plate or even the food, and really enjoy the flavors. The one thing I LOVE about is you get to put your phone down and really enjoy the meal. To me I think being on the phone during a meal or a date just makes it meaningless. It is meant to communicate and become closer to the people sitting next to you, and blackout achieved that! Highly recommending this restaurant and if possible, highly recommend CORY to make your experience even better.

_f_-fUzIen5fiRvF-Bj_hg.text: They get a star for the concept and execution, but the food was horrible. We started the meal very excited about the experience but began to lose enthusiasm with each course. Without being able to see the food, you rely on other senses. The textures were horrible.  The first course was fried balls of mush. The "Cheeses" were grainy even for vegan cheese. The zucchini spaghetti was slimey. Nothing tasted fresh or of quality. We had the 7 course meal and still somehow left hungry, only having a bite of each course blindly hoping to find something edible on each plate. The tables are are situated very close together and we could overhear the family next to us complaining to each other and spitting out food in disgust as well. At $80 a plate I really expected higher quality of food.  Oh and Another thing that was interesting was how the bill was itemized. Prices aren't listed nor explained prior to dining. Each plate was technically only  $39 but there is a $40 fee for each person just to sit down making it about $80 a person before drinks are considered. I wouldn't recommend dining here. The concept was neat but when I dining out the food should be enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of BLACKOUT Dining in the Dark - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $40 a person to enter. $39.95 a person for the meal.

5lgT_oVeps8W8lo_Zeh2UQ.text: This is definitely worth experiencing- whether you're a local or just visiting and looking for a unique dining experience.   My partner and I came for dinner for my birthday and I was very impressed by the level of service and attention given- starting from entering the building and being greeted by the friendly and engaging hostess - the restaurant itself feels like fine dining but in a casual atmosphere.  Our server Willy was polite and respectful yet personable and humorous. He offered us comforting advice and gave us a simple run down of how the dinner service would go and it was greatly appreciated.   The walk into the pitch black dining room did make me a bit nervous, but Willy was great about talking to us during the walk to the table to ensure we were safe and able to follow him. Service was fast but not too fast- each course was timed to perfection with just enough time in between courses to chat and discuss the mysterious foods we were eating. It was amazing how the darkness amplified my other senses... smells smelled more robust, tastes were more pronounced, and I could hear EVERYTHING.   I don't want to say much more to spoil it for anyone else - Just go! Blackout Dining is an amazing experience worth checking out!  We will definitely be back again next season for the new menu (;

LURrs18dpb_B5qiXYjXIRw.text: Soooo fun! What an awesome experience. First of all, no cell phone.  Awesome in itself.   Pitch blackness has a way to make you feel all of your other senses. We thought we had superhero hearing. The food was delicious and VERY allergen friendly.   Our server Anthony was the absolute best! As my son would say,  100 thumbs up! We'll be back for a different menu next year.

jWnZA0HjTNJzhL5mEcMEDQ.text: This was so awesome, Ken was the best!!! We had so much fun, and the food was good! Definitely an experience for anyone looking for something new and isn't a picky eater.

fB5QT3D5uMt20S089vzDNg.text: What a fun filled dining experience! Husband and I went on a date night to Blackout and we were very pleased with the experience. Everyone is very friendly and the waiter made us feel very comfortable. It does take some adjusting once you are in the dining area because it's an initial odd feeling being in the complete dark and thinking you are going to eat in the dark but after a few minutes, I settled in. The waiter did a wonderful job of explaining everything and they clearly explain what to feel for once the plates of food start coming out and make it easy to navigate through the process. The food was really good and good portions so even though it's pricey it feels worth it. You will definitely be full and satisfied upon leaving. It's a really interesting experience that everyone should try!

zFGi4R9dSl3Asoa0UQ_g7g.text: Have been really anxious to check out this place and finally had an opportunity to this past weekend.   We walked in and were greeted by very nice front desk staff. They explained what we should expect from the dining experience and what to do with our electronics and had us sign waivers.   We were then greeted by our server who would walk us in and get us seated. My wife was a little nervous about being in the dark so the server seated us near an exit sign for some illumination.   The service was great and I have no complaints about it. The food was quite good. My one complaint was that the first course, which was supposed to be warm, was lukewarm at best. (I won't spoil the surprise of any of the dishes)   My other complaint was that although it was a unique experience I feel it was a bit overpriced. I wish we could go do this more often but at nearly $170 for 2 (no alcohol), it's not very affordable. If they used pricey meats or protein sources, maybe I'd be a little more understanding but this wasn't the case. These prices are in line with the top restaurants in the city and you don't really go here for that type of formal experience that should come at that cost.   So definitely give it a shot if you've never experienced anything like this before. It's really cool. But expect to dig deep in your pockets.

Ona0cYrwXtEIz_w9NIQ2lQ.text: The experience was out of this world amazing. From the perfectly friendly and fun server Rosco. To the first initial plunge into darkness, robbing me of my most valuable sense. This dark endeavour was guided with care and a smile on everyone's face by a pure professional of his craft. The food was mind blowing every single bite from the very start to end, throwing me through a loop the whole time. Thank you so much!

nkw15PiL12hJUlHvno3vJQ.text: What an experience!! The gist..you enjoy a 6-course dinner entirely in the dark.  Due to the lack of your sight, your other senses are heightened.  You're trying to figure out by smell, taste, and touch/texture what you're eating. I can't tell you about the actual menu, but I can tell you everything was delicious! Our waiter, Willie, was great! Very personable, funny and made the experience even better.  The hostess that checked us in and the rest of the staff were great as well. Overall, this was a great experience, something different to do while in Vegas, only about 10 minites off the strip and worth it!!
